loans.name: Buyanhishig

texts.en:
Buyanhishig is 52 years old and a single mother who lives with her 2 children in a ger (traditional nomadic tent) in Bayanhongor province, Mongolia. Her daughter is a university student and her son is local school student. 
Buyanhishig started tailoring traditional costumes by clients' order at home in 2001. She stopped her business and started working at a local market as a saleswoman in 2010. She is now requesting a loan of 500,000 MNT to purchase materials and other inventories to start her tailoring business at home again. She has a goal of opening her store in a local market rented booth since she has experience in the retail business. She is working hard to increase her income to support her 2 children to be raised well.

loans.use: to purchase materials and other inventories to start her tailoring business at home again

loans.name: Lhagvaa

texts.en:
Lhagva is a 54-year-old woman who lives alone in a ger (Mongolian yurt) in Zavhan province, Mongolia. Her husband passed away recently and her child married and moved to Ulaanbaatar. 
Lhagva started her organic vegetable growing and sales business in 1999 with her husband. She owns 0.5 acres of land and plants a variety of vegetables. She has regular customers and also is planning to open a flower shop in the near future. 
She is a hardworking, neat, and enthusiastic woman who is now requesting loan of 800,000 MNT to purchase special seed-breeding vegetables for next year's planting.

loans.use: to purchase special seed-breeding vegetables for next year's planting

loans.name: Marivic

texts.en:
This is Marivic. She previously accessed an 8,000 PHP loan that she used to purchase more quantities and varieties of grocery items and products needed in her business. Her earnings were a big help for her children’s education and in her personal, household, and business expenditures.
 
She would like to apply for another 12,000 PHP loan for her to buy groceries, toiletries, beverages and other products to add in her inventory. The more items displayed at the store the better. More items to sell will result in better profit. Her profits from business will definitely help sustain her family’s daily needs and children’s education expenses. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

Marivic hopes that her business will last longer and dreams to have a better living. She meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her life and business every week, and this is where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship and the Word of God she studies.

All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for grocery items, toiletries and beverages needed in her business.

loans.name: Lilian

texts.en:
Lilian is very thankful for the financial assistance extended to her. She was able to buy additional supplies for her direct selling business. Her loan is also helpful in the education of her children. Aside from her direct selling business, she also has a tailoring business and sells dried fish for additional income. Her income from her businesses support her everyday household expenditures.
 
She would like to apply for another 30,000 PHP loan for her to buy additional supplies of raw materials like fabric, cloth, thread, needles and other materials needed in her tailoring business. Her profits from the business will definitely help her to sustain her daily needs and her children’s education. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

Lilian hopes to be more successful in her business and dreams to give her children a good life and education. She meets with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her life and business every week and draws strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to pay for fabric, cloth, thread, needles and other materials needed in her business.

loans.name: Margaret

texts.en:
Margaret is a farmer who hails from Murang'a in Central Kenya along the outskirts of Nairobi.  She has carried out farming for 8 years, her main produce for income being milk, eggs, tea, and other crops.  She loves farming because of the output she gets out of it.
Margaret chose Juhudi Kilimo because they have a low interest rate on their loans.  During the training, she learned that she should develop a lifestyle of saving.  This loan will enable her to purchase poultry which will help to boost up her income.  This will bring an improvement to her family's living standards.

loans.use: to purchase poultry.

loans.name: Manuel Antonio

texts.es: Manuel tiene 32 años de edad,  casado y padre de dos hijos. Originario de la ciudad de Teustepe. Es de oficio comerciante, dedicado a la pulpería y venta de pollo. Hace 19 meses empezó su negocio con la ayuda de su hermana. Anteriormente vendía queso y crema pero quería enfocarse en un negocio más fijo,  lo cual con mucho esfuerzo ha trabajado en  su pulpería y venta de pollo de manera independiente. Su meta próxima es ahorrar  para comprar una moto y mejorar su casa. Solicita el crédito para comprar: pollo al por mayor, jabón, arroz, entre otros. Con el fin de cumplir con la demanda de los clientes. Estima que el crédito le ayudará satisfacer las necesidades de los clientes, que le permitiría obtener más ingresos y crecer cada vez más su negocio. Su plan futuro es seguir vendiendo pollos en su misma pulpería para incrementar aún más su negocio.
texts.en:
Manuel, 32, is married and has two children. He was born in the city of Teustepe. He is a merchant and has a small grocery shop and sells chicken. He opened his business 19 months ago with his sister's help. Before that he sold cheese and cream, but he wanted a more established business. With hard work, he has run his own business selling groceries and chicken.

His next goal is to save money to buy a motorcycle and to renovate his house. He has applied for a loan to buy wholesale chicken, soap, rice, and more to meet customer demand. He believes the loan will help him satisfy his customers' needs, earn more, and increase business. He plans to keep selling chicken in his store to grow his business.

loans.use: to buy wholesale chicken, soap, rice, and more.

loans.name: Mirna Consuelo

texts.es: Mirna de 51 años de edad vive en casa propia con su hija de 24 años de edad quien trabaja y le ayuda en los gastos del hogar, Doña Mirna se dedica a la venta de medicina natural, en el mercado que se encuentra cerca de su lugar de residencia, posee mucha clientela por la calidad de sus productos y por los buenos precios, Mirna esta solicitando un crédito para la compra de medicina natural por mayor y poder seguir con su negocio, para poder terne una mejor calidad de vida junto con su hija.
texts.en: Mirna, 51, lives in her own house with her 24-year-old daughter, who works and helps her pay household expenses. Mirna sells natural medicines in a nearby market and has a good customer base because she offers quality products and good prices. Mirna has applied for a loan to buy wholesale natural medicines to keep her business going and to share a better standard of living with her daughter.

loans.use: to buy wholesale natural medicines.

loans.name: Rosmery

texts.es: La Señora Rosmery  sigue con la misma actividad de la venta de productos de su primera necesidad en su tienda de barrio, cuenta que le fue muy bien con el anterior crédito ya que lo utilizo en la compra de mercadería,  ya que surtió su tienda que cada día está más surtida gracias a los créditos de Kiva , en esta ocasión solicita el crédito para la compra de mercadería como abarrotes por mayor como arroz, azúcar y fideos  y así seguir mejorando su negocio y por ende sus ingresos económicos.
texts.en: Rosmery is still selling basic household items in her neighborhood store. She used the previous loan to buy merchandise to stock her shop, which has more inventory each day thanks to Kiva loans. She has applied for a loan to buy groceries like rice, sugar, and noodles at wholesale so that she can keep growing her business and income.

loans.use: to buy groceries like rice, sugar, and noodles at wholesale.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy construction and insulation supplies to finish his family's house

loans.name: Juanito

texts.en:
Juanito operates a food-vending business in the local community to earn a living. He has done it for six years with the help of his wife, earning well enough that he was able to provide for the needs of his family. His previous loan from GDMPC Micro-Credit that he used in his business was successfully repaid. 

Currently, he borrowed a new loan to purchase raw ingredients to cook and sell. He plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve the general living conditions of his family.

loans.use: to purchase raw ingredients to cook and sell.

loans.name: Grace

texts.en:
Grace is a hardworking and enterprising woman. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food.

For the past two years, she has operated a clothes-selling business, selling second-hand clothes for both men and women. She cites stiff competition as her major challenge in the business. 

Grace is requesting 40,000 Kenyan shillings to purchase bales of clothes for resale. She dreams of expanding to a wholesale shop in the near future.

loans.use: to purchase bales of clothes for resale.

loans.name: Peter

texts.en: Peter's previous loan improved his living standards and enabled him to expand his business and earn a higher income. He is requesting another loan from Yehu for 20,000 KES, which he will use to purchase cloth materials and sewing threads for his business.

loans.use: to purchase cloth materials and threads for his business

loans.name: Tunzala

texts.en:
Tunzala works as a cleaner at the school. To provide for the family, she began an agricultural business together with her husband 12 years ago. They are engaged in selling vegetables, poultry and eggs.

Tunzala is the mother of four children. One of them is in need of medical assistance. Tunzala wants to cure their child and doesn't want to wait until the family budget is not as weak. She is able to pay the loan.

loans.use: To cover the treatment at a clinic for one of her children.

loans.name: Elena

texts.en:
Elena is 50 years old, married and a resident of Lower Salug Daku, Mahayag, Zamboanga del Sur, Philippines. She earns a living through farming. She has been 30 years in this business.

Elena has been a member of PMPC for four years and enjoys the privileges of being a member of the Cooperative. Now, she is applying a loan of 10,000 PHP [Philippines pesos] to buy farming supplies such as fertilizer, yellow corn, megaton and marcial.

Elena deeply wishes to maintain as a member in good standing with PMPC.

loans.use: To buy farming supplies such as fertilizer, yellow corn, megaton and marcial.

loans.name: Huda

texts.en:
Huda is a 36-year-old married woman from Gaza city. She lives with her husband and three kids; two sons and one daughter, all of them are under 18 years old. Huda's husband works as an employee at a local firm. Huda also works to help her husband with part of the family expenses. Huda works as a project controller, and most of her time she goes to the sites.
 
Huda requested a USD loan from FATEN. This loan will help her buy a new laptop for her work. by taking this loan, Huda will be able to do her work in a more efficient way.
 
Huda appears in the photo.

loans.use: to buy a new laptop for her work.

loans.name: Julieta

texts.en:
Julieta is from Miligan, Molave, Zamboanga del Sur, Philippines. She  is 43 years old and is married with eight kids. 

In 2008, Julieta applied for her membership with PMPC. Hearing of all the benefits, she never hesitated to become one. She maintains the status of being a member in good standing and repays in a timely manner.

Recently, Julieta is asking for financial assistance of 3,000 PHP [Philippines pesos] to buy two piglets and feeds. Through this loan, she hopes to increase her income and be of help in the expansion of her business. She has found assistance for her financial needs through Paglaum Multi Purpose Cooperative, and she is very thankful with all her heart.

loans.use: To buy two piglets and feeds.

loans.name: Hazel

texts.en:
This is Hazel, 33, a resident of Cabrera, Pasay, Philippines. She is married to Renante, and they have children. Together she and her husband manage their household while working. She works hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses.

Hazel operates a sari-sari, or variety store where she sells inexpensive items such as a sachet of shampoo, 5 PHPs-worth of cooking oil or an egg. She buys her stock at wholesale then sells it by piece at retail. She also runs a food stall to make extra money. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of 500 PHP in sales every day.

Hazel is applying for a 20,000 PHP loan through CCT to buy groceries, toiletries and beverages to expand her inventory. She would like a better stall for her business and hopes to own a house and lot for her family.

Locally, all CCT community partners and clients such as Hazel are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of fifteen to thirty community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: To pay for grocery items, toiletries and beverages needed in her business.

loans.name: Martha Rosalina

texts.es:
La Señora Martha es parte del banco comunal Nueva Amistad desde hace 3 años, en este tiempo ha llegado a consolidar la amistad que tiene con todas sus vecinas y compañeras del grupo, le gusta esta forma de crédito por que en cada reunión se encuentran y platican de varios temas de su interés. Vive por la parroquia de Cumbe en Cuenca, es un hermosa lugar gracias a su geografía, es de clima frió, pero de un corazón muy cálido de sus habitantes, su gente es amable y cordial, se dedican en su mayoría a la crianza de animales y a la agricultura, aun mantienen vivas las llamas de su cultura y tradiciones.
La Señora Martha tiene 36 años de edad, está casada y fruto de su unión conyugal ha concebido 3 hijos de 20, 19 y 7 años de edad, su primer hijo trabaja y le ayuda  económicamente, su segundo hijo está estudiando en el colegio y su ultimo hijo se encuentra en una escuelita de la localidad, su esposo es de profesión chofer y labora conduciendo una volqueta, la casa en la que viven es propia.
Doña Martha se dedica a los quehaceres de su casa y no se descuida de su familia, pero también cuenta con su propio negocio el cual es una tienda y un restaurante, tiene estos negocios desde hace 12 años y trabaja de domingo a domingo sin un horario fijo. 
El dinero de su crédito va a invertir en la compra de víveres para ampliar su tienda. Su meta es agrandar más sus negocios.
texts.en:
Martha has been a member of the communal bank Nueva Amistad for three years, during which time she has formed friendships with her neighbors and the other members. She likes this loan situation because at each meeting the members talk about items that interest them. She lives in Cumbe parish in Cuenca, a beautiful place where the temperature is cold but the residents' hearts are warm. Most of the residents raise livestock and farm, and they still maintain their culture and traditions. 

Martha, 36, is married and has three children, 20, 19, and 7, with her husband. Her oldest son works and helps her out financially; her second son is in high school; and her youngest child attends a local school. Her husband drives a dump truck, and they live in their own house.

Martha does the housework and doesn't neglect her family, but she also has had her own business, a store and restaurant, for 12 years. She works a regular schedule every day of the week. She will use the loan to buy groceries to stock her store. Her goal is to grow her businesses.

loans.use: to buy groceries.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more leather and other necessary materials to make boots

loans.name: Francisco Antonio

texts.es: Francisco es un hombre muy luchador de 53 años de edad, casado, su negocio es un taller de sastrería que tiene ubicado en su domicilio, tiene de dedicarse a esta actividad  30 años, sus productos los comercializa en Masaya, Managua y Rivas, actualmente tiene a dos trabajadores particulares que le ayudan en la elaboración de pantalones y camisas. Es cliente de la institución dese hace 3 años, el crédito que está solicitando nuevamente es para la compra de materiales como tela, forro, hilos, zippers, botones, agujas, etc
texts.en:
Francisco is a very determined man who is 53 years old and married. His business is a tailoring shop that is located in his home. Francisco has been in this trade for 30 years. His products are sold in Masaya, Managua, and Rivas. He currently has two hired workers who help with making trousers and shirts.

Francisco has been a client of ADIM for three years. The new loan he is requesting will be used to buy materials such as fabric, lining, thread, zippers, buttons, needles, and other supplies.

loans.use: to buy fabric, lining, thread, zippers, buttons, needles, and other supplies.

loans.name: Zoumana Diarra

texts.fr:
Né vers Décembre 1971 à Dionkoni   (commune de Fakola), ZOUMANA  y  réside avec sa femme et ses  5 enfants dans une famille traditionnelle.
 Mr ZOUMANA  s’est vite intéressé aux activités génératrices de revenus notamment à l’achat  vente des céréales. Il est très sollicité au marché de Fakola et surtout les jours de foire. 
Fort de ses 7 années d’expériences dans le domaine, il collabore avec Soro Yiriwaso pour augmenter  son fonds de commerce afin de satisfaire sa clientèle qui ne cesse de grandir et est à son  troisième prêt, après avoir remboursé le 2 prêts précédents. 
ZOUMANA  compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter des céréales. Il s’approvisionne chez les producteurs de Fakola et environnants et effectue ses ventes au comptant et quelques fois à crédit au marché essentiellement à  des hommes.
ZOUMANA espère réaliser un bénéfice mensuel de 100.000FCFA qui sera utilisé pour  subvenir aux besoins de la famille, rembourser le prêt et réinvestir dans les activités.
texts.en:
Born in December 1971 in Dionkoni (commune of Fakola), Zoumana lives with his wife and five children in a traditional family. Mr. Zoumana was early on  interested in income-generating activities such as the purchase and sale of cereals. There is great demand at the market and especially on Fakola fair days.

With over 7 years of experience in the field, he collaborates with Soro Yiriwaso to increase his capital in order to meet the demand of his ever growing customers. This is his third loan, after having reimbursed the two previous loans.

Zoumana intends to use his loan to buy grain. He buys from producers in Fakola and its surroundings.  He sells his goods at the market primarily to men, for cash and sometimes on credit.

Zoumana hopes to make a monthly profit of 100.000 FCFA that will be used to provide for the family, repay the loan and reinvest in the business.

loans.use: to buy cereals

loans.name: Erlinda

texts.en:
Erlinda is 59 years old and lives in Culo, Molave in Zamboanga Del Sur province. She is married with four children. She runs a sari-sari, or small retail shop and earns approximately 5,000 PHP each month.

Erlinda has been a member of PMPC for four years. She is applying for a 20,000 PHP loan to buy more stock such as soft drinks, cookies and bread for her shop. She hopes to improve her sari-sari and make it into a mini-enterprise someday.

loans.use: to buy more stock for her shop

loans.name: Alexander

texts.es: El Señor Alexander es una persona humilde, trabajadora y responsable; tiene esposa y tres hijos pequeños. Estudio hasta el bachillerato pero tiene muchas ganas de superarse, por ello ahora está estudiando contabilidad, pertenece a la OTB naranjales en la cual ocupa un cargo de mucha responsabilidad. Actualmente vive en alquiler, por lo que requiere un crédito de Bs. 10200 para pagar una casa en anticrético ya que mediante esta opción podrá recuperar el dinero invertido.
texts.en:
Sr. Alexander is a humble, hardworking, and responsible individual. He has a wife and three young children. Alexander studied through high school and has plenty of drive to succeed. At the moment, he is studying Accounting and is a member of the Naranjales community organization that is in charge of the budget and expenditures. His position carries a great deal of responsibility.

At the moment, he lives in a rental property, but he would like to request a loan in the amount of 10,200 BOB. This will enable him to acquire a house through an "anticrético" contract, which gives him the option to recoup the money he invested at the end of the rental period.

loans.use: to acquire a house through an "anticrético" rental contract.

loans.name: Solidario Group

texts.es: Este grupo lo forman tres socios emprendedores uno de ellos es Gloddys tiene la edad de 38 años, acompañado, su negocio es el destace de cerdo en pie y venta de nacatamales desde hace 5 años. Está solicitando el crédito para la compra de cerdos en pie, materia prima para los nacatamales como es hojas, mecates, arroz, papa, maíz, achote, naranja agria, etc. Gloribel tiene la edad de 18 años su negocio es la venta de cosméticos de Avon desde hace año y medio en su comunidad, Esvelia tiene la edad de 45 años su negocio es la venta de comida en su domicilio desde hace un año.
texts.en:
This group is made up of three entrepreneurs. Gloddys is 38 years old and has a common-law spouse. He has been butchering pigs and selling tamales for the past five years. He is requesting this loan in order to buy livstock as well as the raw ingredients for the tamales, such as the banana leaves, twine, rice, potatoes, corn, seasoning, bitter oranges, etc. 

Gloribel is 18 years old, and she has been selling Avon cosmetics for a year and a half in her community. 

Esvelia is 45 years old, and she has been selling food from her home for a year.

loans.use: to buy livestock, as well as raw ingredients for making tamales, such as banana leaves, twine, rice, potatoes, corn, seasonings, bitter oranges, etc.

loans.name: Anecita

texts.en:
Anecita joined Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative in the year 2008 and she appreciates the programs, services, and continuous education of the co-op. She is a member in good standing and very active in attending the various programs and services that the Cooperative offers.

She is requesting a loan in the amount of PHP 5,000. This loan is intended to buy additional supplies, such as cement, roof, nail, hallow block, round bar, wood and hardiflex, for house repair.

Anecita dreams of nothing more than to have a happy, healthy life and a safe home.

loans.use: to buy additional supplies, such as cement, roof, nail, hallow block, round bar, wood and hardiflex, for house repair.

loans.name: Leonida

texts.en:
Leonida is 48 years old and lives in Molave Zamboanga del Sur. She is married with 6 children.

Leonida has an "ukay-ukay" (used clothing) business, and earns approximately PHP 50,000 each month doing this type of work. She has requested a loan to pay for bundles of ukay-ukay" to sell.

Leonida has been a member of PMPC for 3 years. In the future, Leonida hopes to improve her business and engage in another business some day.

loans.use: to pay for bundles of "ukay-ukay" (used clothing) to sell.

loans.name: Lelis

texts.es:
Lelis tiene 46 años de edad, vive junto a su esposo en la zona rural del distrito de Nueva Arica, su población se dedica al cultivo de arroz, ciruela, ganadería en general, perteneciendo a la ciudad e Chiclayo, costa norte del Perú.

Desde que se caso se dedica a la crianza y venta de animales de corral, es asi como apoya con los gastos del hogar, su negocio está ubicado en su mismo domicilio, su esposo se dedica a labores en general en la empresa azucarera de la zona.

Ella ha solicitado un préstamo de 2 500 nuevos soles para comprar vestidos y ternos para alquilar para fiestas, y de esta manera generar ingresos adicionales para su familia.
texts.en:
Lelis is 46 years old and lives wither her husband in the rural district of Nueva Arica. Her town is known for growing rice and plums, as well as for raising general livestock. This community is part of the city of Chiclayo, which is on the northern coast of Peru.

Lelis has been raising and selling animals since she got married. This enables her to contribute to the household expenses. Her business is located in her home. Her husband is a general laborer at a sugar processing company in the area.

Lelis is requesting a loan in the amount of 2,500 PEN in order to buy dresses and suits that can be rented out for parties. This will enable her to generate additional income for her family.

loans.use: to buy dresses and suits that can be rented out for parties.

loans.name: Levan

texts.en: Levan is a 30-year-old taxi driver from the town of Rustavi, near the capital of Georgia. He lives with his wife, toddler, mother and brother in their own flat. Levan is the only one who makes money in his household. He works from early morning until late at night serving locals as a taxi driver. Levan purchased his car with credit and is now requesting a Kiva loan to buy another car for his brother, Lasha. Lasha is unemployed at the moment and Levan wishes to employ him in his taxi business. Lasha will then be able to generate income and assist his brother in paying back the loan. He will also help cover their daily expenses. Levan and his family members await your support.

loans.use: to purchase a car for his brother to use as a taxi.

loans.name: Karen

texts.en:
Karen is from Kapan town where he lives with his wife and little son. 
Karen has been involved in providing housing renovation service for many years. Due to his hard work, Karen is already very skilled and receives number of orders during the month. Despite of his young age, Karen is able to manage his family's daily needs and cover basic costs.
 
Now, to be able to work in more efficient way, Karen needs to have some tools and materials. Because of family's costs, it is difficult for him to save money for enlarging his working capital, so he has applied for this loan.

Karen has now been approved for a loan within the framework of a new joint initiative between Kiva and SEF international. The start-up loan program provides business start-up loans with soft conditions to informal businesses that do not have access to credit products.
 
The loan will help Karen purchase tools and materials needed for his work and provide better service to his customers.

loans.use: to pay for materials and tools for providing renovation services.

loans.name: Nuriddin

texts.ru: Нуриддин честный человек. Он родился в 1959 года. Он женат и на воспитании имеет 2 детей. Нуриддин имеет собственный магазин возле своего дома. Он продает продукты питания. Нуриддин продает все необходимые продукты как овощи, фрукты, консервы, мучные изделия, колбасные изделия, напитки и т.п. Его жена помогает ему введению бизнеса. Нуриддин всегда старается обеспечить местных жителей качественными и свежими продуктами питания. Он этим бизнесом занимается уже давно. Старшая дочь Нуриддина учится в Сибирском Государственном Медицинском Университете.  Она учится успешно и получает хорошие оценки. Нуриддин должен оплатить за учебный договор своей дочери. Он запрашивает займ на сумму 2200 долларов США для оплаты учебного договора. Он ждет вашу доброту.
texts.en: Nuridden was born in 1959 and is an honest man. He is married, with two children, and has his own grocery shop near his house. He sells all of the essentials such as vegetables, fruits, canned goods, baked goods, sausages, beverages, etc. His wife helps him run the business. Nuridden has had his shop for a long time and always tries to provide local residents with high quality fresh food. His eldest daughter is studying at the Siberian State Medical University. She is a good student and gets good grades. Nuridden is asking for a loan of $2,200 to pay for her tuition. He awaits your kindness.

loans.use: To pay for his daughter's education

loans.name: Rosa

texts.es: Rosa, de 37 años, está casada con Ronald y juntos tienen 04 hijos con quienes vive en su casa propia. El trabajo de Rosa, consiste en el la venta de articulos de forma ambulatoria en el frontis de un colegio de la localidad.  Entre las cosas que vende, ofrece juguetes, collares, aretes, pulseras y accesorios de vestir sobre todo para las niñas.  Sale a diario en busca de algún colegio para  ofrecer sus buenos y novedosos productos.  Lleva trabajando con ésta actividad por más de 03 años, lo hace sola. Comenta que cuando empezó tuvo muchas dificultades como el no saber como  llegar al cliente, ahora es muy buena en el negocio y día a día se supera más. Le agrada su trabajo por que le deja un  tiempo libre y lo usa como desea. Este será el préstamo número 04 con Kiva, está muy contenta al saber que tiene un respaldo económico para seguir con su inversión.  Por tanto se compromete a ser una socia muy cumplida con sus pagos. Con el monto solicitado 300 nuevos soles, comprará mercadería, entre las cosas que comprar tenemos juguetes, collares, pulseras, entre otros accesorios para su venta.
texts.en:
Rosa is 37 and is married to Ronald. They have 4 children together and live with them in their own home. Rosa runs a travelling business and sells goods in front of a school in her neighbourhood. She sells items such as toys, necklaces, earrings, bracelets and fashion accessories, especially for girls. She goes out each day looking for a school where she can sell her good-quality and novel products. She has been doing this work for over 3 years. She works alone and comments that at first she experienced difficulties such as not knowing how to get customers. Now she is good at her job and is improving daily. She likes her job because it allows her some spare time to use as she wants.

This is Rosa's fourth Kiva loan and she is very happy knowing that she has an economic support to keep her investment going. For this reason, she has promised to be punctual with her loan repayments. She intends to use the loan of 300 soles to buy goods such as toys and accessories like necklaces and bracelets for sale.

loans.use: to buy products such as toys and accessories like necklaces and bracelets for sale.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy livestock from herders and sell them to Ulaanbaatar residents

loans.name: Danny

texts.en: Danny is 43 years of age and widowed. He is raising his family in a rural community, and due to hardship of living, he operates his motorcycle to earn additional income. He aims to earn sufficient income in order to satisfy their necessities and continue sending his children to school. He is asking for a loan of 5,000 PHP to buy spare parts and accessories needed for the maintenance of his motorcycle. He believes that the loan will help him improve his business.

loans.use: to buy spare parts and accessories needed for the maintenance of his motorcycle.

loans.name: Emily

texts.en:
Emily is 24 years old, married, and resident of Lower Salug Daku, Mahayag, Zamboanga del Sur, Philippines. Her husband is a tricycle driver and a farmer. They have one child.  

She became a member last June 2011, and has taken out ten loans. Aside from financial assistance, she was able to generate savings and enjoy the benefits given by the Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative.
 
Now she is applying for 35,000 PHP to buy a motorcycle to use as a public utility vehicle. She aims to own a motorcycle to maximize their income and sustain their financial needs.

loans.use: to buy a motorcycle to use as a public utility vehicle.

loans.name: Naseem

texts.en:
Naseem is a 43-year-old housewife who lives with her husband, two daughters and three sons in Punjab, Pakistan. Since 2007 her husband has had a general store, and he works very hard to meet his family’s needs.

Naseem is applying for a 25,000 PKR loan from KIVA’s partner BRAC Pakistan. With this loan her husband can buy a variety of goods including sugar, rice, ice cream, flour, etc. for his general store. In this way he can satisfy his clients more fully as well as increase his savings for his children’s future.

Naseem and her husband are very hopeful that the loan will be a lucky and productive one for their family.

loans.use: To buy a variety of goods for her and her husband's store

loans.name: Zulfiya

texts.ru:
Зульфия молодая женщина в возрасте 35  лет. В разводе. Имеет четверых детей. Зульфия проживает в Спитаменском районе. Она очень любит свой родной район и ценит местных жителей. Зульфия по жизни очень спокойный, терпеливый человек. Из-за непонимание в семье она с мужем рассталась. Но не смотря на своё несчастье Зульфия продолжает жить не сдаваясь, преодолевая все жизненные препятствия ради своих очаровательных детей. Она со всеми силами трудиться, работает на двух местах. Стараясь обеспечить детей, чтобы дети не в чем не нуждались, чтобы жили как и все другие семьи. 
Зульфия вот уже семь лет работает на рынке, она продает продукты питания. Зульфия свой бизнес начинала с одной лавки, со временем Удача начала улыбаться ей и  постепенно улучшалась её деятельность. На сегодняшней день ее бизнес идет успешно. А на выходные Зульфия еще подрабатывает в кафе поваром. Она с любовью готовит наши национальные блюда. Но все же основной семейный доход Зулфии заключается в ее бизнесе. Зульфия хочет расширить свой бизнес, умножить ассортимент товара. Для развития своего бизнеса она хочет брать деньги в кредит и подала заявку в МДО "Арванд". Зульфия очень рада и благодарна что и в нашей стране есть такие организации как "Арванд", что всегда в любой момент поддержат таких предпринимателей, и особенно женщин.
texts.en:
Zulfiya is a young woman, 35 years old. She is divorced and has four children. Zulfiya lives in Spitamen. She is very fond of her native region and values the local populace. Zulfiya is a very calm, patient woman. She and her husband split because of a lack of understanding in the family. But despite this unhappiness, Zulfiya lives without ever giving up, overcoming all the obstacles in life for the sake of her lovely children. She works two jobs with all of her might to try to ensure that her children are not in need and can live like any other family. 

Zulfiya has been working in the market selling groceries for seven years now. Zulfiya's business started with one shop, but over time luck began to smile upon her, and she has steadily improved her operation. Currently, her business is doing well. Additionally, on weekends Zulfiya works part-time as a cook in a cafe. She lovingly prepares national dishes. However, the family's main income comes from the business. Zulfiya wants to expand her business by increasing the variety of goods she sells. To develop her business, she wants to take out a loan and has applied for one from MDO Arvand. Zulfiya is very pleased and thankful that in her country there are organizations such as Arvand which support entrepreneurs, especially women.

loans.use: buy food

loans.name: Naear

texts.en:
Naear, a 34-year-old hard-working woman, lives in Pakistan with her husband, son, and 2 daughters. His income is insufficient to meet the family's needs, so Naear is trying to help him fulfill their needs by stitching clothes. She herself is a tailor, and she wants to generate more income by purchasing a new sewing machine. She will extend her business, if she gets a good amount of profit in the future. 

Naear has requested a loan from Kiva's partner, BRAC Pakistan, to purchase one more sewing machine to stitch more dresses and satisfy the needs of her clients more professionally. She hopes, with the help of the loan, to reach her desired net income and be able to save for their future. She dreams of giving her children a quality education.

loans.use: to purchase a sewing machine to stitch more dresses.

loans.name: Evan

texts.en:
Meet Evans who lives in Murang'a area of central Kenya. He is a farmer who has chosen to work with Juhudi Kilimo. He has been farming for 7 years, where he rears poultry and grows tea and other crops. He loves farming because he gets a good income out of it. 

He faces a challenge of getting a good market for his products, and he doesn't know how to market his produce. In the training he received, he learned that micro finances helps small scale farmers carry out economic projects.

Evans said this loan will help him purchase a dairy cow, which will bring in more income because of the milk produced. His family's living standards will definitely improve, and it will add value to his farming project.

loans.use: to purchase a dairy cow.

loans.name: Alba Marisol

texts.es: Alba de 31 años de edad vive en casa propia con su esposo y sus dos hijos de 14 y 4 años de edad, ella se dedica al cultivo de elotes desde hace 4 años, comercializa sus productos en los diferentes mercados que se encuentran cerca de su lugar de residencia, su esposo le ayuda en la siembra,  y con lo que obtienen de sus ventas logran solventar algunos gastos de su hogar, Alba está solicitando un crédito para la compra de abonos, semillas, fertilizantes, controles de plagas, etc. así seguir con sus siembra, para obtener mejores ganancias y poderle dar a su familia una mejor estabilidad económica.
texts.en:
Alba is 31 and lives in her own house with her husband and their two children, aged 14 and 4. She has been growing corn for the last 4 years, and she sells her produce in various markets near her house. Her husband helps her with the sowing. They use the money they make from the sales to cover some of their household costs.

Alba is asking for this loan to buy items such as manure, seeds, fertiliser and pest control to continue planting in order to improve profits and provide her family with better financial stability.

loans.use: to buy manure, seeds, fertilisers, pest control, etc.

loans.name: Bacari

texts.fr:
Monsieur Bacari est un homme marié de 53 ans et père de 3 enfants qui vit avec sa femme et ses enfants dans le quartier Hérémakono Nord de Bougouni. 
Monsieur Bacari est diplômé en hôtellerie, domaine dans lequel il exerce depuis maintenant 20 ans. Avec une telle expérience il maîtrise cette activité. 
Dans le cadre du renforcement de ses activités il décida de contracter  un nouveau prêt pour agrandir davantage son hôtel. Monsieur Bacari est à son 3ème prêt et les 2 autres ont été tous bien remboursés. Avec ce prêt il compte acheter des matériels:  10 chaises, 8 casiers de sucreries et 8 casiers de boisson alcoolisées. Il s’approvisionne à Bamako et à Bougouni. La vente se fait dans son hôtel. Il a aussi des clients qu’il sert en boissons à Yanfolila, Kolondièba et Garalo. 
IL compte réaliser un bénéfice mensuel 50 000 FCFA.
Avec ce bénéfice il remboursera le prêt et améliorer son hôtel et à subvenir à ses besoins.
texts.en:
Mr. Bacari is a 53-year-old married man and the father of three children. He lives with his wife and children in the district of Hérémakono North of Bougouni.

Mr. Bacari received a diploma in Hospitality, an area in which he has worked for 20 years now. With such experience he has mastered this activity.
As part of the strengthening of his activities, he has decided to take out a new loan to further expand his hotel. This is Mr. Bacari’s third loan, the other two were all repaid. With this loan he intends to buy supplies: 10 chairs, 8 crates of sodas and 8 crates of alcoholic beverages. 

He gets his supplies in Bamako and in Bougouni. The sales are made at the hotel. He also provides drinks for clients in Yanfolila, Kolondièba and Garalo.

He expects to realize a monthly profit of 50,000 FCFA. With this profit he will reimburse the loan and improve his hotel and provide for his needs.

loans.use: to buy various items for the hotel

loans.name: Djenebou

texts.fr:
Madame Djenebou est un femme de 54 ans et mère de 9 enfants. Elle vit avec ses enfants dans la  quartier Hérémakono Nord de Bougouni.
Madame Djenebou n’a pas fréquenté  l’école moderne mais pendant des années l’école coranique. Suite au décès de son mari, et avec les enfants sous la main elle était obligé de mener des activités génératrices de revenus pour subvenir aux besoins des enfants. C’est ainsi qu’elle décida de mener les activités d’achat et de vente d’articles divers de boutique  qu’elle apprit auprès de son feu mari. Avec une expérience de plus de 20 ans, elle maîtrise son activité.. Ayant fait la connaissance de Soro Yiriwaso à travers un agent de l’institution, elle intègre le programme de crédit de Soro Yiriwaso. Avec ce nouveau prêt  elle compte acheté 4 sacs du sucre, 3 cartons du thé, 3 cartons de cigarettes et des sachets de bonbons. Elle est à son 5 ème prêt et tous les autres prêts ont été correctement remboursés. Elle s’approvisionne à Bamako capitale de la république du Mali. Sa clientèle est constitué de toutes les catégories sociales.
Avec ce prêt, elle compte réaliser un bénéfice mensuel de 70 000 FCFA. Ces bénéfices vont la permettre d’assurer les dépenses de ses enfants, payer les intérêts du prêt et à agrandir sa boutique.
texts.en: Madame Djenebou is a 54 year old mother of 9. She lives with her children in the Hérémakono quarter in the north of Bougouni. She did not attend a modern school, but attended a Koranic school for years. Following her husband's death, and with children in her care, she was obliged to earn a living in order to see to her family's needs. It is for this reason that she began selling various items from her store, a skill she was taught by her late husband. With over 20 years' experience she is now an expert in her field. She learned about Soro Yiriwaso via one of the organisation's representatives, and entered its credit programme. With this new loan she aims to buy 4 bags of sugar, 3 boxes of tea, 3 boxes of cigarettes and packets of sweets. She is on her fifth loan and all the previous loans have been repaid. She sources her goods from Bamako, the capital of the republic of Mali. Her customer base is made up of many different social strata. With this loan she aims to generate an average monthly revenue of 70,000 FCFA. These profits will enable her to see to her children's needs, to pay  the loan's interest and to expand her store.

loans.use: to purchase various items for her store

loans.name: Stephene

texts.en:
Stephene is a hardworking and enterprising man who lives at the coastal region of Kenya.

For over two years, he has operated a clothes selling business, selling for both men and women. He cites seasonality as his major challenge. He dreams of establishing a boutique in the near future.

With the KES 50,000, he wants to purchase more bales of clothes for his business. He decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost his business.

loans.use: to purchase more bales of clothes for his business.

loans.name: Maureen

texts.en:
Maureen is a married woman with four children, all of whom go to school. She lives in a rental house that has electricity but not piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees.

For the past three years, she has operated a business selling leso ( women's wrap) cloths. She faces a major challenge of seasonality in her place of operation. She dreams of expanding to become a big supplier of clothes in the future.

With the KES 20,000, she wants to purchase 40 pieces of leso ( women's wrap) for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase 40 pieces of leso (women's wrap) for resale.

loans.name: Irakli

texts.en: Irakli is 21 years old, married, and lives in Kutaisi city with his wife, mother and brother. His father is the only one who makes money in the household; he works abroad and transfers money to his family members. Irakli and his brother, Guram, are students and need tuition fees. Irakli is a very enthusiastic young man and wishes to be financially independent. He decided to start his own business with the help of a loan. Irakli requested a loan from MFO Credo and the application was approved within the startup program framework that enables inexperienced borrowers to begin new businesses. Irakli owns a commercial space, and with the loan received, he will purchase essential equipment, such as a vacuum cleaner, hoses and power washers, for a car wash. He will provide services to local community members. He hopes the new business will generate income and significantly improve the living conditions of his family while giving him financial stability. With the new income he will also cover his tuition fees in order to receive a good education so he can continue to progress in life. Irakli awaits your support.

loans.use: to start up a car wash.

loans.name: Mussarat

texts.en: Mussarat is a 55 year old woman. She lives in Lahore, Pakistan. She is a responsible mother of 6 children. Her husband is a rickshaw driver by profession. For the past many days his rickshaw has not been working properly, and because of this he is unable to generate any income. He wants to repair it as soon as possible. However, due to a lack of money he finds it difficult to cover the cost of repairing the rickshaw. Therefore Mussarat has requested a loan from Kiva partner BRAC Pakistan to help her husband cover the cost of repairing the rickshaw. This will help him to continue his business. Mussarat is so very thankful to Kiva.

loans.use: to cover the cost of repairing her husband's rickshaw.

loans.name: Shumaila's Group

texts.en: Shumaila is a 29 year old married woman. She is a mother of four children. She adores her family and her husband works very hard so that his family can have a good and respectable life. Her husband owns an un-stitched clothing business which is the only source of income for the family. Presently he needs additional capital for the growth of his business. For that Shumaila, as a member of a two-person lending group, is requesting a loan from Kiva partner BRAC Pakistan for her husband to purchase a variety of clothes to sell so that he can respond quickly to customer needs. With the help of profits he will put aside some savings to pay their electricity and gas bills. Shumaila hopes that the loan will be helpful for her husband's business. She is thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to purchase a variety of clothes for her husband to sell.

loans.name: Barpygul

texts.ru: Барпыгул, 59 лет, замужем, вместе с супругом воспитывают 4 детей. Образование-высшее. На протяжении 38 лет занимается полеводством и животноводством, начав этот бизнес с суммы 5,000 сом (KGS). Ежемесячная прибыль 12,000 сом (KGS). На сегодняшний день она смогла развить животноводческую и полеводческую деятельность. В хозяйстве у нее имеется: 1 дойная корова, 10 овец и 2 теленка, а также имеется земельный надел мерою 3,52 ГА на котором она ежегодно выращивает перец, фасоль и клевер. Супруг помогает по хозяйству. В целях дальнейшего развития своего хозяйства и полеводства Барпыгул обратилась в Микрофинансовый Банк «Бай-Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 75 000 сом (KGS) на покупку коров. Доходы от кредита Барпыгул планирует направить на увеличение поголовья скота, и в будущем Барпыгул хочет женить сына.
texts.en: Barpygul is 59 years old, married, and has raised four children with her husband. She has an advanced degree. She has more than 38 years of experience in farming and livestock, having started this business with only 5,000 KGS. She makes 12,000 KGS a month. Up to now, she has been able to develop both the animal husbandry and the food cultivation aspect of her farm. She has one dairy cow, ten sheep, two calves, and a plot of land measuring 3.52 hectares on which she grows peppers, beans and clover. Her husband helps on the farm. In order to further develop her farm, Barpygul approached the microfinance bank Bai Tushum and Partners for a loan of 75,000 KGS to purchase cows. Barpygul plans use the profit from the loan investment to get more livestock, and in the future Barpygul would like to marry off her son.

loans.use: buy cows

loans.name: Julia

texts.es:
Julia vive en casa de unos falimiares en un acabado de ladrillo y piso de cemento en la zona de Las Lomas de la ciudad de La Paz. El oficio que desempeña es de empleada de limpieza y tambien genera ingresos a través de una movilidad que tiene de transporte de pasajeros.
Julia necesita el crédito para el mantenimiento de su movilidad y así poder mantener sus ingresos y cubrir con los gastos que tiene en su hogar.

El sueño de Julia es poder tener casa propia.
texts.en:
Julia lives at the home of some relatives. The house is made of bricks and has a cement floor. It is located in the District of Las Lomas in the city of La Paz. Julia is employed as a janitor, but she also generates income from a vehicle that is used for transporting passengers.

Julia needs this loan so that she can maintain the vehicle. This will sustain her income so that she can cover her household expenses. Her dream is to have a house of her own.

loans.use: to pay for vehicle maintenance expenses.

loans.name: Maritza Lorena

texts.es: Lorena de 35 años de edad vive en casa propia  con su esposo y sus tres hijos, ella posee una tienda donde vende artículos de primera necesidad, frijoles, leche, huevos, pan, entre otros, tiene 3 años con su negocio y eso le ha regalado experiencia en las ventas que le permite obtener las mejores ganancias, está ubicada en el lugar de su residencia en una localidad muy transitada, es muy reconocida por los vecinos de la zona , se ha hecho de mucha clientela, pues tiene la tienda surtida, ella quiere acrecentar el negocio y realizar una nueva inversión pero necesita de capital por eso solicita un crédito que le permita comprar lo necesario para su tienda, asegura que cancelara la deuda y a la vez confía en que le dará a su familia una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Lorena is 35 years old. She lives with her husband and three children in her own home. Lorena owns a store where she sells household staples such as beans, milk, eggs and bread, among other things. She has had her business for three years, and says that she has gained a lot of sales experience, which helps her to maximize her profits. Lorena’s store is located in her home, which is in a busy area.  She says that she is well-known in the neighborhood, and that she has a lot of customers because she keeps her store well-stocked.

Lorena wants to further invest in her business in order to expand, but she needs capital to do it. She is requesting this loan to buy what she needs for her store. Lorena promises to pay off the loan, and she is confident that the loan will help her to give her family a better quality of life.

loans.use: comprar frijoles, leche, huevos, pan, golosinas, refrescos, etc.

loans.name: Ely

texts.en:
Ely is 59 years old, married and a resident of Tubod, Aloran, Misamis Occidental, Mindanao, Philippines. From her desire to help her husband in raising their family, she engaged in a buy and sell business and she was able to expand it with the help of Paglaum Cooperative. Aside from financial assistance, she was able to generate savings and she enjoys the benefit given by the co-op. She became a member in good standing and has taken out several loans.

Now she is applying for 5,000 PHP to restock inventories for her buy and sell business. In the future, she wants to own a space near the public market where she could display her stocks with convenience. Ely deeply wishes to have adequate income and live life comfortably with her family.

loans.use: to restock inventories for her buy and sell business

loans.name: Eshter

texts.en:
Eshter is married with three school-going children. They live at their own house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees.

Eshter has operated her fruits and vegetable stall business for the past three years. She sells from home to her neighbors. She dreams of establishing a mini-greengrocery in the future.

With the Kshs 15,000 she wants to purchase bales of green vegetables, onions, potatoes and tomatoes for resale. She decided to join Yehu to get financial support.

loans.use: to purchase bales of green vegetables, onions, potatoes and tomatoes for resale.

loans.name: Caroline

texts.en:
Caroline operates a bricks-selling business, selling to her neighbors and town dwellers. In addition she operates a farm produce business to supplement her income. She faces the major challenge of seasonality in her business, and also transportation cost is high. 

She is requesting a loan to purchase two lorries of charcoal to sell. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business, and she appreciates the support.

loans.use: to purchase two lorries of charcoal to sell.

loans.name: Saloiddin

texts.ru: Салоиддину 47 лет. Он начинающий предприниматель в сфере кондитерских изделий. Салоиддин в своем городе Худжанд собирается открыть цех по изготовлению тортов. Он уже нашел подходящее помещение для аренды. Сбережение Салоиддина составляет 1000 долларов. Однако этой суммы не хватает ему, чтобы открыть свой цех. Поэтому Салоиддин обратился за кредитом. Он собирается купить большую духовку и другие принадлежности для изготовления тортов. Ему будут помогать жена и дочь. Это будет его семейным бизнесом. Салоиддин уже договорился с местными кондитерскими магазинами и будет поставлять им свой товар. Сейчас он ждет поддержки, чтобы начать бизнес.
texts.en: Saloiddin is 47 years old. He is an aspiring entrepreneur in the field of confectionery. Saloiddin  is going to open a cake shop in Khujand. He has already found a suitable property to rent. Saloiddin has 1,000 dollars in savings. However, this is not enough for him to open his shop. Therefore, Saloiddin applied for a loan. He's going to buy a large oven and other supplies for making cakes. His wife and daughter will help. This will be a family business. Saloiddin already has an agreement with the local sweets shop, so they will carry his goods. Now he is waiting for financial support to start his business.

loans.use: buy a large oven and other equipment to bake cakes.

loans.name: Aleya

texts.en:
Aleya is a 36-year-old married woman. She is a homemaker. Her husband, Samsul, aged 43 years, is engaged in agriculture. Though Aleya received education up to class III (grade 3), her husband is illiterate and can only sign his name.

Aleya is a mother of one child who studies in class V (grade 5). They live in Dhupguri, which is a small town in Jalpaiguri district. Though the house they live in is their own, it is a kachha house (made of straw and mud) and is in poor condition.

They need a loan so that they can buy seeds and fertilizers for potato cultivation and make a good profit from this business.  They want to become financially successful from this business.

They want to purchase a truck in the future with their profit, for transporting vegetables to the market.

loans.use: to buy potato seeds and fertilizers for cultivating potatoes.

loans.name: Sadia

texts.en:
Sadia is a 37-year-old, hardworking and independent woman. She is living in the area of Lahore, Pakistan, with her husband and four children. Her sons are studying in third standard and her daughter in primary. Her husband is employed in a small firm, but his income is not enough to meet the household expenses. 

A few years ago, Sadia started her own beauty salon. She wants to purchase some more cosmetic products, instruments and plastic furniture for her beauty salon. For that reason, Sadia requested a loan from Kiva partner, BRAC Pakistan.

She will spend her profit amount on the establishment of her salon. She hopes that she will be successful in getting more profit through her salon. Sadia thanks Kiva and their field partner, BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: To buy cosmetic products and plastic furniture for her beauty salon.

loans.name: Shamshod

texts.ru: Шамшод родился в 1994 года. Он считает себя счастливым человеком, потому что он в этом году поступил в Национальный Университет Таджикистана. Шамшод учится по специальности Фармацевта. Он учится упорно и часто посещает библиотеку. Он всегда мечтал работать в сфере медицины и помочь больным людям. Он считает, что в будущем он будет развевать успешно свою профессию, так как Таджикистан очень богатая страна лечебными травами. Он должен оплатить договор первого курса, но не имеет поддержки со стороны своих родителей. Она запрашивает займ на сумму 1000 долларов США для оплаты учебного договора. Он ждет вашу доброту.
texts.en: Shamshod was born in 1994. He considers himself to be a happy man because this year he was accepted to the National University of Tajikistan. Shamshod is a pharmacy major. He studies hard and often visits the library. He has always dreamed of working in the medical field and helping people who are sick. He believes that in the future he will have a successful career since Tajikistan is a country very rich in medicinal herbs. He has to pay his tuition for the first year but does not get any support from his parents. He is asking for a loan of $1,000 to pay tuition. He is awaiting your kindness.

loans.use: pay tuition.

loans.name: Ilhomjon

texts.ru: Илхомжон  молодой человек в возрасте 23 лет. Женат. Имеет прекрасную понимающую  жену. У них семья дружная. Живут они с родителями. Жена Илхомжона не где не работает, домохозяйка. Отец  Илхомжона работает на хлебозаводе пекарем, а мама в столовой. Мама Илхомжона занимается выпечкой, выпекает вкусные мучные изделия. Сам Илхомжон занимается ремонтами квартир. Он мастер по евро ремонту. Его всегда интересовали дизайнерские планы, любит красивые,уютные, хорошо обставленные  квартиры. Он с огромной радостью выполняет свою работу. Вот и настал тот час когда надо немножко потрудиться для своего дома. Он затеял у себя дома ремонт. Илхомжон хочет до наступление холодов закончить свой ремонт,купив строительные материалы. Но для этого у него нет достаточно денежных средств.  Поэтому Илхомжон  обратился в МДО "Арванд" за кредитом. Он надеется на поддержку организации и заранее выражает свою благодарность, обещая быть честным и ответственным клиентом.
texts.en: Ilhomjon is a young man, 23 years old. He is married. He has a wonderful, understanding wife. They have happy family. They live with his parents. Ilhomjon's wife is a housewife. Ilhomjon's father is a baker, and his mother works in a cafeteria. Ilhomjon's mother is a baker, baking delicious pastries. Ilhomjon works remodeling apartments.  He is a master of European-style renovations. He has always been interested in design plans, and loves beautiful, comfortable, well-furnished apartments. He does his work with great joy. Now, though, he needs to do a little work on his own home. He has started renovations. Ilhomjon wants to finish his renovations and buying building materials before the cold sets in. But does not have enough cash to do that. Therefore, Ilhomjon has asked MDO Arvand for a loan. He is hoping for support from the organization and would like to thank them advance, promising to be an honest and responsible client.

loans.use: buy building materials

loans.name: Bat-Oyun

texts.en:
Mr. Bat-Oyun is 28 years old and lives with his wife and a daughter in their ger, a traditional tent house, in Selenge province, Mongolia. His wife currently stays home, taking care of their newborn baby daughter. 

Bat-Oyun was married to his wife in 2005, and they started their business of farming. They produce organic dairy products during the summer and sell to local resorts and local retailers. He has a lot of experience in farming because he has been helping his parents to take care of their livestock since he was a kid. 

He is now requesting a loan of 2,100,000 MNT to build a barn and fence for his farming business.

loans.use: to build a barn and fence for his farming business.

loans.name: Manana

texts.en:
Manana, 53, lives with her grown daughter-in-law and grandchild in Kutaisi city. The source of income for the family is small-sized money transfers from abroad where Manana’s son works. In order to generate monthly income on her own, Manana decided to start up a grocery store near her house, but she found she didn’t have enough money to do so. Unfortunately, Manana was unable to obtain a loan from existing financial institutions as they required business experience and stable income as a precondition to a loan. 

But Manana has now received her loan within the framework of a new joint initiative between Kiva and Credo. This start-up loan program provides start-up and re-startup loans with easy terms for the vulnerable and poor who do not have access to credit products. 

With a loan of 5,000 USD, Manana will purchase stock of basic groceries to start a store. She owns commercial space and Manana will save the rental costs. She and her daughter-in-law will work as salespersons and serve the clients in a friendly way.

Manana is a very determined lady and hopes her project will be lucrative. She awaits your generosity.

loans.use: to purchase stock of basic groceries to start a store

loans.name: Grace

texts.en:
Grace is a married woman with three children, all of whom go to school. This is the reason for her hard work.  She owns a house that has electricity, but not piped water. 

Grace operates a café business, making consumables like rice, tea, beans, and chapatti (flat bread) for sale to passersby and neighbours. She cited seasonality as her major challenge.

With the 25,000 Kenyan shillings, she wants to purchase a stock of goods, maize flour, wheat flour, rice and drinks for her business. 

Her dream is to see her child get a better education and become an important person in the society.

loans.use: to purchase a stock of goods, maize flour, wheat flour, rice and drinks for her business.

loans.name: Uzma

texts.en:
Uzma, aged 38, lives in the area of Lahore, Pakistan. She is the mother of seven children; three of whom go to school. Her husband has been successfully running a restaurant for many years and handling his household's financial conditions. This restaurant has been cherished by Uzma's whole family for many years. Now, he wants to offer more menus to his valuable customers so that he can grow his income.

Uzma is taking out a loan for the restaurant as her husband wants to buy chicken, beef, pulses, bread, butter, yogurt, etc. She is hopeful that taking out this loan will lead to earning more profit and having savings as well.

Uzma thanks Kiva and its field partner, BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: To buy food items such as chicken, beef, pulses, bread, butter, yogurt, etc. to increase restaurant menus.

loans.name: Salama

texts.en:
Salama is married with two children who are not yet in school. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food.

Salama has operated a fish selling business at the market for the past six years, selling to her town dwellers and neighbors. She faces a major challenge of the high cost of purchasing fish especially during cold currents in the deep sea. 

Salama is requesting a loan to purchase bundles of fish, cooking oil and firewood. She decided to join Yehu to access loans at lower cost to improve her business.

loans.use: to purchase bundles of fish, cooking oil and firewood.

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.es: La clienta vive en casa de sus padres, ella posee una tienda desde hace 9 años, con lo que obtiene de sus ventas ayuda en los gastos que sus padres tienen, posee mucha clientela porque tiene muy bien surtida la tienda, la clienta está solicitando un crédito para la compra de granos básicos, refrescos, golosinas, aceite, café, etc. y así poder surtir con mas mercadería y poder seguir ayudando en su casa sin limitaciones algunas.
texts.en:
The client lives in her parents’ house.  She has had a store for nine years.  What she gets from her sales helps with her parents’ expenses.  She has a lot of clientele because her store is very well-stocked.

The client is requesting a loan to buy basic grains, soft drinks, candy, cooking oil, and coffee, etc.  This way she will be able to stock up on more merchandise, and she will be able to continue helping at home without any limitations.

loans.use: to buy basic grains, soft drinks, candy, cooking oil, and coffee, etc.

loans.name: Abed

texts.en:
Abed is a 57-year-old married father of one child. He has been running his convenience store since May of 2011. Abed is a hardworking man who puts much effort into developing and expanding his business in order to answer his increasing customers' needs.

He is acquiring a loan from Kiva partner, Al Majmoua, to increase his business merchandise with dairy products and buy the required display refrigerator. He also sells canned food, chips, sweets, detergents and soft drinks. Abed is working hard so as to expand his store into a large supermarket in the future.

loans.use: To increase his business merchandise with dairy products and buy the required display refrigerator.

loans.name: Hussein

texts.en:
Hussein is a 28-year-old married man with two children who attend primary school. 

Hussein sells various items like kitchen goods and other household items. He has been involved in the retail business for the last year, and he still needs a lot of improvement. He is requesting this loan to purchase more goods, so he would be able to increase his stock. 

His dream is to educate his children and give them the best in their life. Hussein is very grateful to everyone who helps him to achieve success in his business with this loan.

loans.use: to purchase more goods so he will be able to increase his stock.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase necessary materials to produce wooden furniture and Ger parts

loans.name: Baymurot

texts.en:
Baymurot is married with 4 children. Being a responsible father, he works hard every day to generate income so that he can cover his daily costs. He lives with his family in a rural region. He is dedicated to his farming business, started 20 years ago. He grows wheat and cotton. Boymurot has additional income from animal husbandry. 

He would like to develop his business, which is why he is asking for a loan in the amount of 2,500 somoni to purchase mineral fertilizers and seeds for the new planting season. He hopes for your generosity.

loans.use: To buy mineral fertilizers and seeds for the new planting season.

loans.name: Elizabet Lourdes

texts.es: La Señora Elizabet tiene 34 años, tiene dos hijitos de 4 y 2 añitos,  ella se dedica a la venta de productos de primera necesidad,  en  su tienda de barrio,  que se encuentra ubicada en la zona de Villa Adela, también se dedica a la confección de mantas para mujeres de pollera, en su misma tienda, este préstamo es su primera secuencia dentro de la institución, la Señora Elizabet va a usar este préstamo para la compra de tela para la confección de mantas, la Señora Elizabet va a utilizar los beneficios en seguir surtiendo su mercadería  en su tienda y así de esta manera genera más ingresos económicos, ella es una persona emprendedora con ganas de superación se siente feliz por esta oportunidad que le brindan.
texts.en:
Elizabet, age 34, has two small children, ages four and two.  She sells basic needs items at her neighborhood store, which is in the Villa Adela area.  She also makes shawls for indigenous women at her store. 

This loan is her first sequence within the institution.  Elizabet will use this loan to buy fabric to make the shawls.  Elizabet will use the profits to continue stocking her store with merchandise.  This way she will generate more income.  She is an enterprising woman with the desire for self-improvement.  She is happy for this opportunity that is being provided.

loans.use: to buy fabric to make shawls.

loans.name: Ramiro

texts.es: Ramiro es padre de 4 hijos, originario de la ciudad de Teustepe. Es de oficio agricultor, se dedica a la crianza de ganado. Esta agradecida con Kiva y MiCrédito ya que logro mejorar las condiciones del potrero de su ganado. Solicita un nuevo crédito para comprar: semillas, alimento para el ganado, materiales para limpiar el potrero, entre otros. Con el fin de criar el mejor ganado. Estima que este crédito le ayudará mantener su finca en la mejor condición posible y evitar la necesidad de vender algunos animales innecesariamente.
texts.en:
Ramiro has four children.  He is from the city of Teustepe.  He is a farmer, and he raises livestock.  He is grateful to Kiva and MiCrédito because he managed to improve the conditions of the pasture where he keeps his livestock.

He is requesting a new loan to buy seeds, feed for the livestock, and materials to clean the pastures, among others.  He wants to do this in order to raise better livestock.  He believes that this loan will help him keep his farm in the best possible condition and avoid the need to sell any animals unnecessarily.

loans.use: to buy seeds, feed for the livestock, and materials to clean the pastures, among others.

loans.name: Rehema

texts.en:
Rehema is a very hard-working woman who lives in her own house that has neither electricity nor piped water. She is married with two children who go to school. Rehema makes various food such as beans, rice, tea and chapati (flat bread) for sale to passersby and neighbours. She cites seasonality as her major challenge.

With the Kshs 20,000 loan, Rehema wants to purchase food items such as tea leaves, maize flour, wheat flour, cooking oil, sugar and beans. She joined Yehu to get financial support.

loans.use: to purchase food items such as tea leaves, maize flour, wheat flour, cooking oil, sugar and beans.

loans.name: Yeabu

texts.en:
Greetings from Sierra Leone! This is 32-year-old Yeabu from Waterloo in the eastern rural area of Freetown. She is married and blessed with five children. 

Yeabu runs a food stand business at home where she sells rice, onions and cooking seasoning. She has been running this business since 2010 after starting her business to improve her standard of living. She works at the business throughout the week, from morning to night. Yeabu says that the main challenge to her business is that sometimes sales are slow.

Yeabu has requested a loan in order to buy more cooking items like rice, onions and cooking seasoning. The extra income from this loan will allow her to educate her children and increase her business. In the future, she plans to expand her business. She thanks you for your support!

loans.use: to buy more cooking items like rice, onions and cooking seasoning.

loans.name: Nasreen

texts.en:
Nasreen is a 45-year-old married woman, living in the area of Lahore, Pakistan.  She is passing her life with her husband, two sons and two daughters.

Her husband is a very hardworking and honest person; he owns a small restaurant in which he offers different types of delicious foods. She cooks some dishes for the restaurant, and the people like to eat at the restaurant of her husband. 

He has been running his restaurant for many years, and this is the reason most of the chairs, utensils and crockery have broken. This is why he wants to buy new plastic furniture, utensils and crockery, but the major part of his income is spent on household expenses. 

Therefore, Nasreen requested a loan from Kiva’s field partner, BRAC Pakistan, so that her husband could buy plastic furniture, utensils and crockery. 

Nasreen thanks Kiva and appreciates the warmth and support for her.

loans.use: to buy utensils, crockery and plastic furniture for the restaurant.

loans.name: Samina

texts.en:
Samina is a 34-year-old woman who is living in Punjab, Pakistan, with her husband and four children. Her husband runs a wood shop which is the only source of income for their family. All of her sons are very hard-working and help their father in his business a lot. 

Samina has requested a loan from Kiva partner, Brac Pakistan. She will use her portion to help her husband to purchase a woodworking machine and some wood materials for his shop. As they have no other source of income, with the help of this loan, her husband will be able to continue his business and, with the net profit, he will open a new shop for his son.

loans.use: To purchase a woodworking machine and some wood materials for her husband's shop.

loans.name: Jeneba     Z

texts.en:
Greetings from Sierra Leone! This is 39-year-old Jeneba from Waterloo in the eastern rural area of Freetown. She is married and blessed with 4 children. She started in business to take care of her family. 

She runs a food stand business at home, selling rice, onions and cooking seasonings. She has been running this business since 2010. She works at the business throughout the week, from morning to night. Jeneba says that the main challenge to her business is the price of transportation and insufficient finances to expand her business.

Jeneba has requested a loan in order to buy more cooking items, like rice, onions and cooking seasonings. The extra income from this loan will allow her to educate her children and increase her business. In the future, she plans to expand her business. She thanks you for your support!

loans.use: to buy more cooking items, like rice, onions and cooking seasonings.

loans.name: Parveen

texts.en:
Parveen, age 36, is a mother of four children. Her husband owns a tailoring shop in the market, which is the only source of income for the family.  He needs to purchase a tailoring machine and a variety of tailoring material for the shop, including threads, needles, clothing, etc. This is very important for him to continue his work efficiently and professionally. 

However, due to the lack of money, he finds it difficult. Therefore his wife, Parveen, is requesting a loan from Kiva partner, BRAC Pakistan, with the goal of helping her husband. He will purchase the needed things with the help of the loan.  Parveen is feeling happy that she will be able to help her husband with the loan amount. She is thankful to Kiva lenders and to BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to purchase tailoring machine and variety of tailoring material for the shop, including threads, needles, clothing etc

loans.name: Mariama

texts.en:
Meet 22-year-old Mariama from Waterloo in the eastern area of Freetown. She is married with 2 children.  In 2010, Mariama established her cake business. She began her business because she wanted to generate her own source of income. She works at the business from 8:00am until 7:00pm, 7 days per week. She says that the main challenge to her business is insufficient capital to expand her business.

Mariama requires a loan in order to purchase flour, sugar and cooking oil to expand her business. She hopes that the extra income from this loan will allow her to change her standard of living and increase her business. In the future, Mariama plans to expand her business more. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to purchase flour, sugar and cooking oil to expand her business.

loans.name: Alicia

texts.es: Alicia, de 52 años de edad, está casada con Evaristo quien es comerciante, fruto de esa unión tienen 05 hijos con quienes vive en su casa propia. La actividad que realiza Alicia es la venta de comidas rápidas, para eso se instala todos los días en el frontis de su casa, ya que está ubicada en una calle muy transitada. Donde atiende muy amablemente  a sus clientes contando con el apoyo de su pareja quien le apoya en la preparación y atención en sus ratos libres. Le gusta su negocio pues le genera ingresos económicos para solventar los gastos de su hogar y apoyar a su pareja. Por lo contrario, le cansa tener que instalar y desinstalar todos los días su puesto de ventas, pero esa no la desanima y desea continuar trabajando. Además comenta tiene planes de ampliar su espacio para poner más mesas y sillas, así atender a un mayor número de clientes. Este será el préstamo número 08 con Kiva y se siente agradecida por el apoyo financiero que recibe para seguir adelante, además se compromete a pagar sus cuotas de manera puntual. Con el monto solicitado de 1000 nuevos soles lo invertirá en la compra de mesas y sillas, así como ingredientes para la preparación de sus comidas rápidas como papas y pollos en mayor volumen y a menor precio.
texts.en:
Alicia, age 52, is married to Evaristo, a merchant.  They have five children with whom they live in their own house.  Alicia sells fast food.  In order to do so, she sets up every day in the front part of her house.  It is located on a very busy street, and that is where she very kindly tends to her customers.  Her life partner helps her with the preparation and waiting on customers during his free time.

She likes her business because it generates income to pay the household expenses and to support her life partner.  On the other hand, it is tiring to have to set up and take down her sales stand every day.  However, this does not discourage her.  She wishes to continue working.  Also, she says, she has plans to expand her space in order to set up more tables and chairs.  This way she can tend to a greater number of customers.

This will be her eighth loan with Kiva.  She is grateful for the financial support she is receiving in order to get ahead.  She pledges to makes her payments punctually.  She will use the requested 1,000 soles to buy tables and chairs.  She will also buy ingredients like potatoes and chicken in greater volume for a lower price in order to prepare her fast food.

loans.use: to buy tables and chairs for her establishment and ingredients for the food.

loans.name: Martha

texts.en:
Martha is a widowed mother of five children, all of whom attend school. She lives at her own house that has electricity and piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family and school fees.

For the past five years, she has operated a clothes selling business, selling from door to door to her neighbors and passersby. She faces the major challenge of the high cost of transportation. She dreams of expanding and establishing a boutique business in the future. 

With the loan that she is requesting of Kes 15,000, she wants to purchase bales of clothes for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase bales of clothes for resale.

loans.name: Samer

texts.en:
Samer is a hard working youth client from Iraq. He is 23 years old, single, and lives with his family of five members, three of whom are employed.

Samer owns a shop where he sells shoes and handbags for women. He has been working with his brother in this same shop and started running this business for his own since 2013.
