The committee "San Cayetano" is from the city of Santaní, a few kilometers away from the city of Asunción. It is in a mostly rural region, where every one of the members is fighting to improve their lives and make the region where they live improve. 

They all work in agriculture, rearing and selling farm animals. Through this activity they want to help their family, in order to be able to give them what they could not have.

Brigida is one of the members. She is asking for this loan in order to be able to invest it in the purchase of animal feed for her animals. In that way, she will be able to continue working and rearing the animals for sale.

loans.use: to buy animal feed for animals.

loans.name: 23 De Octubre Group

texts.es:
Este grupo está en su ciclo 4 del programa de comité de la fundación paraguaya, donde todas están recibiendo capacitaciones para saber usar sus créditos y conocer como invertirlos.
Una de las integrantes es la Sra. Liliana, quien tiene una despensa bien surtida en su casa y en la que trabaja para mejorar su vida, también se debe destacar el trabajo de las asesoras, quienes hacen un seguimiento permanente de capacitaciones y verificaciones que de alguna manera exigen y al mismo tiempo incentivan a las mujeres a luchar para poder superar la pobreza.
La Sra. Solicita de este crédito para la compra de productos variados para su despensa, como ser carne, verduras, frutas, harina, huevos y demás, lo que le ayudará a concretar su plan de negocio, el cual le ayudará a mejorar sus ingresos.
texts.en:
This group is in its fourth cycle of the committee program of the Paraguayan foundation, where they all are receiving trainings to know how to use their loans and know how to invest them.

One of the group's members is Liliana, who has a well-stocked store in her house, which she works in to improve her life. She also should stress the work of the advisors, who do permanent follow-up work with trainings and verifications, which in some way are demanding and at the same time offer incentives to the women to fight to overcome poverty.

Liliana is requesting this loan for the purchase of various products for her store, including meat, vegetables, fruit, flour, eggs, and more. This will help her to make her work plan more complete, which will help her to improve her income.

loans.use: to buy meat, vegetables, fruit, flour, eggs, and more.

loans.name: Huyen

texts.en:
Huyen is asking for a new loan to buy a range of new products, such as food and beverages, to stock her general store. This loan will help her to meet the needs of her customers better. 

Huyen's previous loan enabled her to improve her business, and offer her customers a greater variety of products. She hopes that her new loan will help her to increase the size of her store and increase sales, which will also help her to improve her living conditions.

loans.use: to buy a range of new products to stock her general store.

loans.name: Ciro Javier

texts.es:
Ciro Javier tiene 42 años de edad, vive en el distrito de Oyotún, su población se dedica al cultivo de arroz, maíz y yucas, comercio de animales menores, a dos horas de la ciudad e Chiclayo, costa norte del Perú.

El brinda servicios de jornalearía, tiene herramientas propias que le facilitan el trabajo agrícola, ha solicitado un préstamo de 500 nuevos soles para comprar una motosierra y de esta manera ofrecer otro servicio, que le generara ingresos adicionales para una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en: Ciro Javier is 42 years old and lives in the District of Oyotún, about two hours from the city of Chiclayo on the northern coast of Peru, where the people work growing rice, corn, and yuca and raise small animales. He works as a laborer, he owns his own tools for agricultural work, and he is requesting 500 nuevos soles to purchase a chainsaw. This way he can offer additional services and generate additional income in order to improve his quality of life.

loans.use: purchase a chainsaw.

loans.name: Ngoc

texts.en:
Ngoc is a 25-year-old married woman. She lives with two children and her husband in Ho Chi Minh City. She and her husband earn money running a business making shoes and slippers to sell.  Ngoc has run this business for ten years.

Ngoc would like a loan to purchase better quality materials such as leather and shoe accessories to make better shoes and slippers. She hopes this will enable her to better meet the needs of her customers and attract additional customers. 

She also hopes that through her loan, she will be able to increase her income and save money for any future difficulties facing her family.

loans.use: to purchase better quality materials to use in making shoes and slippers for her business.

loans.name: Thanh

texts.en:
Thanh is 39 years old and is married. He has a son and lives with his family in Ho Chi Minh City. He and his wife have run a business selling beverages and furniture for 15 years. He intends to use his loan to buy many kinds of beverages products to sell and to buy new furniture to better serve his customers.

He hope his business runs smoothly and will help him to improve his family's living conditions and save money for his child's education.

loans.use: to buy many kinds of beverage products to sell to his customers.

loans.name: Lien

texts.en: Lien lives with her husband and two children in Ho Chi Minh City. She and her husband run an internet café. Lien started this business four years ago. Lien would like to take a loan to expand her current business in order to attract additional customers. With the loan, she will upgrade the computer's system to better serve her customers. Lien hopes that through the loan, her business will generate a higher income and will help her to improve her family's living conditions, as well as enable her to set aside some savings.

loans.use: to upgrade her computer system to better serve her customers.

loans.name: Thuy

texts.en:
Thuy, 45, is married and has one son and two daughters. 

She lives with her family in Ho Chi Minh City. She and her husband earn an income running a metal-working shop. She started this business thirty years ago. She is requesting a loan to expand her business by buying metal materials and tools to increase the production of her shop and better satisfy her customers. She hopes her business runs smoothly and will generate a higher income to assist her in improving her family's living conditions and send her children to school.

loans.use: To buy metal materials and tools

loans.name: Hoa

texts.en:
Hoa is a 54-year-old married woman with a son and two daughters. She lives with her husband and son in Ho Chi Minh City. 

Hoa has been running a food stall for nearly two years. She sells Hue noodles with beef to people in the local community. She intends to take a loan in order to buy a greater quantity and variety of food ingredients to produce more dishes to meet her customers' demand. 

She hopes that through the loan, she will be able to earn more money from her business and save additional amounts for reinvestment.

loans.use: to buy ingredients to make food and sell it at her stall.

loans.name: Sakina

texts.en:
Sakina is 43 years old and the mother of four children. She lives with her children and spouse in Lahore, Pakistan. 
She would like a loan for her husband’s business; he purchases and sells of vehicle tires.  He has grown old and no longer has the same amount of energy. Through this business, he generates income for his family.
He wants to buy more tires to grow his business but he does not have a sufficient amount to make the investment.
Therefore, Sakina contacted Kiva’s field partner BRAC Pakistan and present her humble request for a loan. 
Sakina seems very happy will the prospect of this loans and she thanks Kiva and hopes that the Lenders will takes an active part to support her.

loans.use: to buy tires for resale.

loans.name: Annapurna

texts.en:
Annapurna is a 28-year-old housewife who lives with her husband and children in a small pacca (brick-built) house in the small town of Maynaaguri (in the village of Khagrabari) in the district of Jalpaiguri.  Annapurna and her husband Sanjay, 37 years old, both received a secondary education. Sanjay is engaged in paddy cultivation. Both of their sons go to school in class IV (Grade 4) and class I (Grade 1).

She has applied for a loan to purchase paddy seeds and fertilizers for cultivating paddy on their own land. They hope they will be able to grow products more efficiently.  She has chosen paddy cultivation, as rice is the staple food of the local people and is in great demand in the present market. Annapurna's dream is to use the income for her children's further education and to build a latrine in their house with their profit.

loans.use: To purchase seeds and fertilizers to cultivate paddy

loans.name: Carmen Rosa

texts.es: La señora Carmen tiene 31 años, es casada y tiene tres hijos dependientes, vive en la Ciudad de Monteagudo, donde alquila su cuarto y su tienda, obtuvo el título de confección de ropa deportiva y se dedica a eso. Ahora requiere un crédito de Bs. 20000 para comprar materia prima y dos máquinas, de esta forma lograra aumentar su cantidad de trabajo y por consiguiente obtendrá mayores ingresos para tener mejores condiciones de vida.
texts.en: Carmen is 31 years old, married, and has three dependent children. She lives in the City of Monteagudo, where she rents her room and store. She obtained the qualification of making casual clothing and she works doing that. Now she requires a loan of 20,000 BOB (Bolivian currency) to buy basic materials and two machines. In this way she will achieve increasing her quantity of work and consequently will obtain better income in order to have better life conditions.

loans.use: to buy basic materials and two machines.

loans.name: Rukhsana's Group

texts.en:
Rukhsana belongs to a poor family, living happily with her spouse and five children in the area of Lahore, Pakistan. Her husband is a blacksmith. He manufactures iron accessories for door and windows, which are used in houses. He has been providing door-to-door services to weld the broken accessories.

A few days ago, his welding plant stopped working due to overheating and needs to be replaced.  He wants to buy a new welding plant but he does not have money due to a lot of household expenses. Therefore, Rukhsana requested a loan from BRAC who is an active field partner of Kiva, so that her husband will be able to buy the welding plant for manufacturing iron accessories.
  
Rukhsana thanks Kiva and its field partner BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: To buy new welding equipment

loans.name: Bibirajab

texts.ru: Бибирачаб 48-летняя швея, проживает в районе Файзабад, всего нескольких километрах от столицы. Она замужем, имеет четверых детей. Бибирачаб зарабатывает на жизнь предоставляя услуги швеи. Ее профессия очень востребованная. Каждый день она шьет по два платья. В основном Бибирачаб принимает заказы на шитье национальных женских платьев. За 5 лет своей работы, она приобрела своих постоянных клиенток, которые всегда остаются довольными ее работой. Сейчас Бибирачаб хочет расширить свою деятельность и улучшить условия проживания семьи. Она просит кредит в размере 3000 долларов США. На часть кредита она собирается купить компьютерную швейную машинку, а на оставшуюся сумму провести в доме ремонт, чтобы подготовиться к зиме. Бибирачаб очень надеется, что ее поддержат!
texts.en:
Bibirajab, age 48, works as a seamstress and lives in the Fayzabad district, just a few kilometers away from the capital city.  She is married and the mother of four children.  She makes a living offering sewing services, a profession which is in very high demand.  She sews a couple of dresses every day (mostly traditional Tajik dresses for women).  Since she started in this business five years ago, she has acquired some regular customers who are always pleased with her work.

Bibirajab now wants to expand her activity and improve her family's living conditions, which is the reason why she is taking a loan of 3,000 USD.  She will use her loan, in part, to buy an electronic sewing machine and, with the rest of the money, she will perform some repairs at home, in order to be ready for the winter.  She truly hopes to receive some support!

loans.use: to buy an electronic sewing machine and also to perform some repairs at home.

loans.name: Belashi

texts.en: Belasi, 47 years old, is a homemaker who lives in a small kachha house (made of mud and straw) with her family, which includes two sons, one daughter and her husband, Brojobasi. Her husband is a trader of conch-made bangles (a traditional bangle for Bengalese Hindu women). He is 56 years old and passed VIII standard (Grade 8). Belasi is illiterate and can only sign her name. Their daughter is in class VIII (Grade 8).  One son is a mason. The third child runs a sweetmeat shop. Now she needs to support her family financially. To provide sustenance for her family, she has applied for a loan from BJS. She wants to expand their conch-made bangles business with the loan by purchasing more bangles.  As a mother, she dreams of seeing her daughter have a high education, a higher standard of living and a brighter future.

loans.use: To purchase conch bangles (a traditional bangle) to sell

loans.name: Lela

texts.en: Lela is a 44-year-old married woman. She lives with her husband and two daughters in Samtredia district. Nowadays, the family has no source of income. Lela decided to start her own business and requested a loan. The Start Up program, which is a joint initiative with Kiva and Credo, enables her to get a loan of $400 to begin to trade clothes. She plans to purchase clothes at wholesale prices and then resell in her district at a good price to generate income. The Start Up program will be a great support for the family.

loans.use: to purchase clothes at wholesale prices to resell

loans.name: Gita

texts.en:
Gita is 33 years old and lives in the village of Khashtarak, which is in Tavush region. She is married and she lives with her husband, their children who are twins (two sons) and parents-in-law. Gita has graduated from economical college and now she works at the village municipality. Her husband works at the village school as a teacher, her parents-in-law are also employed. Nevertheless, without farming and agriculture, they cannot earn their family living. On their farm, they have cows, calves, piglets and chickens. They have an orchard full of apple and plum trees. All their farm products they sell at the local wholesale market.

Gita is asking for a loan of 500.000 Armenian drams in order to buy several piglets and some animal fodder for winter.

loans.use: to buy several piglets and animal fodder

loans.name: Zebo

texts.ru:
Зебо 50 лет. Она из района Файзабад. Зебо замужем и имеет детей. Ее муж всегда помогает ей по работе и поддерживает ее во всех ситуациях, за что она его так сильно любит. Зебо владеет маленьким продуктовым магазином. Она много сил и средств вложила, чтобы открыть свой магазин. И для нее он является важным. Зебо целеустремленная и ответственная женщина. Она всегда старается угодить своим покупателям. 
     Зебо хочет расширить ассортимент своих продуктов и привести новые продукты питания и заполнить ими все свои полки. К сожалению чтобы осуществить задуманное Зебо не хватает средств, поэтому она просит ей помочь. Судьба ее магазина для Зебо важен. Она нуждается в Вашей помощи!
texts.en:
Zebo, age 50, is from the Fayzabad district of Tajikistan.  She is married, with a few children.  She loves her husband very much because he always helps her with her work and he supports her in every situation.  Zebo runs a small grocery store.  She invested a lot of efforts and resources in order to open her store, and her small commerce now means a lot to her.  Zebo is an ambitious and responsible woman who always tries her best to please her customers.

Zebo wants to expand her inventory, bring in new food products and replenish all her shelves.  Unfortunately, she doesn't have the necessary means to do so, which is the reason why she is looking for assistance.  The fate of her store is crucial to Zebo.  She needs your help!

loans.use: to buy food products.

loans.name: Heghine

texts.en:
Heghine lives in Vanadzor town with her husband and two children ages 11 and 5. Heghine has already been involved in the retail business for five years. In particular, she sells clothing and dressmaking supplies from her house or by itinerant trade. Heghine is a very enthusiastic and hardworking lady who does her best to help her husband with sustaining the family. Realizing the importance of her retail business for the family, Heghine would like to enlarge it. She has applied for this loan to be able to purchase a new stock of clothing to resell to her clients.

She has now been approved for a loan within the framework of a new joint initiative between Kiva and SEF international. The start-up loan program provides business start-up loans with soft conditions to informal businesses that do not have access to credit products. This loan will be very helpful for Heghine and she hopes for lenders' support.

loans.use: to pay for a new stock of clothing to sell to clients

loans.name: Saleem

texts.en:
Saleem is 48, the mother of four children, living with her spouse and children in the area of Lahore, Pakistan. Her husband is a green grocer by profession, and he has sold fresh vegetables at a shop in a nearby town for many years. Her husband offers seasonal and fresh vegetables to his customers. He has been feeding his family through the generated income from this vegetable shop.

Nowadays, the needs of his family suddenly increased and he does not have other sources to cope with these needs, so he decided to expand his current business. He wants to increase his stock on a daily basis so that he can maximize sales out of the vegetables.

Therefore, Saleem requested a loan from Kiva’s field partner, BRAC Pakistan, so that her husband can buy excess seasonal vegetables. She thanks Kiva and its field partner, BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: To buy seasonal and fresh vegetables to sell.

loans.name: Alexander

texts.ru:
Александр живет и работает в Мелитополе. Он женат, у него есть сын-подросток. Он торгует на крупном местном рынке детской одеждой. У него свое выкупленное торговое место. Опыт работы составляет 10 лет. 
Александру нужна сумма в 21 000 гривен для того, чтобы закупить сезонную детскую одежду на продажу зимой, а именно костюмы, курточки и шапки.
texts.en:
Alexander lives and works in Melitopol.  He is married and has a teenage son.  He works as a market vendor at a large local market, selling children's clothes.  He owns his retail outlet, and has been working in this field for ten years.

Alexander needs 21,000 Hryvnia to buy seasonal children's clothes (particularly coats, jackets and hats) to be sold this winter.

loans.use: to purchase seasonal clothing merchandise

loans.name: Faride Esther

texts.es:
Gracias por apoyar a Faride en su negocio de venta de mercancías variada, porque con su credikiva logró comprar nuevas colecciones de vestidos, que impactaron a su clientela. Sus inventarios aumentaron y así mismo el volumen de sus ventas, generando nuevos ingresos. La imagen del negocio y la calidad  de su vida.
Ella dice a sus finaciadores que “muchas gracias y que espera seguir contando con ellos”. En la actualidad está aplicando a un credikiva, mediante el cual comprará blusas, jeans, ropa elegante y accesorios femeninos, pues llega la temporada en la cual las familias celebran sus fiestas navideñas y de fin de año y con ello esperan lucir elegantes para recibir el año nuevo, haciendo sus compras en el negocio de Faride.
texts.en:
Thank you for supporting Faride in her business selling miscellaneous merchandise. With her Kiva loan she was able to buy new collections of dresses, which made an impact on her customers. Her inventory increased and also the volume of her sales, generating new income and improving the image of her business and her quality of life.

To her lenders, she says "many thanks and that she hopes to be able to continue counting on you." Currently she is asking for a Kiva loan that will be used to buy blouses, jeans, formal wear and women's accessories, since the season of Christmas and New Year celebrations is approaching and people wanting to look elegant will come to shop at Faride's store.

loans.use: to buy blouses, jeans, formal wear and women's accessories.

loans.name: Christine

texts.en:
Christine is a married mother of one child. They live at their own house that has neither electricity nor piped water. 

For years, she has operated a food stall business, selling from home to her neighbors and passersby. She faces a major challenge of price fluctuations in her business. Christine dreams of establishing a wholesale business in the future. 

With the 20,000 Kenyan shillings, she wants to purchase three bundles of wheat flour, cooking fat and sugar. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase three bundles of wheat flour, cooking fat and sugar.

loans.name: Zoraida

texts.es:
Gracias por apoyar a Zoraida en su negocio de confecciones de ropa femenina, porque con su credikiva anterior logró comprar una máquina de coser industrial y materias primas al por mayor  y de contado, e inicó el mejoramiento de su planta física y de su capital de trabajo.  Su productividad mejoró, la calidad de los productos tambien y por consiguiente las utilidades del negocio y sus ingresos.
Ella dice a sus finaciadores: "Muchas gracias,  por ese apoyo , mi negocio ha crecido y las utilidades tambien, espero seguir recibiendolo. "
En la actualidad está aplicando a un credikiva nuevamente, mediante el cual comprará una fileteadora industrial,  una bordadora y materias primas e inusmos como telas hilos adornos. El éxito de esta inversión cosnsiste en que con la fileteadora y la bordadora, aumentará la calidad de las prendas, pues tendran un mejor terminado y con las materias primas e insumos aumentará su producción y esto por si solo vende mucho mas.
texts.en:
Thank you for supporting Zoraida in her business of making women's clothing, because with her previous Kiva loan, she succeeded in buying an industrial sewing machine and raw material in bulk and in cash; and began improvements on her building and her working capital. Her productivity improved along with the quality of her products, and therefore so did her business's profits and her earnings.

She says to her financial backers: "Thank you very much for this support; my business has grown and so have my profits. I hope to continue receiving it."

Currently, she is again applying for a Kiva loan, with which she will purchase an industrial overlock sewing machine, an embroiderer, and raw material and supplies like fabric, thread and adornments. The success of this loan rests on the fact that with the overlock sewing machine and the embroiderer, the quality of her garments will increase, as they will be more finished. With the raw materials and supplies, her production will increase, and with this alone, she will sell much more.

loans.use: to purchase an industrial overlock sewing machine, an embroiderer, and raw material and supplies like fabric, thread and adornments.

loans.name: Gevorg

texts.en:
Gevorg is 22 years old, and he lives in Yerevan city. He lives with his parents and his sister. Gevorg has a higher education and a specialty of economist. Now he works at a private importer company as an operator. Gevorg’s sister is still a student; his mother is housewife; and his father is a businessman. So, Gevorg, together with his father, perfectly provides for their family and provides them with good living conditions. 

Gevorg has a very nice girlfriend, and they have decided to be engaged. Gevorg asks for a loan of 500,000 Armenian drams for the expenses of gifts for his bride and organizing activities for their engagement ceremony.

loans.use: for the purchase of gifts for his bride and organizing activities for their engagement ceremony

loans.name: Julio

texts.es:
Julio tiene 23 años de edad y se dedica a la elaboración y venta de productos fritos, como empanadas, arepas, carimañolas,(amasijos de yuca a los que se les agrega carne, pollo o queso),  que se ofrecen en las horas de la mañana diariamente, mientras las noches vende chuzos de butifarra, chorizo, carne, pollo hamburguesas y otras comidas rápidas. Su oferta de alimentos la inició hace 3 años, cuando llegó a la ciudad de Barranquilla y con su abuela y primos dio curso a la generación independiente de ingresos, apoyándose en esa experiencia familiar emprendedora  que existía.  Él logró comprar un carro de comidas rápidas, y lo instaló donde su tía, ofreciendo perros calientes, hamburguesas, chuzos y empanadas y maíz desgranado combinado con queso y verduras.  Sus ventas de alimentos hoy continúan y las realiza de contado a los habitantes de la comunidad donde habita y tiene su negocio,, mientras sus compras las hace de contado a grandes proveedores, que le ofrecen los mejores precios de oportunidad, para ser competitivo. Su meta más adelante es tener un local propio y posteriormente su propia vivienda, para habitarla con su abuela y no tener que pagar arriendo.  Su mayor desafío es lograr establecerse en un local más comercial, debido que el lugar donde está le trae muchas incomodidades productivas y a su clientela. En la actualidad está aplicando a un credikiva, primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo,  mediante el cual comprará, carnes frías, salsas y una plancha de mayor tamaño para sus asados.  
Julio planea que con esta inversión proveniente de Kiva, pueda dar un sabor ideal a sus alimentos y mejorar la apariencia de su negocio, logrando vender mucho más y ganar mucho más, lo cual se constituye en la razón de éxito de su credikiva.
texts.en:
Julio, 23, has a business making and selling fried food products such as empanadas, corn cakes, and carimañolas (cassava fritters with beef, chicken or cheese), which he offers to his customers every morning. In the evenings he sells colombian butifarra sausages, chorizo, beef, chicken, burgers and other fast foods. 

He started his food business three years ago when he reached the city of Barranquilla, and along with his grandmother and cousins he ​​started to generate an income independently, based on his family's existing entrepreneurial experience. He managed to buy a fast food truck, which was installed at his aunt's place and offered hot dogs, burgers, pies, skewers and corn with cheese and vegetables. His food sales continue today and he sells in cash to the people of the community where he lives and works. He makes cash purchases from large suppliers, which gives him the opportunity to offer competitive prices. 

Julio's goal is to own his own premises and his own home in the future, and to live there with his grandmother and not have to pay rent. His biggest challenge is to move into a more commercial premises, because his current premises has many inconveniences for his clientele. Julio is currently applying for a CrediKiva loan, his first financing with Fundación Mario Santo Domingo. He will use this to purchase cold meats, sauces, and a larger platter for his roasted products. With this investment, Julio plans to give his food a great flavor and improve the appearance of his business to enable him to sell and earn more, which will be a successful use of his CrediKiva.

loans.use: to purchase cold meats, sauces, and a larger platter for his roasted products.

loans.name: Rubina

texts.en:
Rubina is at the age of 48 years, living in the area of Lahore, Pakistan. She is a mother of three children, and a very hardworking and honest lady. She has to do a lot of hard work to run her household. Her husband owns a small shop in which he sells beauty products. He contributes his full income to the household expenses. He always tries to establish his business through offering the latest cosmetic products. Nowadays, the latest cosmetic products introduced in the market are very in demand and costly.

Rubina requested a loan from Kiva’s field partner BRAC Pakistan. She will give the full amount to her husband so that he can buy the latest cosmetic products, such as facial creams, hair dyes, makeover kits, lipsticks, nail polish, etc. She hopes that through this amount, her husband will enhance the business.

Rubina is very thankful to Kiva and its field partner, BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: To buy cosmetic products for resale.

loans.name: Adnan

texts.en:
Adnan is a 31-year-old married man who lives in Taiz, Yemen. He studied up to a bachelor's degree. He has worked very hard for many years to get his family ahead and give them everything they deserve. 

He has a grocery store and it is his main source of income. He started his business three years ago. His business was initially started with limited capital and didn't run well enough to get much profit. His dream is to see his store flourish. 

Due to the current bad situation in Yemen, he has less profit from his enterprise. So, he took a loan of 100,000 Yemeni Rial (YER) from AMB to stock his business with grocery products so that his customers will always find what they need and keep coming back. In the future, he hopes to be able to get his family ahead and give them better opportunities in life.

loans.use: to stock his business with grocery products so that his customers will always find what they need and keep coming back.

loans.name: Shota

texts.en:
Shota is 23 years old and married with two toddler children. He lives in Kutaisi city, West Georgia. Shota's economic activity is his newly started trading business. Specifically, he buys fruits and vegetables in bulk in neighboring villages and sells the products in his city's open market. 

In order to generate more income and develop his business, Shota is requesting a $900 loan. If his loan is financed on the website, Shota will rent a section in the active grocery store and buy stock of merchandise. He will sell fruits and vegetables from the store and serve his customers comfortably. Shota hopes his initiative will be successful and he will improve the standard of living for his family members.

loans.use: to rent a section in the grocery store and sell fruits and vegetables

loans.name: María Erlinda

texts.es:
María de 56 años de edad, es madre de 3 hijos, vive con sus hijos que aunque ya son adultos, ella comenta que requieren de atención , se satisface ver que sus esfuerzos fueron logrados , ya que sus hijos trabajan , algunos son empleados y devengan sus ingresos  de forma honrada y a la vez son un aporte para los gastos del hogar.


María desde muy pequeña, realiza los oficios del hogar, aprendió con su mamá y lo perfecciona cada día, además trabaja en enseñarles a sus hijos para que se desempeñen bien en ese ámbito. 

El préstamo que está solicitando a Fundación Campo, es para realizarse un tratamiento médico, debido a que esta presentando problemas de salud.

La señora manifiesta que su propósito es luchar, que sus hijos puedan seguir , y también tengan esta alternativa en sus proyectos y necesidades a futuro.
texts.en:
Maria is 56 years old and the mother of 3 children.  She lives with her children, even though they are adults now, and says that they need some attention.  She is grad to see that her efforts achieved something since her children work, earn an honest living, and help with the household expenses. 

Maria has been working as a housekeeper since she was very young, having learned from her mother, and she improves every day.  She also teaches her children so that they will work well.

She is asking for a loan, through Fundación Campo, so she can have medical treatments because she is having problems with her health.

This lady says that her purpose in life is to work hard so that her children can continue and have alternatives in their plans and futures.

loans.use: to pay for medical treatments.

loans.name: Tatyana

texts.ru:
Татьяна – из Виноградово. Она работает диспетчером в одном ООО. Работает на этой должности вот уже 5 лет. У Татьяны трое детей, она с мужем живет в своем доме. Более того, у Татьяны дома есть швейная машинка, на которой она подрабатывает. 
Татьяна давно мечтает приобрести домой спальный гарнитур, так как старый диван в ее спальне с мужем совсем износился. Это стоит 5 000 гривен. Пока Татьяна не могла собрать сразу всю сумму целиком, чтобы купить спальню. Поэтому она решила, что средства, полученные от КИВА, помогут ей осуществить свою мечту и постепенно вернуть всю сумму. В будущем Татьяна мечтает открыть магазин по пошиву одежды и работать больше в этом направлении, что получается у нее достаточно хорошо.
texts.en:
Tatyana is from Vinogradovo.  She has been working as a dispatcher in a Ltd. company for the past five years.  She has three children.  She and her husband own their house.  In addition to her job, she also uses a sewing machine, at home, and she makes some money from sewing.

Tatyana has been dreaming about buying some bedroom furniture for her house, as the old sofa the couple uses in their bedroom is now very worn out.  She needs 5,000 Hryvnia for this purchase and, so far, she has not been able to save the whole amount necessary to buy bedroom furniture.  This is why she has decided to make her dream come true by applying for a loan from Kiva, and gradually pay back her loan amount.   

In the future, Tatyana would like to open her own sewing shop and focus more on that type of business, because she is quite good at it.

loans.use: to purchase bedroom furniture for her house.

loans.name: Flor Maria

texts.es:
Flor María tiene 28 años de edad, vive junto a su esposo e hijas en el distrito de Cayalti, su población se dedica al cultivo de arroz, yucas, maíz a dos horas de la ciudad de Chiclayo, costa norte del Perú.

Tienen una pequeña bodeguita en su domicilio, son una familia que se esfuerza mucho por tener una mejor calidad de vida, su esposo trabaja como maestro de construcción en los caseríos aledaños a su comunidad.

Ella ha solicitado un préstamo de 3 000 nuevos soles para comprar abarrotes para abastecer su negocio y de esta manera tener mayores ingresos para su familia.
texts.en:
Flor Maria is 28 years old, and lives together with her husband and daughters in the district of Cayalti, whose population makes a living through the cultivation of rice, yuccas, and corn. Cayalti is two hours from the city of Chiclayo on the northern coast of Peru.

Flor Maria and her husband have a small bodega in their home. They are a family who struggles greatly to have a better quality of life. Her husband works in construction as a master builder in the hamlets that border their community.

She has requested a loan of 3,000 nuevos soles to buy groceries to supply her business and in this way earn more income for her family.

loans.use: to buy groceries to supply her bodega.

loans.name: Nadezhda

texts.ru:
Надежда – из Павлограда. Она торгует в магазине посудой, мелкой бытовой техникой, изделиями из пластмассы. Торговое место у нее арендованное, опыт работы составляет 20 лет. 
Надежда надеется приобрести партию посуды, электрочайники, фены, а также миски, ведра, мыльницы и прочие изделия из пластмассы на сумму в 30 000 гривен для того, чтобы реализовать этот товар и получить дополнительную прибыль. В будущем Надежда надеется расширить ассортимент изделий из дорогой пластмассы, а именно приобрести комоды, наборы для ванных комнат и дорогие зеркала и подключить эти группы товаров к своему ассортименту.
texts.en: Nadezhda is from Pavlograd.  She sells dishware, small consumer electronics and plastic goods at a store.  Her retail outlet is leased, and her work experience is 20 years.  Nadezhda hopes to purchase an inventory of dishware, electric teapots, fans and also bowls, buckets, soap dishes and other plastic goods with 30,000 hryvnia in order to sell this merchandise and make an additional profit.  In the future, Nadezhda hopes to expand the selection of goods made from expensive plastic, specifically dressers, bathroom sets and expensive mirrors, and add these groups of goods to her selection.

loans.use: to purchase additional merchandise for sale

loans.name: Fidel

texts.es: Fidel de 67 años de edad vive en casa de un familiar con su esposa, desde hace varios años posee un vivero donde se dedica al cultivo y venta de diferentes tipos de plantas, su negocio lo tiene ubicado en su lugar de residencia, posee clientela, con lo que obtiene de su negocio logra cubrir los gastos que se le presentan en su hogar,  Fidel está solicitando un crédito para la compra de semillas, abonos, bolsas, tierra negra, etc. para poder seguir con sus cultivos, y obtener mejores ganancias para tener una mejor calidad de vida junto con su esposa.
texts.en: Fidel is 67 years old and lives at home with his wife.  He has had a growing area for several years where he grows and sells different types of plants.  His business is in his home and he has many customers and is able to cover the household expenses with his profits.  He is asking for this loan so he can buy seeds, compost, bags, soil, etc. so he can continue raising plants, improve his income, and have a better quality of life with his wife.

loans.use: to buy supplies.

loans.name: Zinaida

texts.ru:
Зинаида разведена. У нее двое взрослых детей. Зинаида имеет свой бизнес.

На рынке родного города Зинаида торгует мужским трикотажем. У нее большой опыт работы, есть постоянные клиенты. Самыми популярными товарами являются: свитера, джемперы и толстовки. Зинаида  трудолюбивая и вежливая, хочет развивать бизнес.

Зинаида просит предоставить ей кредит в сумме 6000 гривен на закупку сезонного товара- теплых зимних свитеров и шапок.
texts.en: Zinaida is divorced.  She has two grown children.  Zinaida has her own business.  She sells men's knitted goods.  She has a lot of work experience and has regular customers.  The most popular goods are sweaters and vests.   Zinaida  is hardworking and polite and wants to expand her business.  Zinaida is requesting a loan in the amount of 6000 hryvnia to purchase seasonal merchandise - warm winter sweaters and hats.

loans.use: to purchase seasonal merchandise, such as winter sweaters and hats

loans.name: Archagul

texts.ru: Арчагул 38 лет, замужем, вместе с супругом воспитывают 2 детей. У Арчагул - среднее образование, в качестве основного дохода для своей семьи Арчагул занимается животноводством, стартовав 3 года назад, с покупки скота на 10,000 сом KGS. Благодаря упорному труду Арчагул, в ее хозяйстве на сегодняшний день имеется: 2 дойные коровы, 10 овец. Ежемесячный доход составляет 10,000 сом (KGS). В целях дальнейшего развития своего хозяйства, Арчагул обратилась в Микрофинансовый банк «Бай –Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 50,000 сом (KGS) на покупку коровы для увеличения поголовья скота. Доходы от кредита Арчагул планирует вложить в дальнейшее приумножение количества домашней скотины, и планирует накопить средства на дальнейшее обучение детей.
texts.en: Archagul is 38 years old, married and raising two children together with her husband. Archagul has a secondary education. To provide the primary income for her family, Archagul is involved in animal husbandry, having started 3 years ago with a purchase of livestock with 10,000 som (KGS). Thanks to Archagul's hard work, today her business contains 2 dairy cows and 10 sheep.  The monthly income amounts to 10,000 som (KGS). In order to further develop her business, Archagul requested a loan in the amount of 50,000 som (KGS) from the microfinance bank "Bai-Tushum and Partners" to buy a cow to increase livestock headcount. Archagul plans to invest the earnings from the loan into further increasing domestic livestock quantities and saving money for her children's future education.

loans.use: to buy a cow

loans.name: Hanh

texts.en:
Hanh is 48 years old, and is married with one son and one daughter. She lives with her family in Ho Chi Minh City. Her husband is a soldier. 

Hanh supports her family by running a general store in front of her house. She started this business eight years ago. She sells snacks, toys for kids, soft drinks, yoghurt and other household items to people in her community. She is requesting a loan to expand her business by buying a greater variety of products, in particular food and beverages, to stock her store and better satisfy her customers. 

She hopes her business runs smoothly and will generate a higher income to assist her in improving her family's living conditions and send her children to school.

loans.use: to buy a greater variety of products, in particular food and beverages, to stock her store.

loans.name: Oscar

texts.es:
Oscar tiene 21 años, esta terminado el colegio actualmente y trabaja como peluquero, es un joven muy sacrificado.
Él sabe que la única forma de poder salir adelante es capacitándose y estudiando, es por eso que pide este crédito para poder invertirlo en estudiar computación, y así seguir ampliando su conocimiento y crecer como persona.
texts.en:
Oscar is 21 years old. He is currently finishing school and also works as a barber. Oscar is a young man who has made many sacrifices.

He knows that the only way to get ahead is through training and studying. For this reason, he is requesting a loan to invest in the study of computer science. This will allow him to continue expanding his knowledge and to grow as a person.

loans.use: to pay for a computer science course.

loans.name: San Cayetano Group

texts.es:
San Cayetano está en su 7º ciclo del programa de comité de mujeres, donde todas están formando parte del programa de eliminación de pobreza, como un medio de luchar por erradicarla.
Una de las integrantes es la Sra. Cinthia, quien en su  encuesta mostró un nivel de pobreza dentro del nivel uno, es decir con ingresos bajos, pero está esforzándose y luchando por mejorar sus ingresos.  Ella vende cubiertos, y con este trabajo está luchando por mejorar, es una persona muy entusiasta, que trata de dar el ejemplo a sus demás compañeras por medio de su esfuerzo.
Pide este préstamo para poder invertirlo en la compra de cubiertos, como ser tenedores, cucharas y cuchillos para la venta y así seguir con sus ventas, mejorando cada día más.
texts.en:
"San Cayetano" is in its seventh loan cycle with the Women's Committee Program. All of the members are participating in the poverty elimination program, which provides them the means to eradicate this condition.

One of the members is Sra. Cinthia, whose results indicated that she is at a Level 1 poverty stage. In other words, she has very low income. For this reason, she is pushing and striving to improve her earnings. Cinthia sells cutlery and is making the effort to improve in her work. She is an enthusiastic person and is trying to set an example for her fellow group members through her efforts.

Cinthia is requesting a loan so that she can invest in the purchase of cutlery such as forks, spoons, and knives to sell. This will enable her to continue increasing her sales and to keep improving each day.

loans.use: to buy forks, spoons, and knives to sell.

loans.name: Al Azkiyaa Group

texts.en:
Yasmine is the featured borrower of Al Azkiyaa group. She joined with the other group members to acquire a loan from Kiva's partner Al Majmoua, because they have always been neighbors and friends.

Yasmine is pictured on the left wearing blue. She is a 49-year-old single woman who has been working selling clothes for six years. She is acquiring a loan to increase her business merchandise with autumn and winter collections, and in addition to buy necessary Mouneh and diesel for heating during the hard winter season.

She hopes to keep on developing her business and stay in good health to provide better for her three family members, who she is responsible for taking care of.

As for the other group members, Jamila is standing in the middle with the dark blue shirt, and Jamal is the lady at the far right of the picture, wearing pink.

loans.use: to increase her business merchandise with autumn and winter collections, and in addition to buy necessary Mouneh and diesel for heating during the hard winter season.

loans.name: Jeisson Ismael

texts.es: Jeisson es una persona muy trabajadora y luchadora de 21 años de edad, soltero, su negocio es la venta de ropa, perfumes, cosméticos en su comunidad y alrededores de Granada desde hace 6 años. El crédito lo está solicitando para la compra de mercadería como pantalones de damas, de varón, camisas, blusas, cremas faciales, cremas corporales, perfumes de varón, perfumes de damas, tratamiento shampoo, desodorantes, etc.
texts.en: Jeisson is a very hardworking 21 year old man.  He is single and has been selling clothing, perfumes, and cosmetics in his community and around Granada for six years.  He is asking for this loan to buy merchandise such as ladies’ and men’s pants, shirts, blouses, face creams, body creams, men’s and women’s perfumes, treatments, shampoo, deodorant, etc.

loans.use: to buy inventory.

loans.name: Jackline

texts.en:
Jackline operates a vegetable stall business, selling from home to her neighbours and passersby. She faces stiff competition from other vegetable operators in her business.
 
With the KES 50,000, she wants to purchase sacks of tomatoes, potatoes, fruit, and green vegetables to re-sell. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase sacks of tomatoes, potatoes, fruit, and green vegetables to re-sell.

loans.name: Anita

texts.en:
Anita is a widowed woman and has two children. She lives at a rental house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family.

For the past year, Anita has operated a cereal shop business, selling from home to her neighbours and passersby. Her potential customers are neighbours and passersby. She faces a major challenge of seasonality in her business, and she dreams of establishing a wholesale cereals shop in the future. 

With the loan that she is requesting of KES 40,000, she wants to purchase stock of wheat, maize, beans and rice for sale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase stock of wheat, maize, beans and rice to sell.

loans.name: Safia

texts.en:
Safia is 55 years old, and lives with her husband and five children in the area of Lahore, Pakistan.

She wants to make some savings so she can provide better living facilities for her children, but it seems impossible in the absence of a profitable source of income. Her husband has been driving an auto rickshaw for many years, however his income is insufficient to feed his entire family. He has to repair the auto rickshaw body, but he does not have enough money to fix it.
 
Therefore, Safia has requested a loan from Kiva’s field partner BRAC Pakistan so that her husband will be able to buy a new auto rickshaw body. 

She hopes that she will be able to make save enough before her children are married in the future, and that she will succeed in providing higher education to her children.

Safia thanks Kiva and its field partner BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy an auto rickshaw body for her husband.

loans.name: Marte

texts.en:
Marte, who is a mother of eleven children, wants to build a hay barn and for this she needs your financial help. 

“Raising all the children, hasn’t been easy at all and my husband passed away when they were still young. However, older siblings helped in raising the youngest ones,” said Marte. 

Marte lives with her family in northern Albania, and the way she is dressed is very traditional in that part of the country. In addition, the fact that she is a widowed lady, makes her dress in black colored clothing. 

This past year, Marte has been selling baby calves and raw milk at the farmers market of a nearby city. She is planning on expanding her activity; at the moment she has only two dairy cows.

loans.use: to build a hay barn.

loans.name: Leila

texts.en:
Leila is a 57-year-old woman from a small village in Akhmeta district. Leila works at the local school as a history teacher and gets 250 GEL monthly. In addition she has a small vineyard and sells grapes seasonally. 

Leila decided to start her own business and requested a loan. The Start Up program, which is a joint initiative between Kiva and Credo, enables her to get a loan of 2,000 GEL to open a shop. She plans to purchase fruit and vegetables at wholesale prices and then resell them at a good price in her newly opened shop. The Start Up program will be a great support for her.

loans.use: to open a shop selling fruit and vegetables.

loans.name: Zohra

texts.en:
Zohra is a 36-year-old housewife. She lives in Lahore, Pakistan and is the mother of five children. Her husband is a greengrocer by profession; his shop situated in the market, and is the only source of income for the family. He sells seasonal and fresh vegetables.
 
Zohra has requested a loan from Kiva's partner BRAC Pakistan to purchase a variety of seasonal vegetables from the field to sell them in the market at a profitable price. Her dreams are for the higher education of her children. Zohra is very thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy fresh and seasonal vegetables to sell.

loans.name: Huaraypata Group

texts.es:
Los socios pertenecen al banco comunal “HUAYRAYPATA”; Este banco se ubicada en el distrito de Urcos, perteneciente a la provincia de Quispicanchis y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Juana Paula ella es casada y tiene 45 años y tiene 5 hijos; La socia trabaja en su negocio de crianza de animales, la socia cría animales como cuyes y gallinas, ella los hace engordar y crecer y luego los vende en las diferentes ferias, la socia también trabaja en un centro donde cuidan niños, la socia trabaja desde las 8:00 a.m hasta las 5:00 p.m,la socia tiene 8 años en su negocio de crianza de animales, por medio de su trabajo y negocio la socia saca adelante a sus hijos, el sueño de la socia es tener un local donde venda los animales. La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar cuyes y gallinas y alimentos para los animales. 


 
Los otros socios se dedican al negocio de crianza de animales, negocio de agricultura, negocio de tienda de abarrotes y negocio de venta de comida.


La socia agradece a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
These members belong to the Communal Bank "Huayraypata", which is located in the District of Urcos, Quispicanchis Province, Department of Cusco.

One of the members is Sra. Juana Paula. She is 45 years old, married, and has five children. Juana Paula works at her business of raising animals, such as guinea pigs and chickens. She fattens the animals to make them grow and then sells them at different fairs. Juana Paula is also employed at a children's day care center, where she works from 8:00 A.M. to 5:00 P.M. She has been in the business of raising animals for eight years. Through her job and her business, Juana Paula has been able to help her children move forward. Her dream is to have a place where she can sell her animals.

Juana Paula is requesting a loan in order to buy guinea pigs, chickens, and feed for the animals. The other members engage in businesses such as raising animals, farming, managing a grocery store, and selling food. Juana Paula is grateful to those who have helped to fulfill part of her dream in this manner. Therefore, she promises to complete her payments according to the established terms.

loans.use: to buy guinea pigs, chickens, and animal feed.

loans.name: Rosanna

texts.es:
Rosanna tiene 27 años vive con sus padres, ella  trabaja como ayudante de cátedra en la facultad de arquitectura  y a la vez  está preparando su tesis, una vez  que termine su carrera quiere trabajar en su profesión, y asi ayudar a su familia.
Comenta que siempre le gusto la carrera de arquitectura y es por ello que a estudio. Pide este préstamo para poder invertirlo en pago de los gastos de su titulación, ya que tiene muchos gastos que cubrir.
texts.en:
Rosanna is 27 years old and lives with her parents. She works as a teaching assistant in the School of Architecture. At the same, Rosanna is preparing her thesis. Once she finishes her degree, Rosanna wants to work in her profession and help her family. She says that she has always enjoyed the field of architecture, which is why she wanted to study this subject.

Rosanna is requesting a loan so that she can invest in the payment of her degree expenses since there are so many that need to be covered.

loans.use: to pay her degree expenses.

loans.name: Hrachya

texts.en:
Hrachya is a 32-year-old prosperous businessman, who lives in Vanadzor city, which is in Lori region. He is married and he has a small son. 

Hrachya rents a space where he established a workshop making iron doors, and windows made of metal and plastic materials. This is the business that his father has taught him all the secrets and details of this work. Now, he is already a Jack of all trades. His workshop is very popular. Hrachya gets his materials from the Yerevan wholesale markets, and transports them to his workshop on his truck. 

As Hrachya has a lot of orders, but a lack of materials, he has requested a loan of 1,000,000 AMD in order to buy a lot of raw materials so he can manage his orders on time.

loans.use: to buy a lot of raw materials so that he can manage his orders on time.

loans.name: Ashot

texts.en:
Ashot is from Kapan town where he lives with his wife and 26-year-old son. He has been driving a taxi using his own car for many years. As the only breadwinner of the family, Ashot works hard and manages to cover the family's daily costs. 

Currently, the car that Ashto drives needs to be renovated. By applying for this loan, Ashot has asked for financial support. He has been approved for a loan within the framework of a new joint initiative between Kiva and SEF international. The start-up loan program provides business start-up loans with soft conditions to informal businesses that do not have access to credit products. The loan will be a great support for Ashot and he hopes for lenders' help.

loans.use: to pay for the renovation of his car.

loans.name: Temur

texts.en:
Temur is a 29-year-old married man. He lives with his wife, an infant daughter and father in a small village in Zugdidi district. 

The family is involved in agricultural activities. In particular, they have two cows, two calves, a pig and a horse. They produce cheese products to sell locally. In addition, they have a plot of agricultural land, where they grow maize and nut trees. Temur is very hard working man and always has high quality products which are sold at a good price. 

Temur decided to start his own business and requested a loan. The Start Up program, which is a joint initiative between Kiva and Credo, enables him to get a loan of 1,000 GEL to start a trading business. He will purchase fruit and vegetables at wholesale prices and then resell at a good price. The Start Up program will be a great support for the family.

loans.use: to start a business selling fruit and vegetables.

loans.name: Comfort

texts.en:
Comfort live in West Point. She is 42 years old, divorced and has two children who are presently in school and live at home. 

For four years now, Comfort has been involved in the sale of fashion clothes. She has many customers since her business is in a very good location in the market. She sells from Monday to Saturday, spending nine hours per day on her business. She described herself as a hard working business woman. 

She is requesting a loan to buy fashion clothes such as blouses, jeans, trousers, and dresses for her business. She plans to expand her business even more.

loans.use: to buy fashion clothes such as blouses, jeans, trousers, and dresses for her business.

loans.name: Teikar

texts.en:
Teikar is a 53-year-old married woman. She lives with her daughter and son-in-law in the Gardabani district. 

Teikar has previously requested loans from local financial institutions several times for a family business start-up, but without any success. Her loan requests were rejected each time because of her low income and the family's poor living conditions. 

The only source of the income for the family is from agriculture. They have rented a plot of land, where broom trees are grown. With the harvested product the family makes brooms and sells them at local markets. Teikar has now been approved for a loan within the framework of the new joint initiative of Kiva and Credo. The start-up loan program envisages the provision of business start-up and re-startup credits with soft conditions to rural poor people, who do not have access to credit products. These rural poor people are regarded as "high risk borrowers" because of their low income. 

With her loan, Teikar will start trading clothes. She will purchase clothes from the wholesalers and then resell at a higher price in her district.

loans.use: to begin trading clothes.

loans.name: Al-Naseem Group

texts.en:
Al-Naseem Group consists of four women from Taiz, Yemen. They have asked for a loan of 220,000 YER. 

Amany, who is 31 years old, is a married woman who lives with her family in Taiz. She is the leader of the group. She has been accumulating money for a few years and is now constructing a small room. She needs to buy construction supplies to complete building her house, but she has no money left. She has therefore applied for a loan of 60,000 YER. She hopes to be able to open a savings account for her family members after finishing the room construction.

loans.use: to buy construction supplies to complete building her house.

loans.name: Salim

texts.en:
Salim is 39 years old, and is married with four children, for whom he works extra hours to provide for. 

Salim owns a general store. He sells plumbing tools, light bulbs, and other basic needs for a house. He has been in this business since 2006, and through practice he has gained good experience. Salim has become well-known in his surroundings due to his competitive prices. 

Salim is requesting a loan of 3,000 USD. He will use this loan to expand his general store and to install a rolling shutter. He believes this loan will improve his business, increase his profits, and will give him the ability to provide his family better life conditions.

loans.use: to expand his general store and to install a rolling shutter.

loans.name: Flor Del Campo Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “FLOR DEL CAMPO”  iniciará el primer ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Villa Tejada, está compuesta por ocho integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Vidalia es la Presidenta. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos existen: venta de material de construcción, tienda de barrio, venta de celulares, venta de gorras, venta de lencería.

El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Vidalia es integrante, ella indica que hace es la primera vez que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por invitación de una amiga que es socia de la institución. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de  tejido y venta de prendas de vestir; cuenta que este negocio lo emprendió hace varios años atrás al observar que estos productos eran altamente comercializados en el mercado internacional, es por ello que ya trabaja con los mismos productos hace treinta años.
 
El crédito que ahora sacará es para el aumento de capital (compra de lana) que adquirirá de las fronteras Bolivia y Perú y posteriormente a la elaboración lo comercializará en su espacio de venta. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para mantenerse en lo posible a su hogar ya que ella vive en concubinato y tiene tres hijos.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gustan el área de salud.
texts.en:
The not for profit group Flor del Campo will begin their first loan cycle with Pro Mujer as part of the Villa Tejada regional office. The group is made up of eight members and is directed by an executive board of which Vidalia is president. The members of the communal bank run a variety of businesses, including running a grocery store, selling construction materials, mobile phones, hats, and lingerie.  

This loan will benefit the small business owners, including Vidalia who is a group member. She says that this is the first time that she has joined Pro Mujer after being invited by a friend who is a member of the institution. She currently has a knitting store where she sells garments of clothing. She says that she began this business many years ago after seeing that these garments were in high demand in the international market, which is why she has been selling the same garments for thirty years.

The loan that Vidalia is taking out will increase her working capital (by purchasing wool) which she will acquire from the borders of Bolivia and Peru and later, after making her garments, she will sell them from her store. This line of work allows her to generate an income to keep her going as much as possible in her home where she lives with her partner and three children.

When asked what she liked about Pro Mujer, Vidalia said that she liked their health service.

loans.use: to buy wool

loans.name: Salome

texts.es: La señora Salome tiene 58 años de edad, es casada y tiene 2 hijos; cuenta con un grado de instrucción primario, se dedica a la  Agricultura, pero su actividad principal es  la comercialización de papa y hortalizas en Quillacollo, compra de los productores y luego comercializa, tiene 30 años de experiencia y con el fin de seguir progresando requiere un crédito de Bs 7000 para comprar mayor cantidad de papa y hortalizas para generar mas ingresos.
texts.en:
Salome is 58 years old and is married with 2 children. She has one grade of primary education. She works in agriculture but her main job is selling potatoes and vegetables in Quillacollo. She buys from the producers and then sells the produce. She has been doing this for 30 years.

So she can continue to make progress, Salome needs a loan of 7,000 BOB to buy a larger quantity of potatoes and vegetables in order to generate more income.

loans.use: to buy a larger quantity of potatoes and vegetables.

loans.name: Meris Del Socorro

texts.es:
Gracias por apoyar a Meris, quien con su credikiva su negocio de venta de productos de belleza y cosmetología, ha mejorado porque logró comprar ofertas de productos a precios excepcionales y venderlo a su clientela fija, la cual potencializó nuevos compradores. Su vida ha cumplido con responsabilidad a sus hijos y esto la hace feliz. Ella dice a sus financiadores de Kiva 2Por personas como ustedes, hemos podido sacar adelante nuestros negocios y mejorar nuestro entorno”
Su negocio va en ascenso ahora ha adicionado servicios de internet que han potencializado la venta de productos de Belleza. En la actualidad está aplicando a un credikiva, mediante el cual comprará productos de belleza, que han llegado con precios de oportunidad y podrá captar una vez más nuevos cliente y satisfacer a sus fieles compradores.
texts.en:
Thank you for helping Meris, who has improved her business selling beauty and cosmetology products using her Kiva loan, because she was able to buy products on offer at exceptional prices and sell them to her regular clientele. This has brought in new customers. Her work life has helped her fulfil her responsibility to her children and this makes her happy.

Meris says to the Kiva lenders: "Thanks to people like you, we have been able to move our businesses forward and improve our environment." Her business is on the increase now she has added internet services, which has boosted her sales of beauty products. 

Currently Meris is applying for a Kiva loan which she will use to buy beauty products, which she has an opportunity to buy at a good price, and this will enable her to attract more new customers and satisfy her loyal regular buyers.

loans.use: to buy beauty products to sell to her customers.

loans.name: Silvia

texts.es: Silvia tiene 55 años de edad  y se dedica a la venta de artículos de miscelánea desde hace 13 años, fundamentándose en la experiencia de su familia, quien por tradición es comerciante. Los principales productos de su oferta son los vestidos, el calzado, los productos para el hogar, los accesorios femeninos etc.  Silvia realiza sus ventas a crédito la mayor parte y de contado, trabajando desde los lunes a domingos, en un horario que va desde las 8 de la mañana, hasta las 8 de la noche, mientras sus compras las realiza de contado, con una frecuencia quincenal, a mayoristas que le ofrecen precios competitivos, que él puede trasladar a sus vecinos del sector, quienes son sus principales clientes. En la actualidad Silvia está aplicando a un credikiva, primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, mediante el cual comprará ropa, calzado, artículos para el hogar, entre otros artículos, determinados por la temporada navideña de fin de año, que se acerca. Su meta es hacer que su negocio sea reconocido y tenga un mayor posicionamiento, razón por la cual trabaja esmeradamente para lograrla y hacer que su inversión, producto de su credikiva, sea exitosa.
texts.en:
Silvia is 55 years old and has been selling miscellaneous items for 13 years, following her family's experience and tradition of working in retail. The main products she sells are clothing, footwear, household items and women's accessories etc. Silvia sells mostly on credit and also in cash and works from Monday to Sunday from 8 in the morning until 8 at night. She buys her stock in cash every fortnight from wholesalers who give her competitive prices, which she can pass on to the neighbours in the area who are her main customers.

Currently Silvia is applying for a Kiva loan and this is the first loan she has had from the Fundación Mario Santo Domingo. She will use this to buy clothing, footwear, household items and other items for the approaching Christmas season. Her goal is for her business to be recognised and have a better position and she works diligently to achieve this and to make a successful investment out of her Kiva loan.

loans.use: to buy clothing, footwear, household items and other items for the Christmas season.

loans.name: Rosita Elena

texts.es:
Rosita Elena tiene 45 años de edad, vive en Piedra del Toro, una zona rural de Buenos Aires, una comunidad que se caracteriza por sus bosques de algarrobo, a dos horas de la ciudad de Piura, costa norte del Perú.

Ella es conocida por la venta de chicha de jora y cerveza en su domicilio, ha solicitado un préstamo de 1 000 nuevos soles para comprar abarrotes y colocar una bodeguita, lo que le permitirá tener mayores ingresos para su familia.
texts.en:
Rosita Elena is 45 years old and lives in Piedra del Toro, a rural area in the community of Buenos Aires known for its carob tree forests and located two hours from the city of Piura on the north cost of Peru.

Rosita is known for her maize chicha and beer which she sells from home. 

She has requested a loan of 1000 nuevos soles to buy groceries and start a store which will allow her to bring in more income for her family.

loans.use: to buy groceries for her store

loans.name: German Rudiard

texts.es: El señor German es soltero y no tiene hijos, estudia en la universidad pero no cuenta con ayuda económica de sus padres, por lo que él se mantiene solo y cubre todos sus gastos, es muy trabajador y se dedica a la producción y elaboración de pan, aun no produce grandes cantidades por que le falta un poco de capital por ello requiere un crédito de Bs. 4800 para la compra de harina e insumos para aumentar su nivel de producción y así mejorar su calidad de vida
texts.en: German is single and has no children.  He studies at the university but receives no economic help from his parents so he must cover all of his costs by himself.  He is a very hard worker and earns a living making bread, although he still cannot make large volumes because he is lacking the capital required.  That is why he is requesting a loan in the amount of 4,800 BOB to buy flour and supplies to increase production and improve his lifestyle.

loans.use: To buy flour and supplies.

loans.name: Anna

texts.ru:
Анна занимается продажей одежды. Она уже пользовалась микрокредитами от Надежды Украины, благодаря чему увеличила оборот товара и свой доход. 

В прошлом году у Анны был небольшой несчастный случай - она повредила ногу, когда отдыхала  на природе и некоторое время не могла торговать. Вынужденный отпуск по болезни пошел Анне на пользу и она вернулась к своему бизнесу здоровой и с новыми силами. Также, недавно сын Анны устроился на работу; теперь в их семье есть дополнительный источник дохода.

Анна надеется, что бизнес и дальше будет развиваться и приносить больше прибыли в семью. Она просит предоставить ей кредит в сумме 25 000 гривен на закупку нового товара: кофты, рубашки и брюки.
texts.en:
Anna sells clothing. She has already taken out loans from Hope Ukraine thanks to which she has increased her sales volume and her income.

Last year Anna had an accident, she injured her leg while vacationing outside of town and could not work for some time. This forced medical leave did Anna some good and she came back to her business healthy and recharged. Also, just recently Anna's son started working and now their family has additional income.

Anna hopes that business will grow further and will bring more income into her family. She is asking for a loan in the amount of 25,000 hryvnia to buy new merchandise such as sweaters, shirts and pants.

loans.use: to purchase more seasonal merchandise.

loans.name: Sharafat

texts.ru: Шарафат 47 лет, замужем, вместе с супругом воспитывают 2 детей. У Шарафат - среднее образование, в качестве основного дохода для своей семьи Шарафат занимается животноводством, стартовав 20 лет назад, с покупки скота на 20,000 сом KGS. Благодаря упорному труду Шарафат, в ее хозяйстве на сегодняшний день имеется: 2 дойные коровы, 15 овец, 15 коз. Ежемесячный доход составляет 16,000 сом (KGS). В целях дальнейшего развития своего хозяйства, Шарафат обратилась в Микрофинансовый банк «Бай –Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 100,000 сом (KGS) на покупку коров для увеличения поголовья скота. Доходы от кредита Шарафат планирует вложить в дальнейшее приумножение количества домашней скотины, и планирует накопить средства на свадьбу сына.
texts.en: Sharafat is 47 years old, married, and together with her husband, is raising two children. Sharafat has a secondary education. As the main source of income for her family, Sharafat practices livestock breeding. She started this business 20 years ago, with an initial purchase of cattle in the amount of 20,000 som (KGS). Thanks to Sharafat's hard work, she currently has on 2 milk cows, 15 sheep and 15 goats on her farm. Her monthly income is 16,000 som (KGS). For the purpose of further developing her business, Sharafat turned to Microfinance Bank "Bai Tushum and Partners." She is requesting a loan in the amount of 100,000 som (KGS) to buy cows to increase the size of her herd. Sharafat plans to invest the earnings from the loan in the further acquisition of livestock. She also intends to save money for her son's wedding.

loans.use: to buy cows.

loans.name: Seynakan

texts.ru: Сейнакан 60 лет, незамужем, одна воспитывает 3 детей. У Сейнакан - среднее образование, в качестве основного дохода для своей семьи Сейнакан занимается животноводством, стартовав 20 лет назад, с покупки скота на 1,500 сом KGS. Благодаря упорному труду Сейнакан, в ее хозяйстве на сегодняшний день имеется: 2 дойные коровы, 2 телки, 1 бычок, 10 овец. Ежемесячный доход составляет 15,000 сом (KGS). В целях дальнейшего развития своего хозяйства, Сейнакан обратилась в Микрофинансовый банк «Бай –Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 100,000 сом (KGS) на покупку коров для увеличения поголовья скота. Доходы от кредита Сейнакан планирует вложить в дальнейшее приумножение количества домашней скотины, и планирует накопить средства на ремонт дома.
texts.en: Seynakan is 60 years old, unmarried, and is raising three children on her own. Seynakan has a secondary education. As the main source of income for her family, Seynakan practices livestock breeding. She started this business 20 years ago, with an initial purchase of cattle in the amount of 1,500 som (KGS). Thanks to Seynakan's hard work, she currently has on 2 milk cows, 2 calves, 1 bull and 10 sheep on her farm. Her monthly income is 15,000 som (KGS). For the purpose of further developing her business, Seynakan turned to Microfinance Bank "Bai Tushum and Partners." She is requesting a loan in the amount of 100,000 som (KGS) to buy cows to increase the size of her herd. Seynakan plans to invest the earnings from the loan in the further acquisition of livestock. She also intends to save money to renovate her house.

loans.use: to buy cows.

loans.name: Imigulsun

texts.ru: Имигулсун 57 лет, вдова, после смерти мужа сама воспитывает троих детей, а также ведет свое хозяйство. У Имигулсун - среднее образование, в качестве основного дохода для своей семьи Имигулсун занимается животноводством, стартовав 10 лет назад, с покупки скота на 5,000 сом KGS. Благодаря упорному труду Имигулсун, в ее хозяйстве на сегодняшний день имеется: 2 дойные коровы. Ежемесячный доход составляет 3,000 сом (KGS). В целях дальнейшего развития своего хозяйства, Имигулсун обратилась в Микрофинансовый банк «Бай –Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 120,000 сом (KGS) на покупку коров для увеличения поголовья скота. Доходы от кредита Имигулсун планирует вложить в дальнейшее приумножение количества домашней скотины.
texts.en: Imigulsun is 57 years old and a widow. After the death of her husband, she continues to raise three children on her own. Imigulsun has a secondary education. As the main source of income for her family, Imigulsun practices livestock breeding. She started this business 10 years ago, with an initial purchase of cattle in the amount of 5,000 som (KGS). Thanks to Imigulsun's hard work, she currently has on 2 milk cows on her farm. Her monthly income is 3,000 som (KGS). For the purpose of further developing her business, Imigulsun turned to Microfinance Bank "Bai Tushum and Partners." She is requesting a loan in the amount of 120,000 som (KGS) to buy cows to increase the size of her herd. Imigulsun plans to invest the earnings from the loan in the further acquisition of livestock.

loans.use: to buy cows.

loans.name: Juan Angel

texts.es:
Juan, es casado, vive junto a su esposa y sus dos hijos; es el encargado de generar los ingresos para que su familia tenga lo necesario, se dedica a la agricultura y ganadería, es una actividad que aprendió desde que era un niño junto a su padre. 
Juan está preparando la reserva de alimento para su ganado en época de verano, con la inversión comprara aditivos, plástico y pagara mano de obra para la elaboración del silo de la maicillera que posee, espera que teniendo el alimento suficiente su ganado no pasara hambre en ese época seca.
Desea aumentar la producción de leche en sus vacas, pues así sus ganancias serán mayores, tendrá un negocio más productivo y dará a sus hijos una buena educación.
texts.en:
Juan is married and lives with his wife and two children.  He is the bread-winner for the family and works in agriculture and livestock farming.  He learned farming from his father when he was a little boy.

Juan is preparing the reserve of livestock feed for the summer season and with the investment he plans to buy additives and plastic and hire workers to make a silo for the corn field he has.  He hopes he will have enough feed on hand so the livestock will not go hungry during the dry season.  He wants to increase dairy production and earn more income.  This will make his business more productive so he can give his children a good education.

loans.use: To buy additives, plastic, and hire workers.

loans.name: Elmer Alirio

texts.es:
Elmer,  ha optado por otro crédito para surtir su cerrajería, comprara variedad de llaves, con las que podrá diversificar sus productos y atender mejor a sus clientes. Con el crédito anterior el surtió su inventario, dio un mejor servicio, tuvo buenas ganancias y cancelo sus deudas.
Su negocio es más amplio hoy en día ya ofrece el servicio  de instalación de alarmas de vehículo, su familia tiene un alimentación mucho mejor, todos están muy saludables.
texts.en:
Elmer is requesting another loan for his metal workshop.  He plans to buy a variety of keys so he can diversify his products and provide better customer service.  With the previous loan he stocked his business and was able to provide better service.  This increased his profit and enabled him to pay off debts.

Elmer's business has grown and now offers a vehicle alarm installation service.  His family has better food on the table and everyone is healthy.

loans.use: To buy a variety of keys.

loans.name: Esmeralda Noemy

texts.es:
Esmeralda, es una joven emprendedora que ha podido administrar de una forma adecuada los créditos, anteriormente se le facilito capital con el que ha invertido en la venta de especias y fortaleció la venta de ropa. En esta oportunidad invertirá en la compra de ropa diferentes estilos, colores y tallas, también comprara especias.
Espera que en esta época navideña sus ventas aumenten y poder generar ingresos para cancelar las cuotas, seguir ampliando su negocio.
texts.en:
Esmeralda is a young entrepreneur who has been able to manage her loans correctly.  She used a previous loan to invest in a spice business that strengthened her clothing business.  On this occasion, she will buy different styles, colors and sizes of clothing, as well as spices.

She hopes sales will increase during the Christmas season so she can earn enough to pay off debt and continue expanding her business.

loans.use: To buy clothing.

loans.name: Rysbubu

texts.ru: Рысбубу 58 лет, замужем, вместе с супругом воспитывают 6 детей. У Рысбубу - среднее образование, в качестве основного дохода для своей семьи Рысбубу занимается животноводством, стартовав 13 лет назад, с покупки скота на 60,000 сом KGS. Благодаря упорному труду Рысбубу, в ее хозяйстве на сегодняшний день имеется: 2 дойные коровы, 1 теленок, 20 овец. Ежемесячный доход составляет 11,000 сом (KGS). В целях дальнейшего развития своего хозяйства, Рысбубу обратилась в Микрофинансовый банк «Бай –Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 60,000 сом (KGS) на покупку коров для увеличения поголовья скота. Доходы от кредита Рысбубу планирует вложить в дальнейшее приумножение количества домашней скотины, и планирует накопить средства на дальнейшее обучение своих внуков.
texts.en: Rysbubu is 58 years old, married, and together with her husband, is raising six children. Rysbubu has a secondary education. As the main source of income for her family, Rysbubu practices livestock breeding. She started this business 13 years ago, with an initial purchase of cattle in the amount of 60,000 som (KGS). Thanks to Rysbubu's hard work, she currently has 2 milk cows, 1 calf and 20 sheep on her farm. Her monthly income is 11,000 som (KGS).
