For the purpose of further developing her business, Rysbubu turned to Microfinance Bank "Bai Tushum and Partners." She is requesting a loan in the amount of 60,000 som (KGS) to buy cows to increase the size of her herd. Rysbubu plans to invest the earnings from the loan in the further acquisition of livestock. She also intends to save money for the future education of her grandchildren.

loans.use: to buy cows.

loans.name: Eli

texts.es:
Eli tiene 32 años de edad vive junto a su esposa en el distrito de Mocupe, su población se dedica al cultivo de caña, arroz, comercio de animales menores y ganadería, a dos horas de la ciudad e Chiclayo, costa norte del Perú.

Junto a su esposa tiene un pequeño negocio en la parte posterior a su domicilio de crianza y venta de aves de corral, también se dedican a la crianza de ganado vacuno.

El ha solicitado un préstamo de 3 000 nuevos soles para comprar una vaca y de esta manera ofrecer su leche en el mercado de la zona, teniendo ingresos adicionales para su familia.
texts.en:
Eli is 32 years old and lives with his wife in the Mocupe district.  The inhabitants here make a living growing sugar cane and rice, and selling young animals and cattle.  Mocupe is two hours away from Chiclayo, on Peru's northern coast.

Eli has a small business with his wife, which he runs out the back of his house.  Eli raises and sells poultry, as well as raising cattle.

Eli has applied for a loan of 3000 Nuevo Soles in order to buy a cow so as to be able to sell milk at the market and have an additional income for his family.

loans.use: to buy a cow.

loans.name: Jeniffer

texts.es: Jeniffer de 23 años de edad, habita en un municipio área metropolitana de la ciudad, con su cónyuge y su pequeño hijo de 5 años. Hace 3 años, inició su actividad productiva, armando limpiones en el negocio de su padre y cuando éste, se dio cuenta de su conocimiento, le compró una máquina de coser, para que no solo los armara, sino que hiciera todo el proceso productivo y generara para ella, todo el ingreso.  Hoy elabora  con trapos, limpiones industriales, que vende por retales, a empresas productivas, de contado, trabajando de lunes a sábados, en un horario de 8 a 6 de la tarde, cesando solo en los tiempos requeridos para alimentación. Su meta es ampliar su local y mas adelante adquirir una vivienda nueva, razón por la cual planea crecer más, aunque su desafío, es la competencia del mercado, y su capacidad de comprar en mayor volumen, para obtener mejores precios, por la compra de sus materias primas e insumos. En la actualidad está aplicando a un credikiva, primer financiamiento, que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, mediante el cual comprará, retales de franela, para elaborar limpiones industriales y vender en el marco de su competencia, haciendo de su credikiva una buena y oportuna inversión
texts.en:
Jeniffer, 23, lives in the metropolitan area of the city with her husband and five-year-old son.  Three years ago she started her own production of dust cloths at her father's business.  When he realized what she was capable of doing he bought her a sewing machine, not only to sew with but so she could be more productive and generate more income.

Now she makes industrial cloths out of rags and sells them to companies on a cash basis. She works Monday through Saturday from 8:00 a.m. to 6:00 p.m., only pausing long enough to eat.  Her goal is to expand her business and buy a new house in the future.  That is why she plans to expand more, although she is up against a lot of competition in the market.  She wants to increase her capacity to buy larger volumes so she can get better prices on raw materials and supplies.

Jeniffer is currently requesting her first CrediKiva loan through the Mario Santo Domingo Foundation, which she will use to buy pieces of flannel to make industrial cloths to sell.  The CrediKiva loan will be a good, opportune investment.

loans.use: To buy flannel.

loans.name: Otilia

texts.es:
Otilia, es una madre soltera de 31 años, vive con sus padres, una hermana y su hijo. Por la necesidad de generar ingresos para apoyar con los gastos de su casa y cubrir las necesidades de su hijo implemento su propio negocio, desde hace cinco años en el que elabora pupusas y diferentes antojitos, es un oficio que aprendió de su familia, lo realiza en horas de la tarde a partir de las 3:00 p.m. hasta las 9:00 p.m.
El capital lo invertirá en compra de yuca, chicharrón, quesillo, aceite y papas, todos estos ingredientes son su materia prima para que el negocio funcione sin ningún problema, es una actividad no complicada para ella pues ya tiene mucho tiempo de experiencia. 
Sueña aumentar sus ventas, generar más ingresos, cancelar bien la deuda y sobre todo construir su propia casa para que su hijo tenga un mejor ambienta habitacional.
texts.en:
Otilia is 31 years old and a single mother.  She lives with her parents, one of her sisters, and her son.  Because she needed to earn an income in order to support the family with household costs, and to buy her son's necessities, Otilia started her own business preparing "pupusas" (a corn tortilla stuffed with cheese, meat or beans) and other snacks five years ago.  She learned this trade from her family, and now works in the afternoons, from 3pm until 9pm.

Otilia will use this loan to buy yucca, pork, cheese-filled tortillas, oil, and potatoes.  All these ingredients serve as the prime materials that she needs for her business to run smoothly.  For Otilia, it is not difficult to run this business as she now has a lot of experience.

Otilia's dreams are to increase her sales and income, to pay off her debt and, above all, build her own home so that her son has a better place to live.

loans.use: to buy yucca, pork, cheese-filled tortillas, oil, and potatoes.

loans.name: Karla Patricia

texts.es: La señora Karla Patricia se dedica a la actividad de venta de mariscos frescos desde hace 13 años  en el mercado Santa Ana, la señora es madre de tres hijas de las cuales todas estudian y se esfuerza por sacarlas adelante, trabaja de lunes a sabado desde las cinco de la mañana se viene al mercado a vender su mercaderia hasta las doce del dia. la señora Karla solicita el financiamiento para comprar pescado de pargo que es el mas caro y necesita capital para comprar al por mayor
texts.en: Karla Patricia has been selling fresh seafood in the Santa Ana market for thirteen years.  Karla is a mother to three daughters, all of whom are in school.  Karla is making a lot of effort to help them to get ahead.  She works Monday to Friday, from 5am, when she comes to the market to sell her merchandise until midday.  Karla is applying for a loan in order to buy red snapper, which is more expensive than other fish.  Karla needs capital to buy this fish in bulk.

loans.use: to buy red snappers and other fish.

loans.name: Benigno Ricardo

texts.es: El señor Benigno Ricardo tiene un tramo en el mercado del bisne desde hace 17 años, el señor presta servicios de elaboracion y reparacion de calzado, en su taller tiene dos jovenes que le ayudan a realizar los trabajos, el señor es casado, de el depende un joven el cual estudia en secundaria y se esfuerza por sacar adelante a sus hijo, labora de lunes a domingo desde las siete de la mañana con mucho esfuerzo a sacado adelante su taller tiene bastante clientes que lo buscan por su experiencia, solicita el financiamiento para comprar materiales para su talelr el cual tiene un pedido y desea cubrirlo al 100%.
texts.en: Benigno Ricardo has had a stall at the Bisne market for 17 years.  There he offers services producing and repairing footwear. He has two young people who help him with the work at the workshop.  Benigno is married and has one dependent, who is currently studying in secondary school.  Benigno is putting in the effort to help his son get ahead.  Benigno works seven days a week, from 7am.  With lots of effort, his workshop has prospered and he now has many customers, who come to him for his experience.  Benigno is applying for a loan in order to buy materials for his workshop.  He has an order which he would like to fulfil completely.

loans.use: to buy leather, rubber, glue, and thread.

loans.name: Edgardo Armando

texts.es:
Edgardo, solicita capital para comprar terneros y semovientes, que criara, engordara y luego los venderá a sus clientes, con lo que ampliara su negocio, mejoraran sus ventas, y seguirá apoyando en los gastos de su casa.
Con el crédito anterior aumento su ganado lo que le facilito tener más semovientes a la venta parta que los clientes pudieran quedar más satisfechos,, su economía mejoro y el negocio se mantiene activo, su familia se encuentra muy saludable.
texts.en:
Edgardo is applying for a loan in order to buy calves and livestock, which he will raise, fatten up, and later sell to his customers.  This will help Edgardo to expand his business, improve his sales, and continue to help with household costs.

Edgardo used his last loan to buy more livestock to sell.  As a result, his customers were more satisfied, his finances improved and the business remained active. Edgardo's family is in good health.

loans.use: to buy calves and livestock.

loans.name: Sabohat

texts.ru: Двадцати восьмилетняя Сабохат начинает новую деятельность в сфере растениеводства. Она замужем и является матерью 6-летней девочки и 2-летнего мальчика. Муж Сабохат работает мастером строителем. Сама Сабохат занимается шитьем. В данный момент она собирается одновременно заняться растениеводством, как многие жители ее района Хамадони. Сам климат этого района благоприятствует ведению этой деятельности. Сабохат просит кредит и хочет арендовать орошаемый участок земли. На сумму своего сбережения она купит семена пшеницы, минеральные удобрения и топливо. Она планирует посеять пшеницу и весной получить хороший урожай. Благодаря кредиту у нее появится новый источник дохода и жизненные условия ее семьи намного улучшатся.
texts.en: Twenty-eight-year-old Sabohat is starting a new business in the sphere of crop farming. She is married and is the mother of a 6-year-old girl and two-year-old boy. Sabohat's husband is a construction foreman. Sabohat works as a seamstress. She is currently planning to simultaneously take up crop farming like many of the residents of her district, Hamadoni. The district's climate is favorable for this type of business. Sabohat is requesting a loan and wants to rent an irrigated plot of land. With her own savings she will buy wheat seeds, mineral fertilizers and fuel. She plans to sow the seeds and in the Spring, receive a great harvest. Thanks to the loan, she will have a new source of income and her family's living conditions will improve greatly.

loans.use: to lease an irrigated plot of land.

loans.name: Candida Rosa

texts.es: La señora Candida Rosa se dedica a la actividad de venta de productos por catalogos desde hace 10 años, vende ambulante, su negocio lo empezo con capital propio,  ella ya tiene sus clientes quienes le solicitan pedido, la señora Candida es madre de 4 hijos de estos solo uno depende de ella,  estudia la  universidad,  se esfuerza por sacarla adelante, vende de lunes a domingo, realiza sus pedidos a las empresas y se dedica a repartir y a ofrecer sus productos, solicita financiamiento para comprar cosmeticos y perfumerias con el fin de aprovechar la temporada buena que es el mes de diciembre.
texts.en:
Candida Rosa has been selling products through catalogues for 10 years. She is a travelling vendor, and she set up her business with her own capital. She already has customers who order through her. Candida is the mother of 4 children, one of whom is still dependent and studies at university. Candida strives to progress in life, and sells from Monday to Sunday. She fulfils her orders at companies and delivers and sells her products.
She is looking for finance to buy cosmetics and perfume in order to make the most of December, which is a good season for sales.

loans.use: to buy a variety of perfumes, talc, colognes, cosmetics and clothes.

loans.name: Kartlos

texts.en: Kartlos is a 51-year-old married man, who lives in the village of Kanda with his wife, son, daughter-in-law and grandchildren. Kartlos runs a pig farm and sells piglets seasonally. He works hard all day long to earn his living, but his existing income is not enough to cover food and everyday expenses. That is why Kartlos decided to start another business. He applied for credit from MFO Credo. His request was approved under the startup loan program, which is a joint initiative with Kiva. This program enables the vulnerable poor to start or re-start businesses. A loan of $3,000 will help Kartlos to purchase a minibus. Kartlos will work on the minibus line as a driver and transport passengers from his district to the capital city. The new business initiative will significantly increase the family funds. With the increased income, the family will be able to increase their daily spending and improve their living standard in future.

loans.use: to purchase a minibus and start working on the minibus line.

loans.name: Rawyah Group

texts.en:
Sanaa is the featured borrower of Rawyah's group. She joined with her other group members to acquire a loan from Kiva partner Al Majmoua. They have always been neighbors and friends.

Sanaa is a 27-year-old married mother of two children. She has been working as a hairdresser for five years. Two years ago, she started her own business, which she runs from home. It's developing gradually and most of her clients recommend her to friends and relatives.

Sanaa is the lady sitting in the middle. She is acquiring a loan from Kiva partner Al Majmoua to buy necessary tools and machines requested for developing her business.

As for the other group members, Rawya is the first from the left, she is 21 years old, and Wafaa, who is 38 years old, is the first from the right.

loans.use: to buy necessary tools and machines requested for developing her business.

loans.name: Kholiskhon

texts.en: Kholiskhon is a 38-year-old woman. She has 3 wonderful children, two sons and one daughter. They live in a small, rural area.  For a long time, her husband has been working as an immigrant in the Russian Federation. Money that he was sending wasn’t enough so Kholiskhon started a new business of cattle breeding.  She has been doing this for 4 years and now she is very experienced and strong. She buys cattle, raises them and sells them. She asks for the loan, because she wants to buy a plane ticket for her husband.

loans.use: to buy an air ticket for her husband.

loans.name: Eveline

texts.en:
Eveline is married and has two children both of whom attend school. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees for her children. 

For the past year, Eveline has operated a poultry business, selling chicks at the market to her neighbors and town dwellers. She faces a major challenge of disease attack in her business. 

Eveline is requesting a loan to purchase more chicks and feeds for the chicks for the business. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase more chicks and feeds for the chicks for the business.

loans.name: Rachael

texts.en:
Rachael is 55 years old from Olkalou. She is married to David who is a businessman and they are blessed with three children 32, 29 and 25 years old.

Rachael is a farmer who grows crops like wheat, maize, potatoes, beans and sweet potatoes. She has been running this business for the last six years. To enable her to hire a tractor to plow her land in readiness for the next planting season and to also purchase some wheat planting seeds, she has applied for her third loan of KES 30,000 from KADET.

From her farming activities, Rachael makes a monthly income of KES 20,000 and she intends to use profits from her expanded business to build rental houses on a plot of land. She hopes to be the most successful farmer in her area.

loans.use: to boost her farming activities by hiring a tractor to plow her farm and to buy some wheat planting seeds.

loans.name: Doris

texts.en:
Doris is married with two children, both of whom attend school. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. 

She operates a business of selling tea leaves at the market to her neighbors and passersby. She faces a major challenge of seasonality in her business.  Her dream is to establish a tea shop in the near future. 

With the KES 20,000 she wants to purchase sacks of tea leaves for sale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase sacks of tea leaves for sale.

loans.name: Dorica

texts.en:
Dorica is a single woman with one child who attends school. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family.

Dorica operates a grocery vegetables selling stall. She sells at the market to town dwellers and neighbors. She faces a challenge of high cost of transportation to her place of operation. She dreams of expanding and establishing a big shop business in the future.

With the KES 20,000, Dorica wants to purchase green vegetables, two crates of tomatoes, and onions for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase green vegetables, two crates of tomatoes, and onions for resale.

loans.name: Lucy L.

texts.en: Lucy L. works in the West Point area, and lives in the area of New Georgia of Montserrado County. She is 45 years of age, married to an electrical engineer, and they have two children age 16 and 21, who live at home and attend school.  Lucy is a high college graduate, and has been doing her own business for three years now. She has more customers and makes lots of profit. She wants to expand her business even more.  She is requesting a loan in order to buy more fashion clothes like blouses, jeans, trouser, shirt, and many more for her business.

loans.use: to buy more fashion clothes like blouses, jeans, trouser, shirt, and many more for her business.

loans.name: Jouli 1 Group

texts.en:
Hamida is the featured borrower of Jouli 1 group. She joined with the other group members to acquire a loan from Kiva partner Al Majmoua because they have always been neighbors and friends.

Hamida is a 51-year-old married mother of five children. She has worked as a tailor from her house for four years. Hamida is acquiring a loan from Kiva partner Al Majmoua to buy a new tailoring machine to replace the old one that has stopped working. Hamida is the first one at the far right side of the picture.

As for the other group members, Zeinab is the second from the right, Etab is the lady in black, and Itab is the first from the left.

loans.use: to buy a new tailoring machine to replace the old one which stopped working.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more televisions, digital video discs, and compact discs for resale.

loans.name: Mayra Damaris

texts.es: La señora Mayra Damaris se dedica a la venta de carne de cerdo en el mercado desde hace 8 años, empezo su negocio con capital propio, es madre de tres niños todos en edad escolar, es casada, lucha por sacar adelante a sus hijos, trabaja de lunes a domingo, en su negocio vende carne de cerdo, frito, pepena, charrasca, estos tres ultimos se acompaña con yuca y se le llama chancho con yuca una de las comidas tipicas de Chinandega, la señora solicita financiamiento para comprar tres cerdos en pie para criarlos y luego mandarlos al destace para verder su carne ya que se aproximan la temporada buena para la venta de carne el precio sube por el mes de diciembre.
texts.en: Mayra Damaris has been dedicated to selling pork in the market for eight years. She began her business with her own capital. She is mother to three children who are all school age. She is married. She works hard to get her children ahead. She works Monday through Sunday in her business selling fried pork, cooked pork fat,  and pork rinds. The last three are accompanied with cassava and is called "chancho con yuca", one of the typical dishes of Chinandega. She is requesting the loan to buy three live pigs to raise them and then send them to the butcher to prepare their meat since the season for good meat sales approaches. The price rises in the month of December.

loans.use: to purchase live pigs.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to maintain and repair his vehicle.

loans.name: Victor Raul

texts.es:
Víctor Raúl tiene 44 años de edad, vive en Piedra del Toro, una zona rural de Buenos Aires, su población se dedica al cultivo de frutales destacando el mango, comercio en general y ganadería a dos horas de la ciudad de Piura, costa norte del Perú.

El brinda servicio de mano de obra calificada, en la preparación de terrenos de cultivo, es muy conocido en la zona por la labor que realiza.

Ha solicitado un préstamo de 3 500 nuevos soles para darle mantenimiento a su vehículo que es la herramienta de trabajo que utiliza en el servicio que brinda.
texts.en:
Víctor Raúl is 44 years old. He lives in Piedra del Toro, in the rural area of Buenos Aires, two hours from the city of Piura on the north coast of Peru. The people in this district work in the cultivation of fruit, especially of mango, and also in trade and the raising of livestock.

Víctor Raúl provides services as a skilled worker. He prepares land for farming and is very reknowned for his work in his area.

He has asked for a loan of 3,500 nuevos soles in order to have maintenance work done on his vehicle, which is a tool he needs for the service he provides.

loans.use: to maintain his vehicle.

loans.name: Theresa T.

texts.en: Theresa T. is 34 years old and lives in West Point. She is divorced and has an 11-year-old child who lives at home and attends school. Theresa is a college graduate. She has been keeping busy with her own business for three years. She started this business by selling in her community for her parents who taught her how to sell. Theresa really enjoys operating her fashion clothes shop, meeting so many women and earning a daily profit. Theresa is requesting a loan to purchase more fashion clothes (blouses, jeans, trousers, dresses, etc.) for her business. She plans to expand her business by opening another shop and wants to be an international business woman in future.

loans.use: to purchase more fashion clothes (blouses, jeans, trousers, dresses, etc.) for her business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more flour, sugar, and other ingredients for her bakery.

loans.name: Leonardo De La Concepcion

texts.es: El señor Leonardo vende en el mercado de chinandega desde hace 40 años, en su negocio vende productos de ferreterias, es padre de cinco hijos pero ninguno depende de el mas que su esposa, el señor Leonardo vende de lunes a domingo desde las siete de la mañana hasta las cuatro de la tarde para llevar el sustento a su hogar y cubrir con las medicinas de su esposa, el señor es  trabajador, le gusta salir adelante solicita el financiamiento para comprar mas mercaderia y comprar juguetes ya que se aproxima la venta buena de juguetes y poder tener mejores ganancias
texts.en:
Leonardo has been selling in the market of Chinandega for 40 years. He sells hardware products in his business. He is the father of five children, although the only dependent is his wife. Leonardo sells from Monday to Sunday from seven in the morning until four in the afternoon in order to earn a living and to cover the costs of medicine for his wife. He is hard-working and he wants to get on in life.
Leonardo is asking for this loan in order to buy more goods and to buy toys as the season is coming when toys sell well, and he can improve his profits in this way.

loans.use: to buy tools, plugs, extensions, hoses, scissors and sockets.

loans.name: Rosa

texts.es:
Rosa tiene 58 años de edad, vive junto a su esposo en el distrito de La Matanza, su población se dedica al comercio, cultivo de de arroz, frutales entre otros, a dos horas de la ciudad de Piura, costa norte del Perú.

Ella se dedica a la venta de cerveza y chicha de jora, nos explica que esta actividad lo realiza desde que se caso y de esta manera contribuye con su esposo en los gastos de la familia.

Ha solicitado un préstamo de 2 000 nuevos soles para comprar insumos para la elaboración de chicha de jora y distribuirlos en los caseríos aledaños a su comunidad, generando de esta manera ingresos adicionales para su familia.
texts.en:
Rosa is 58 years old. She lives with her husband in the Matanza district. Its population is dedicated to trade, growing rice and fruit, among other things, two hours from the city of Piura on the north coast of Peru.

She is dedicated to selling beer and "chicha de jora" (a fermented drink made from corn). She explains that she has performed this work since she married and, in this manner, contributes, alongside her husband, to the family's expenses.

She has requested a loan of 2,000 PEN to buy ingredients to make "chicha de jora" and distribute it to villages near her community, generating additional income for her family.

loans.use: to buy ingredients to make "chicha de jora" (a beverage).

loans.name: Ani

texts.en:
Ani is from Sisian. After graduating from college and getting a specialization as a cosmetologist, Ani has started to provide cosmetics services to locals in her. Despite her young age, Ani has been able to gain a number of loyal customers who use her services with great pleasure. 

Particularly, Ani provides hairdressing and manicure services. With this loan, Ani would like to purchase cosmetics and hairdressing products so that she can provide better quality services to her clients. 

She has now been approved for a loan within the framework of a new joint initiative between Kiva and SEF international. The start-up loan program provides business start-up loans with soft conditions to informal businesses that do not have access to traditional credit products. 

The loan is very important for Ani because it will help improve the services that she provides, so she hopes for lenders' support.

loans.use: to pay for hairdressing and cosmetic products for her business.

loans.name: Abdul Aalem

texts.en:
Abdul Aalem is an Iraqi client. He is 43 years old, married, and has five children. Abdul Aalem is the only provider in the family. 

Abdul Aalem owns a small shop where he sells raw chicken and various types of birds. He has been in this field since 2007, and has gained good experience. Abdul Aalem is gradually growing in popularity in the area, and is gaining the respect of his neighborhood thanks to his good customer service and his competitive prices. 

Abdul Aalem is requesting a loan of 3,000 USD to renovate/expand his shop, and to install a rolling shutter. 

He believes that this loan will positively impact the improvement of his business, and that the increase in profits will give him the ability to provide better living conditions for his family.

loans.use: to renovate/expand his shop and to install a rolling shutter

loans.name: Bandhana

texts.en:
Bandhana is a 30-year-old housewife. Her husband, Bimal, is 40 years old. He is engaged in potato cultivation. Both received secondary education. Bandhana passed VI standard (Grade 6) and her husband passed XI standard (Grade 11). They have four children: three sons and one daughter. All of them are receiving education. They are in class VI (Grade 6), class IV (Grade 4), class III (Grade 3) and class I ( Grade 1). They live in the town of Maynaguri, village of Tekatuli, in Jalpaiguri District.

Due to lack of capital, they could not invest properly in their farming. That’s why their earnings are not enough. So Bandhana has applied for a loan to purchase large quantities of potato seeds and fertilizers for cultivation. The demand for potatoes is very high in the present market. They are thankful to Kiva and Belghoria Janakalyan Samity for the loan. Bandhana also hopes that the profit she will make from the business will upgrade their poor financial condition and ensure that her family members – especially her children – will have a better future.

loans.use: To purchase potato seeds and fertilizers for the farm

loans.name: Celia Del Carmen

texts.es: Doña Celia es originaria de la ciudad de Chinandega. De 36 años de edad, Casada y madre de dos hijas. Es de oficio comerciante, se dedica a la venta de productos varios (ropa, bisutería, cosméticos etc.).  Inicio este negocio desde  hace 4 años vendiendo aretes y pulseras con una pequeña vitrina, la cual su esposo la compro para apoyarla en ese negocio. Hoy día cuenta con una mini tienda donde vende una variedad de productos. Solicita el crédito para comprar mercadería tales como: ropa, perfumes, pulseras y aretes de todo tipo entre otros, con el fin de incrementar sus ventas y la clientela. Estima que este crédito le ayudara aumentar su inventario y podrá cumplir con la demanda de sus clientes. Su plan futuro es comprar más productos,  vitrinas, maniquíes y extender a una tienda.
texts.en:
Celia is from the city of Chinandega.  She is 36 years old, married, and has two daughters.  She sells various products (clothes, costume jewelry, and cosmetics, etc.)  She started four years ago by selling earrings and bracelets in a small display case.  Her husband bought her the display case to support her in this business.  She now has a mini-store where she sells a variety of products.

She is requesting the loan to buy merchandise like clothes, perfumes, bracelets, and all types of earrings, among others.  She will do this in order to increase her sales and her clientele.  She believes that this loan will help her to increase her inventory, and she will be able to fill her customer demand.  Her plan for the future is to buy more products, display cases, and mannequins and to expand her store.

loans.use: to buy merchandise like clothes, perfumes, bracelets, and all types of earrings, among others.

loans.name: Malkhaz

texts.en: Malkhaz is 42-year-old married man from Senaki district. He lives with his wife, two sons and father-in-law. His father-in-law is provided with a retirement pension of 150 GEL per month. Malkhaz owns a commercial space  which is rented out for 100 GL. He decided to start a business and requested a loan. The Start Up program, which is a joint initiative with Kiva and Credo, enables him to get a loan of $300 for a trading business. He will purchase fruits and vegetables at wholesale prices and then resell them at higher prices. The Start Up program will be a great support for the family.

loans.use: to begin trading fruits and vegetables.

loans.name: Arpik

texts.en:
Arpik lives in Vanadzor city, which is the Lori region. She is 49 years old, and unfortunately already a widow. She is a mother of three children; her two daughters are already married and they live with their families; her son lives with her. He is still a student, and in the future, wants to be an architect.

Arpik works at a private workshop as a tailor-worker. She has a great practice and she works smartly, that is way she is always busy and sometimes even short of time, because she has many orders. As Arpik says, she loves her work and after her husband’s death she has already got used of doing nearly everything for her children and her family alone, to work hard and for her family of two.

Arpik asks a loan of 320,000 Armenian drams since she wants to improve her son’s and her living conditions, and to buy a refrigerator.

loans.use: to improve the living conditions for her family, and to buy a refrigerator

loans.name: Basanti

texts.en:
Basanti is a teacher in a primary school. She passed XII class (Grade 12) and is 44 years old. Her husband, Gokul, age 48 years, is a trader of medicine. They live with their two children, one son and one daughter, in their own pacca (brick-built) house in the town of Maynaguri (village Khagrabari) in the district of Jalpaiguri. Both children go to school. The son is in class IX (Grade 9) and the daughter is in class II (Grade 2).

In the medicine business, they do not have sufficient stock of medicine for lack of capital. Basanti also tries hard to give financial support to her family. The money both of them earn is not sufficient. So they face great difficulty in affording the cost of their children's education and food expenses. Basanti applied for a loan to expand their medicine business so that they can earn more money for a better livelihood of their own and at the same time serve the people of the locality. There are few medicine dealers in the locality. Her plan is to upgrade their standard of living, expand their business and cover other expenses with the profit she will earn from the business. She is grateful to Belghoria Janakalyan Samity and Kiva for giving her the opportunity.

loans.use: To purchase medicine for expanding her medicine business.

loans.name: Bulan

texts.en: Bulan is a 28-year-old married woman. Her husband is Biswajit, age 32 years. Bulan passed XI standard (Grade 11), but her husband is illiterate and can only sign his name. She is the loving mother of one daughter who has just been admitted to school. They live in the small town Maynaguri (Tekatuli) in the district of Jalpaiguri, in their own kachha (mud- and straw-made) house. Both of them are in a hotel business. She is very enthusiastic about her business and helps her husband to earn a reasonable amount of money to support the family. Their earnings are not sufficient to cover their household expenses. So Bulan has applied for a loan to start cultivation of paddy and wants to sell in the local market. The loan will be used for purchasing seeds and fertilisers. The demand for paddy is very high in her locality. Both Bulan and her husband dream that in future they will be able to buy a piece of land with the profit they will earn from the business.

loans.use: To purchase good quality paddy seeds and fertilisers for cultivating paddy.

loans.name: Gaspar Antonio

texts.es:
Gaspar, es un agricultor de 32 años, está acompañado, posee casa propia donde vive con su compañera de vida y su pequeña hija de un año, aprendió de su padre a sembrar la tierra, desde hace cuatro años está trabajando propio, labora desde las 6:00 a.m. a 12:00 p.m., ya para él es una actividad muy conocida por lo que no le da ningún problema realizarla.
Comprará 4 sacos de abono, plaguicidas, pesticidas y semilla, con lo que preparara la tierra para sembrar sin ningún contratiempo, espera aumentar su producción y sus ganancias.
Sueña con estabilizarse económicamente, cancelar su deuda, ampliar su negocio y sobre todo tener la oportunidad de darle a su familia una mejor alimentación, salud y una carrera profesional a su hija.
texts.en:
Gaspar is 32 years old and in a relationship. He is a farmer, and he owns the home where he lives with his life partner and his daughter, age 1. Gaspar says that he learned to farm from his father, and that he has been working on his own for four years. He works from 6 am until noon, and he says that he knows the work very well so he has no trouble doing it.

Gaspar will use this loan to buy four bags of fertilizer, herbicide, pesticide and seeds, so that he can prepare the land for planting without any difficulties. He says that he wants to increase his production and his income. Gaspar says that he dreams of getting his finances under control, paying off his debt and expanding his business. Most of all, he wants to be able to give his family better nutrition and healthcare and to give his daughter an education to become a professional.

loans.use: to buy four bags of fertilizer, herbicide, pesticide and seeds.

loans.name: Suon

texts.en:
Suon is 56 years old and a married woman with two children, who are living with her and her husband in their own home situated in Baray district, Kampong Thom province. Suon earns a living by farming rice and cassava on more than 1 hectare of farmland. Her husband is also in the same career and helps her manage their farm. Together, they are able to make a suitable income of 20,000 KHR [Cambodian riels] per day, which they usually use for daily meals and school allowances for their children.

Suon would like to renovate her house in order to provide her family members a comfortable living, but she has insufficient capital to make this happen. In this particular way, she is asking for a loan in the sum of 2,000,000 KHR to buy wood and hire laborers to perform the construction. She is very delighted and grateful for the loan support to enable her to improve her living conditions.

loans.use: to buy wood and hire laborers to perform construction.

loans.name: Parandzem

texts.en:
Parandzem and her family live in the village Kirants, which is in Tavush region. She has a large, nice family; she lives with her husband, son, daughter-in law and two grandchildren. In her family, all members are employed and have their work, but all together they are engaged in farming and agriculture. They have a rather rich and big farm: six cows, 12 sheep, six piglets, 10 beehives, 20 chickens and 20 rabbits. On their land, they cultivate fruit trees (apple, persimmon), beans and cucumbers. All their farm products they manage to sell to resellers. 

Parandzem is sure that farming is really a good way of having decent income, and she does everything around her farm with great love. Thanks to her family members hard work, they receive a good profit at the end of each season.

Parandzem asks for a loan of 1,100,000 Armenian dram in order to buy a lot of animal fodder and also to organize autumn sowing activities.

loans.use: to buy a lot of animal fodder and also to organize autumn sowing activities.

loans.name: Tamaz

texts.en:
Tamaz is applying for a loan to start up a bakery in his village and bake shoti, the traditional Georgian bread.

He is 47 years old and married and lives with his wife, student daughter, and school-age son. The only one who earns money in the household is Tamaz, who is a musician and sings in a folk band. 

Besides, he runs a small-scale agricultural business and grows lucerne (alfalfa) on his own plot of land. He sells the harvest seasonally.
 
In order to generate income, Tamaz decided to start an additional business. He estimates his business will be lucrative, as there is high demand for bread in his village, and he has the proper experience in baking. 

With the received credit, Tamaz will renovate his own commercial space and purchase firewood and flour. Tamaz is happy for this start-up loan that is offered to poor people for improving their living condition in the future.

loans.use: to start a bakery making traditional Georgian bread

loans.name: Jasem

texts.en:
Jasem is an Iraqi client of 35 years of age.  He is married and has three children. Jasem is the only provider in his family.

Jasem is a barber. He established his business in 2011 and gained his experience through previously working at his friend’s barber shop for several years. Throughout his career, Jasem became well-known in his surrounding area and has gained an excellent reputation.

Jasem is requesting a loan of USD 3,000. He will use this loan to renovate his barber shop and to install a display window. 

By this loan, Jasem is aiming to continue to grow his business and increase his revenues, so he will be able to provide his family better living standards.

loans.use: to renovate his barber shop and to install a display window

loans.name: Avtandil

texts.en:
Avtandil is 20 years old and from the small village of Vani district. He lives with his mother and sister. The family is involved in agricultural activities. In particular, they have two cows and a calf. They produce cheese to sell. In addition, they have a plot of agricultural land, where they grow nut trees. 

Avtandil decided to start his own business and requested a loan. The Start Up program, which is a joint initiative with Kiva and Credo, enables him to get a loan of $2,000 for purchasing special equipment to repair cars. Avtandil is very motivated to work hard and generate his own income. The Start Up program will be a great support for his family.

loans.use: to purchase special equipment and repair cars.

loans.name: Haydar

texts.en:
Haydar is a grocer. He is an Iraqi client, aged 34 years old, married and has a single child. In his grocery store, Haydar offers various types of products for his customers such as canned food, detergents, dairy products and snacks. He established his business in 2011 and has gained good experience in this field. Haydar has gained a good reputation in his neighborhood, thanks to the competitive selling prices that he offers. 

He is requesting a sum of $3,000 as a loan to install a rolling shutter, a display window and a sunshade for his grocery store. Haydar is an ambitious person. He hopes that this renovation will attract more customers and will result in the increase of his profits.

loans.use: to install a rolling shutter, a display window and a sunshade for his grocery store.

loans.name: Zahrae

texts.en:
Zahrae is 21 years old, married, and has one child. She is a youth client from Iraq. Both Zahrae and her husband provide for the family. Zahrae is tailor and works from home, which she has been doing since 2006. She specializes in making all types of women's outfits. Zahrae has gained an excellent reputation and is well known in the surrounding area. 

Zahrae is requesting a youth loan for $3,000, which she will use to buy a new sewing machine and a specialized iron. She wants to expand her business and increase her profits so that she may open an institute for tailoring and enroll her child in this field.

loans.use: to purchase a new sewing machine and a specialized iron

loans.name: Mayumi

texts.es:
Mayumi, es soltera tiene dos hijos , vive en casa de sus padres la misma se encuentra ubicada en la zona Villa Oriental de la ciudad de El Alto.
Ella estudio hasta el nivel secundaria. Ella tiene su movilidad la cual fleta a una empresa que presta sus servicios a centros turisticos donde viajan a  (copacabana , salar de uyuni y otros ); por el flete del vehiculo le pagana Mayumi semanalmente .
El crédito lo requiere para el mantenimiento de su movilidad( compra de llantas, bateria  y otros) asi poder cumplir con sus requerimiento de la empresa.
El sueño de Mayumi  es que su movilidad este en buenas condiciones para asi poder tener mejores ingresos.
Es el segundo que solicita crédito junto a IMPRO y la primera vez con KIVA.
texts.en:
Mayumi is a single mother of two children. She lives in her parents’ home, which is in the Villa Oriental neighborhood of the city of El Alto. Mayumi completed elementary school. 

Mayumi has a vehicle which she rents to a company that transports tourists to sites such as Copacabana and Salar de Uyuni. The company pays Mayumi weekly to rent her vehicle.

Mayumi is requesting this loan to perform maintenance to her vehicle. She says that she needs to buy tires, a battery and other things to meet the company’s requirements. Mayumi says that her dream is to keep her vehicle in good condition so that she can earn a better income. This is her second loan with the field partner and the first time with Kiva.

loans.use: to pay for maintenance to her vehicle, which she rents to a company that transports tourists to sites in Bolivia.

loans.name: Eang

texts.en:
Eang is 57 years old and the widowed mother of a grown-up child. 

Eang permanently lives in her own home in Kampong Thom province, from which she cultivates rice and other seasonal crops to sell. She has been a farmer for over 29 years and earns a daily income of KHR 24,000 per day to cover the costs of living. Farming is the sole source of income for her family.

Since Eang’s home has deteriorated over the years, she would like to fix up her house, partially to provide good living conditions for her household. Due to insufficient capital, she is asking a loan of KHR 3,000,000 to buy wood for the job and hire laborers to perform the construction. 

She is very happy and thankful for the loan support to enable her to improve her living conditions.

loans.use: to buy wood to fix up  her house and hire laborers to perform the construction.

loans.name: Ra

texts.en:
Ra, aged 29, is a married woman and has three dependent children, all of whom are attending local primary school. Ra is a hardworking person who devotes her full-day time to work on daily farming chores and selling mixed grocery products in a small village of Baray district, Kampong Thom province. Having been in these activities for almost 10 years, Ra is seeking ways to develop her family-owned businesses in order to improve their household income. 

To help her further develop her farming business and help her achieve her dream, Ra has applied for a loan amounting to 5,000,000 KHR [Cambodian riels] to buy a piece of land to enlarge her farming areas. She hopes to increase her productivity this year and make additional income to secure the overall welfare of her family. Thanks to lenders for their generosities and good will toward poor people like her.

loans.use: to buy a piece of land to enlarge her farming areas.

loans.name: Rorn

texts.en:
Rorn is 43 years old and married, with two grown-up children. 

To provide enough food for her family, Rorn is engaged in farming rice in Kampong Thom province, and she also raises piglets and poultry from her home for additional income. With support from her husband and children, she is able to make a suitable income of KHR 20,000 per day. She has been doing this for almost 30 years.

To help her further develop her pig-raising business, Rorn wants to acquire a loan of KHR 2,000,000 to buy 10 headcounts of pig and poultry for raising. Through the loan support, Rorn hopes to boost her income when she sell her mature pigs and poultry into the local markets. 

For her future business plan, Rorn aims to enlarge her pig farm and increase the number of pigs to raise. She thanks lenders for their generosities and good will towards a poor fellow like her to improve her family-owned business.

loans.use: to buy 10 headcounts of pig and poultry for raising.

loans.name: Ren

texts.en:
From the Prey Chhor district of Kampong Cham, Ren is a hardworking woman who has devoted her lifetime to a farming business, managing on about one hectare of farmland for rice cultivation. Her family consists of her husband and nine children. It’s quite a big family, so the income from farming is barely enough to cover their daily costs. Because of this, her oldest daughter decided to quit studying at school and started selling used clothes in a local market to supplement Ren’s income.

At the moment, Ren would like to borrow a loan of 1,500 US dollars to help her daughter increase her stock of clothes to sell in her store. With this bundle purchase, Ren hopes that her daughter can increase the number of clients, satisfy their needs, and thereby earn more income. She is very thankful for the financial support offered by lenders, which enables her to develop her family-owned business as well as improve her living conditions.

loans.use: to support her daughter and increase her clothing stock to sell in her store.

loans.name: Bela

texts.en:
Bala is 44 years old and lives with her husband, Jogen, 47 years old, and their son. She received education up to class VI (Grade 6) and her husband, an education up to class X (Grade 10). Their son goes to school and reads in class X (Grade 10). They live in the small town of Mayanaguri (Haspatalpara ) in Jalpaiguri district in a semi-pacca (brick wall and straw roof) house of their own. Their cloth business is not good enough to support a decent lifestyle.  

She would like to get a loan to buy a good quantity of clothes and expand her business to meet her customers' needs as well as to upgrade their financial situation. The profits generated will be used to build up her savings and also help her to give her child better education. Her dream is to purchase a shop in the local market in order to expand their business.

loans.use: To purchase more clothing from the wholesale market to expand her business.

loans.name: Rina

texts.en:
Rina is a 40-year-old housewife who lives in the town of Maynaguri with her husband, Krishna, age 45 years. She is illiterate but can sign her name whereas her husband had education to class VIII (Grade 8) and he runs a saree business. They have two sons who assist to the same business. 

Her husband started this business with a small amount of money and a few varieties of sarees and sold the sarees door to door in their locality. But gradually they improved their business and purchased a shop where they sell. Due to lack of capital they could not maintain good stocks of sarees and their sales were not sufficient. In the locality, there is a good demand for sarees. To assist her husband’s business, Rina wants to take a loan from BJS so that they can buy a variety of sarees in a bulk. From the profit, she wants repair their house.

loans.use: To purchase variety of sarees for selling in their shop.

loans.name: Keidy Yanira

texts.es: Keidy, tiene 23 años de edad, vive en unión libre con su esposo con quien tiene un hijo y reside en el municipio de La Lima, Cortes. Hace 1 año y medio que tiene su propio negocio de una pulpería donde ofrece productos de la canasta básica como ser carnes, manteca, arroz, frijoles, lácteos, embutidos, productos  plásticos, etc. Este negocio lo tiene establecido en un local del mercado. Ella ha decidido solicitar un préstamo por 10,000 Lempiras y lo va utilizar para la compra de más productos de la canasta básica como ser refrescos, carnes, churros, productos plásticos, granos básicos, azúcar, y otros abarrotes para tener su negocio más surtido y así poder tener mayores ventas y ganancias. Su meta es crecer con su negocio y apoyar a su familia para mejorar la calidad de vida.
texts.en: Keidy is 23 years old and lives in union with her husband with whom she has a son. She lives in the town of La Lima, Cortes. For the past year and a half, she has had her own grocery store business which provides basic food products such as meat, butter, rice, beans, dairy, lunch meats, plastic products, and more. This business is located in a local market. She has decided to apply for a loan of 10,000 Lempiras which will be used to purchase more basic food products such as soft drinks, meats, churros, plastic products, grains, sugar, and others for her store to give her business more variety as well as increased sales and profits. Her goal is to grow with her business and support her family to improve their quality of life.

loans.use: to purchase basic food products such as soft drinks, meats, churros, plastic products, sugar, and others to sell.

loans.name: Champa

texts.en:
Champa is a married woman. She lives in a small town of Maynaguri (village Debinagar) in the district Jalpaiguri in their semi pacca (brick wall but straw roof) house. Her husband, Samir, is 36 years old. Champa passed X standard (Grade 10), whereas her husband received education up to class VIII (Grade 8). They have three children; one son and two daughters.  All of them are going to school.  They are in class VII (Grade 7), class VI (Grade 6) and class III (Grade 3) respectively. 

Champa runs a grocery shop with her husband. Their income is hardly enough to cover the cost of food and daily expenses. They decided to take this loan to invest in their existing business by purchasing grocery items. There is a great demand for these grocery items in their locality. She hopes that the business will be lucrative and with the profit she will be able to give financial assistance to her family and good education to her children. She has a plan to upgrade her kachha (made of mud and straw) shop to a pacca (made of brick) one.

loans.use: To purchase more grocery items for her business.

loans.name: Ashot

texts.en:
Ashot is 56 years old, and he lives in the village of Sevkar, which is in the Tavush region. Unmarried, now he lives with his mother and with his brother’s family. 

Ashot for many years used to work in the military sphere, but now he is fully engaged in farming. He takes care of his farm cattle with pleasure and with great enthusiasm. In his farm he has six cows, two calves, two piglets, fifteen chickens. He mainly sells milk and eggs, and near to the New Year period he will also manage to sell some meat. He tries to help his brother to earn a living and to take care of family.

Ashot asks a loan of AMD 1,100,000 in order to buy two more cows and also a lot of fodder for winter.

loans.use: to buy two more cows and also a lot of fodder for winter

loans.name: Karlo

texts.en:
Karlo is 57 years old and married with one grown son living with him. Karlo is jobless at the moment. His wife is employed at the local maternity hospital as a nurse, and his son is a worker at the local construction factory. They get monthly salaries, which are hardly enough for household expenses.

That is why Karlo is requesting this loan now, to start up a business. He plans to purchase a secondhand car and serve the local people as a taxi driver. Karlo hasn’t run any businesses, but he hopes his initiative will be lucrative as there is high demand for taxi services on the market. Karlo believes in his enthusiasm and wishes to improve the living standard for his family members.

loans.use: to purchase a car and start a taxi business

loans.name: Sandhya

texts.en:
Sandhya is a 30-year-old housewife who lives in the small town of Maynaguri in their own house. Her husband is a day labourer. Both of them are illiterate and just know how to sign their names. They have one son and one daughter who are in class VII (Grade 7) and in class IV (Grade 4) respectively.  

Her husband’s earning is very small and it is difficult to maintain the family.  Both of them thought to shift to another business from where the income will be more. Then Sandhya came to know about BJS and has taken a loan to purchase a cycle van for carrying people and goods in their locality. A cycle van is a type of carriage using a bicycle. Now her husband is pulling the van and earns more than previously.  Their future dream is to buy more vans to be used on a hire basis. Her full thanks go to BJS as well as Kiva for giving the loan.

loans.use: To purchase a cycle van for carrying people and goods.

loans.name: Chheng

texts.en:
Chheng is 39 years old and a resident living in the Prey Chhor district, Kampong Cham province. 

She is dedicated to a farming business to make a livelihood. Her husband helps her share the costs of living by working in the construction sites around the province. This couple has four children, three of whom still depend on their income. 

The challenge for them is that they don’t have a motorcycle for their household, so they are experiencing difficulties in fulfilling their transportation needs. For this reason, Chheng is asking for a loan amounting to USD 1,000 to buy a used motorcycle for their use. 

With this purchase, she hopes that she can minimize the costs of transportation whenever her husband goes to his workplace or they go anywhere far away from their home. 

Thanks to all kind lenders who always give her a constant support.

loans.use: to buy a used motorcycle for commuting and personal use.

loans.name: Tahima

texts.en:
Tahima, age 25, is a homemaker who stays with her husband, Sablu, in a small town of Dhupguri in Jalpaiguri. She and her husband both are uneducated, but know how to sign their names. They have three children, two of them go to school and another one is too small to go school. 

Tahima’s husband is a farmer. They have land where her husband cultivates different seasonal vegetables and sells them to the market. Tahima gives assistance to her husband in this work. 

Now they want to farm potatoes in this land. She is requesting this loan to buy potato seeds, fertilizers and pesticides for farming potatoes and to avoid contamination of insects and diseases. 

In the future, with the profit, she hopes to buy more land for expanding her business. She hopes Kiva and BJS will give her extensive support in near future.

loans.use: To buy potato seeds, fertilizers and pesticides for farming potatoes.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy wood, nails, paint, and varnish.

loans.name: Nanibala

texts.en:
Nanibala is a very courageous 43-year-old woman with many hopes. She is a housewife of Dhupguri town, District Jalpaiguri, and mother of four children. She received education until class VIII (Grade 8). Her children are pursuing their studies; two of them are pursuing BAs (bachelor in arts), and the other child is in standard XII (grade 12). 

Nanibala’s husband is associated with a cultivation business. They have their own land near their home. Due to lack of finance she couldn’t do any business on that land. She decided to take a loan and start potato cultivation, as potato is very much in demand in West Bengal and her husband has knowledge about potato cultivation.  With this loan she wants to buy potato seeds and fertilizers.

She gives hearty thanks to Kiva and BJS for funding this loan.

loans.use: To purchase potato seeds and fertilizers for potato cultivation.

loans.name: Arman

texts.en: Arman is 33 years old, and he lives in the village Azatamut, which is in the Tavush region. He is married, and he has two cheerful daughters. Arman lives with his parents, wife, and two children. Arman is a skilled and careful driver with many years of practice. For some time he has worked as a taxi driver and now he works at a private company as a driver. Together with his father’s work, they manage to earn their family living, but lately Arman’s car has been out of order and requires big expenses, which are in vain, since this car is just worn out. He asks for a loan of 1,100,000 Armenian drams in order to buy a new car, which will help him to work in comfort and earn more profit for his family.

loans.use: to buy a new car, which will help him to work in comfort and earn more profit for his family

loans.name: Odile

texts.en:
Odille is 36 years old. She is married, with six children between 2 and 18 years. 

She sells timbers, and she has been in the business for the past 14 years. She has requested a loan to buy more timber to sell. 

The profits from the business will be used to make more savings and provide food for he family.

loans.use: To buy more timber for sale.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy cement, cement blocks, iron, gravel, and sand and to pay for the cost of labor.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more goods (spare parts, engine oil)

loans.name: Armine

texts.en:
Armine lives in Sevan city which is in the Gegharkunik region. She is 42 years old and has a son and a daughter. She is divorced and she has brought up her two children alone, but very cutely and with great responsibility. 

She has her own beauty salon and she works there herself both as a manicurist and hairdresser. In this way she earns her family living and she tries to provide her children with high living conditions. Her son is already grown up and he helps his mother greatly, working as a deliveryman. Her daughter is a student in the paid division of Yerevan State Economic University.

Armine asks for a loan of 1,000,000 Armenian drams in order to develop her business and to renew the interior of her beauty salon so that she may attract more clients and have more income.

loans.use: to develop her business and to renew the interior of her beauty salon so that she may attract more clients and have more income

loans.name: Catalina

texts.es: La señora Catalina está casada y tiene un hijo, es de familia humilde y vive en la localidad de Esquilan, zona sud de la ciudad de Cochabamba; se dedica a la producción de leche cruda pero la misma es baja debido a que su ganado no están siendo muy bien alimentado, por ello solicita un crédito de Bs. 10200 para comprar alimento balanceado y soya para su ganado lo cual le beneficiaria mucho para poder incrementar sus ingresos.
texts.en:
Catalina is married and has a son. She is from a humble family who lives in the municipality of Esquilan in the southern region of the city of Cochabamba. 

She earns a living in raw milk production. However, production is low because her livestock are not being very well nourished. For this reason she is applying for a loan of 10,200 Bolivian Bolivianos to buy animal feed and soy for her cattle. This will help her to increase her income.

loans.use: to buy animal feed and soy for her cattle.

loans.name: Kimsroeurn

texts.en:
Kimsroeurn, 32, is a married woman and has two children, both of whom are attending school locally. Kimsroeurn is hardworking and honest with her daily tasks, both at the household and at her paddy fields located in Kampong Cham Province. She primarily grows and harvests rice and cassava crops to sell in the local markets in her region. Having been in this business for almost 5 years, Kimsroeurn is able to make an income of $10.00 per day, which she uses for daily meals and other commodities.

To help her further develop her farming business, Kimsroeurn has applied for a loan amounting to $1,000 US dollars to invest in planting cassavas. She believes that, through the loan support, she will be able to increase her productivity and boost additional income to secure the overall welfare of her family. She thanks lenders for their generosity and goodwill towards a poor fellow like her.

loans.use: to invest in planting cassavas

loans.name: Voeun

texts.en:
Voeun is 35 years old and a loving father of two school-aged children. He lives with his spouse and children in a rural village of Baray district, Kampong Thom province. Voeun is a hardworking person who aims to provide them a better lifestyle and ensure further education for his children. 

He is in agribusiness, primarily farming rice and cassavas to sell. He is lucky because his wife gives full support in developing their farming business. Voeun has been in this occupation for nearly 13 years and earns approximately KHR 10,000 per day.

Voeun wants to buy a motorcycle to use in the household so he can minimize daily traveling costs and satisfy his family’s transportation needs. Due to the shortage of funds, Voeun is seeking a loan in the amount of KHR 2,000,000 to buy a used motorcycle. He hopes that the loan will be granted, so that he is able to improve his living conditions.

loans.use: to buy a used motorcycle for household use.

loans.name: Garnik

texts.en:
Garnik is 62 years old. He lives in the village Agarak, which is in Gegharkunik region. His four children are already married and all they live separately with their families. Garnik lives with his wife, who his already retired. She is a housewife. 

Garnik works at the Zangezur Copper-Molybdenum Plant as an operator and at the same time he sells cow’s leather, which he buys from villagers and from butchers. Garnik says in autumn months more cattle is slaughtered and he plans to buy a lot of leather. He sells the gathered leather in Yerevan city once a month to different workshops. 

Garnik asks for a loan of 3,000 USD for the purchase of a lot of leather. This will be Garnik’s second deal with Kiva and he is sure that it will be as successful as the first one.

loans.use: purchase a lot of leather

loans.name: Obed

texts.en:
Obed is 29 years old.He is a father of one child, aged one. He sells metals and other construction materials. 

With the requested loan, he wants to buy more metals for sale. The profits from the business will be used to provide food for the family.

loans.use: To buy more metals for sale.

loans.name: Margaret

texts.en:
Margaret is a farmer, which she has been doing for 27 years. She lives in Nkubu area of eastern Kenya. She derives her income from the sale of  milk and crops. With farming, she loves the part where her produce is ready for harvesting which means that her hard work has been satisfied.

Margaret is requesting a loan from Juhudi Kimimo, which she will use to purchase a chaff cutter which will help her livestock have enough feed and enable them to produce more and hence more income earned. She chose Juhudi Kilimo for this loan because they offer low interest rates on their loans. During the training, she learned that as a small scale farmer, she should practice a culture of savings.  With the income earned from the loan, she will be able to pay school fees for her children.

loans.use: to purchase a chuff cutter

loans.name: Levan

texts.en:
Levan is 34-year-old married man. He lives with his parents, wife and sister in Batumi, the seaside of Georgia. His parents are provided with a retirement pension and his sister is a teacher at the local school. 

Levan decided to start his own business and requested a loan. The Start Up program, which is a joint initiative between Kiva and Credo, enables him to get a loan of $5,000 to renovate a flat and then rent it out. The business will be profitable since Batumi is very popular among tourists, especially in summer times.

loans.use: to renovate a flat and rent it out.

loans.name: Florence

texts.en:
Florence is a married woman and has been blessed with three kids who attend school. She lives in her own house that has electricity and piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is school fees. 

Florence operates a poultry selling business, which has been operational for over a year. She mentioned disease outbreak causing losses as a challenge in the business. Florence dreams of becoming a wholesaler of poultry in the future. 

With the 10,000 KES, Florence wants to purchase chicks and poultry feed. She joined Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase chicks and poultry feed.

loans.name: Melanya

texts.en:
Melanya is from Vanadzor town. She lives with her daughter and her husband, who is a migrant worker who tries to support his family financially. 

Three months ago, she got involved in a retail business. She has been selling cloth and dressmaking supplies to locals. The income from this activity is very important for Melanya to cover the family's daily costs. Realizing this, Melanya has applied for this loan in order to purchase new stock of clothing and dressmaking supplies. She has been approved for a loan within the framework of a new joint initiative between Kiva and SEF international. The start-up loan program provides business start-up loans with soft conditions to informal businesses that do not have access to credit products. 

The loan is very important for Melanya and she hopes for your support.

loans.use: to pay for new stock of cloth and dressmaking supplies.

loans.name: Florence

texts.en:
Florence is a married woman and has been blessed with five children who attend school. She lives at her own house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is school fees. 

She operates a poultry-selling business, which has been operational for over two years. She mentioned disease outbreak causing losses as a challenge in the business and she dreams of becoming a wholesaler of poultry in the future. 

With the KES 20,000, she wants to purchase chicks and poultry feed. She joined Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase chicks and poultry feeds

loans.name: Djantoyerela Group

texts.fr:
Djantoyerela est un regroupement de femmes du quartier Koulikoro de la ville de Koutiala qui vivent dans de grandes familles traditionnelles avec leurs maris, enfants et autres parents. Elles ont en moyenne 31 ans, sont mariées et au ont moins 5 enfants.
Ce groupe de femmes fait le commerce d’articles divers tels, les tissus, de fruits légumes, des plastiques de la friperie, etc. 
Pour augmenter la taille de leurs activités, les membres ont décidé d’intégrer le programme crédit de Soro Yiriwaso. Elles sont à leur huitième prêt de groupe. 
Tenin  première assise de la droite vers gauche, compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter une balle de friperie. Elle se procure de cette friperie au grand marché  de Koutiala les Jeudis jour de foire. Elle vend ces articles en détail et au comptant à la maison et au marché et à une clientèle diverse. 
Tandis que les autres membres du groupe comptent réaliser un bénéfice moyen de 106 000CFA  chacune au  cours de ce cycle Mme Tenin  compte réaliser  114 000FCFA.  
En plus du remboursement des prêts, elles utilisent une partie du revenu  pour faire face aux dépenses personnel et augmenter son fond de commerce.
texts.en: Djantoyerela is a group of women from the Koulikoro neighborhood in the city of Koutiala who live in large traditional families with their husbands, children and other parents. They are on average 31 years old, married, and have at least 5 children. This group of women sells diverse products such as cloths, fruits and vegetables, plastics, second hand clothing, etc. In order to increase the size of their businesses, the members decided to join the loan program of Soro Yiriwaso. They are on their eighth group loan. Tenin, the first seated from the right to the left, expects to use her loan to buy a load of second hand clothing. She gets her second hand clothing at the grand market of Koutiala on Thursdays, the day of the trade fair. She sells these items at retail from her home and at the market to a diverse clientele. While the other members of the group expect to make a monthly profit of 106,000 f CFA each throughout the course of this loan cycle, Ms. Tenin expects to make 114,000 f CFA. Along with the reimbursement of their loans, they will use a part of their revenue to deal with personal expenses and to increase their business funds.

loans.use: to purchase second hand clothes

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to increase her inventory of bowls, utensils, and other items.

loans.name: Nona

texts.en:
Nona is 48 years old and lives in the village of Ushapati with her husband, mother, brother, daughter, son, son-in-law and toddler granddaughter. 

The family runs an agricultural business and raises seven cows and five pigs. She takes good care of her livestock and sells the received milk locally. As well, Nona grows maize, grapes and nut trees on her own plot of land. Their existing income is not enough for a family of eight. 

With this start-up loan, Nona will purchase a truck and her husband will work in a transportation business. He will carry and transport a variety of goods, depending on the needs and requests of his customers. For this season, Nona’s husband will transport firewood from the forest and get a service fee. As he has the appropriate experience in this field, Nona hopes their project will be successful and lucrative.
 
Nona would like to thank all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase a truck for her husband to start working on transportation.

loans.name: Jean

texts.en: Jean is 40 years old. He is a father of four children. He owns a canteen selling tea, breads and andazi. He has spent 10 years in the business. With the loan, Jean would like to buy more flour for making more andazi and breads for sale. The profits from the business will be used to renovate the house.

loans.use: To buy more flour to make more breads and andazi for sale.

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en: Josephine is 35 years old, married, and has four children. She is requesting a loan, which she will use to buy more charcoal to sell. The profits from the business will be used for savings.

loans.use: to purchase charcoal to sell.

loans.name: Sulman

texts.en: Sulman is 23 years old, a single man who lives in Sana`a, Yemen. He is a person who has gone through many adversities in his life. He dreams of a better future and brighter world to surround him, but life in Yemen where he lives is full of challenges and difficulties. He came to think that the only way to secure his future was to establish his own micro-enterprise. With the help of his family and some friends, he was able to start a grocery business in his neighborhood. Sulman took out a loan of 150,000 YER from AMB in order to purchase grocery items and recharge phone cards, which are required by his customers. With the help of his grocery income, he will be able to contribute to improving his family's living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase grocery items and recharge phone cards, which are required by his customers.

loans.name: Mairamkan

texts.ru: Майрамкан 30 лет, замужем, вместе с супругом воспитывают 3 детей. У Майрамкан - среднее образование, в качестве основного дохода для своей семьи Майрамкан занимается животноводством, стартовав 10 лет назад, с покупки скота на 10,000 сом KGS. Благодаря упорному труду Майрамкан, в ее хозяйстве на сегодняшний день имеется: 6 дойных коров, 35 овец. Ежемесячный доход составляет 13,000 сом (KGS). В целях дальнейшего развития своего хозяйства, Майрамкан обратилась в Микрофинансовый банк «Бай –Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 70,000 сом (KGS) на покупку коров для увеличения поголовья скота. Доходы от кредита Майрамкан планирует вложить в дальнейшее приумножение количества домашней скотины, и планирует накопить средства на дальнейшее обучение детей.
texts.en: Mairamkan is 30 years old, married and raising three children together with her husband. Mairamkan has a secondary education. To provide the primary income for her family, Mairamkan is involved in animal husbandry, having started 10 years ago with a purchase of livestock with 10,000 som (KGS). Thanks to Mairamkan's hard work, today her business contains 6 dairy cows and 35 sheep. The monthly income amounts to 13,000 som (KGS). In order to further develop her business, Mairamkan requested a loan in the amount of 70,000 som (KGS) from the microfinance bank "Bai-Tushum and Partners" to buy cows to increase livestock headcount. She plans to invest the earnings from the loan into further increasing domestic livestock quantities and saving money for her children's future education.

loans.use: to buy cows

loans.name: Souzane

texts.en:
Souzane is 31 years old. She sells different items in her boutique. 

With the loan she would like to buy more lotions and cooking oil for resale. The profits from the business will be used for providing food for her family.

loans.use: To buy more lotions and cooking oil to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to repair his pedicab and buy new brake lines.

loans.name: Nurmukhamad

texts.ru:
Нурмухамад 56-летний дехканин, работающий на 0,29 га приусадебном и президентском участке земли. Он в основном выращивает овощи, в частности картофель, лук, морковь, помидор и огурец. Нурмухамад на протяжении 15 лет работает земледельческой деятельностью. Ему всегда помогает жена и дети. У Нурмухамада трое сыновей и одна дочь. Он живет со своей семьей в районе А.Джами. Нурмухамад также занимается рыбоводством. 
Сейчас Нурмухамад готовится к очередному посеву. Он запрашивает кредит для приобретения семян картофеля, помидора, моркови и огурца, а также минеральных удобрений и ГСМ. Он надеется получить хороший урожай к весне и за счет прибыли купить в дом холодильник.
texts.en: Nurmukhamad is a 56 year-old farmer, working on 0.29 hectares of land.  He primarily grows vegetables, such as potatoes, onions, carrots, tomatoes and cucumber.  Nurmukhamad has been involved in farming for 15 years.  His wife and children always help him.  Nurmukhamad has three sons and one daughter.  He lives with his family in the A. Jomi district.  Nurmukhamad is also involved in fishing.  Currently Nurmukhamad is getting ready for the next sowing.  He is requesting this loan to buy potato, tomato, carrot and cucumber seeds and also mineral fertilizers and fuel.  He hopes to get a good harvest for the spring and buy a refrigerator for his home with the profits.

loans.use: to buy potato, tomato, carrot and cucumber seeds and also mineral fertilizers and fuel

loans.name: Hasan

texts.ru: Хасану 29 лет. Он муж и отец троих детей. У него есть сын и две дочки. Хасан получил среднее специальное образование, но по специальности он не нашел работу. Хасан начал маленький бизнес в сфере торговли. Он продает зимнюю, летнюю и спортивную одежду. Он любит свою работу и хочет остаться работать в сфере торговли. Чтобы его товары покупались, и он не терял постоянных клиентов, Хасану приходиться все время обновлять свой товар. Скоро зима и люди начинают покупать зимнюю одежду. Хасан просить кредит, чтобы закупить и привести зимнюю одежду для продажи. Он привезет товар с города Душанбе и будет продавать на родном районе Вахш. Хасан надеется, что ему помогут и он приобретет новых клиентов. Он ждет Вашей помощи!
texts.en: Hasan is 29 years old.  He is a husband and has three children.  He has a son and two daughters.  Hasan obtained a secondary specialized education, but could not find a job in his field.  Hasan started a small business in the retail sphere.  He sells winter, summer and athletic clothing.  He loves his work and wants to continue working in retail.  To never lose regular customers, and ensure that his merchandise is bought, Hasan has to always update his merchandise.  He will bring merchandise from the city of Dushanbe and sell it in his native Vakhsh district.  Hasan hopes that he will be helped and will obtain new customers.  He awaits Your help!

loans.use: to purchase winter clothing

loans.name: Parviz

texts.ru:
Этому молодому мужчине 24 года. Его зовут Парвиз. Он начинающий бизнесмен. Парвиз живет с родителями. У его родителей имеется 2 гектаров земли, где они занимаются растениеводством. Большая часть жителей района Фархор занимаются растениеводством, сажают овощи, пшеницу, рис и капусту. Кроме растениеводства деятельность животноводство является тоже популярным на районе. Такие деятельности востребованы потому, что климат Таджикистана позволяет и благоприятен для развития бизнеса в такой сфере.
    Парвиз решил заняться животноводством. Он успел построить коровник, чтобы его животные не мерзли зимой. Он купил сено, жмых и одну корову. У Парвиза осталось мало средств, чтобы приобрести больше скотов, поэтому он просит ему помочь. На деньги от кредита Парвиз купит бычков и телят. Сумму, которую он просит, является не большим, потому что такой бизнес требует много средств и сил. Парвиз не стал рисковать и начал с малой суммы. Он надеется, что его поддержат, и он получит помощь!
texts.en: This young man is 24 years old.  His name is Parviz.  He is a beginner businessman.  Parviz lives with his parents.  His parents have 2 hectares of land, where they are involved in agriculture.  A majority of the Farkhor district residents are involved in agriculture, plant vegetables, wheat, rice and cabbage.  Besides agriculture, animal husbandry is also popular in the district.  These types of businesses are in demand because the climate of Tajikistan allows for and is favorable to developing businesses in this area.  Parviz decided to get involved in animal husbandry.  He was able to build a cowshed so that his livestock would not get cold in the winter.  He bought hay and other livestock feed, and one cow.  Parviz was left with little money to buy more livestock and this is why he is requesting help.  Parviz will use this loan to buy bulls and calves.  He is not requesting a large amount because this business demands a lot of money and effort.  Parviz decided not to take a risk and started with a small amount.  He hopes that he will be supported and will receive help!
