loans.use: to buy cattle to start his own business

loans.name: Moussa

texts.fr:
Monsieur Moussa est homme marié de 33 ans et père de 3 enfants. Il vit avec sa femme et ses enfants dans le quartier Torakabougou de Bougouni.
Il abandonne les études  au secondaire, au profit des activités génératrices de revenus notamment la vente d’articles de boutique apprise auprès de son oncle.
Avec une expérience de 7 ans, il maîtrise son activité. Sa boutique est située à Bougouni dans le quartier Torakabougou.
Pour renforcer son activité, il décide de prendre un nouveau prêt avec Soro Yiriwaso pour acheter 2 sacs du sucre, 3 cartons de cigarettes, 50 sachets de bonbon et 3 cartons du thé. Il est à son 3ème prêt et tous les 2 autres prêts ont été bien remboursés.
Il s’approvisionne à Bamako Capitale de République du Mali et parfois à Bougouni. Sa clientèle est composée de la population locale.
Il compte réaliser un bénéfice mensuel de 60 000 FCFA. Avec ce bénéfice il subviendra à ses besoins, payer les intérêts du prêts et agrandir sa boutique.
texts.en:
Mr. Moussa, age 33, is married with 3 children. He lives with his wife and children in the district of Torakabougou, in Bougouni. He attended school up to the secondary level then quit to begin income-generating activities such as the sale of shop products, which he learned from his uncle. 

With 7 years of experience, he has a good command of his activity. His shop is located in Bougouni, in the district of Torakabougou where he lives.

To strengthen his activity, he is seeking a new loan from Soro Yiriwaso to buy 2 bags of sugar, 3 cartons of cigarettes, 50 packets of candy and 3 cartons of tea. This is his 3rd loan cycle with the MFI, and both past loans were repaid without incident. 

He buys his stock in Bamako, the capital of the Republic of Mali, and sometimes in Bougouni. His clientele consists of locals. 

He expects to earn a monthly profit of 60,000 FCFA, which he will use to support himself, to pay the loan interest and to expand his shop.

loans.use: to buy merchandise for his shop.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for consumption expenditures for postnatal health.

loans.name: Amy

texts.fr:
Madame Amy âgée de 26 ans est mariée et mère de deux enfants. Elle  évolue dans le secteur du commerce depuis maintenant 2 ans. Elle gère une  boutique de mercerie et voudrais la renforcer en achetant de la garniture. Amy travaille de 9 heures à 19 heures, elle gère elle-même son activité. Elle est à son second crédit à l’IMCEC et veut un renouvellement de 150000FCFA. Amy appui son mari dans les charges de la famille et veille à la bonne éducation de ses enfants et cela grâce aux bénéfices acquis. 
Puisque la mercerie et les tissus entrent dans la même rubrique de couture, Amy rêve d’ouvrir parallèlement une boutique de vente de tissus, et pour pouvoir le réaliser, elle compte sur l’appui  financier de l’IMCEC.
texts.en: Ms. Amy is 26 years old, married, and the mother of two children. She has developed in this business sector for two years now. She manages a haberdashery shop and would like to strengthen it by buying some decorations. Amy works from 9 a.m. until 7 p.m. She manages her business herself. She is on her second loan at the IMCEC and would like a renewal of 150,000 f CFA. Amy supports her husband in meeting the needs of the family and ensures the good education of her children, all thanks to the profits she acquires. Since haberdashery and cloth fall under the same category of sewing, Amy dreams of opening a boutique to sell cloth at the same time, and to make this happen, she counts on the financial support of the IMCEC.

loans.use: to purchase haberdashery goods for resale.

loans.name: Jose Norvil

texts.es:
José Norvil tiene 39 años de edad, vive con su esposa e hijos, en el distrito de Cayalti, su población se dedica al cultivo de caña, arroz, comercio y ganadería, a dos horas de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

El brinda el servicio de transporte, trasladando a sus pasajeros a comunidades aledañas a su distrito, tienen otra mototaxi que lo alquilan para que lo trabajen, ha solicitado un préstamo de 3 000 nuevos soles para reparación de una de sus motos y de esta manera seguir generando ingresos para su familia.
texts.en:
José Norvil is 39 years old. He lives with his wife and children in the district of Cayalti, which is two hours from the city of Chiclayo. The people here grow sugarcane, rice raise cattle and run businesses.

José offers transportation services. He takes passengers to other communities in his district. He also owns another motor-taxi which he rents out to work. He has requested a loan of 3,000 PEN to repair one of the motorcycles, thus being able to continue generating income for his family.

loans.use: to repair a motor-taxi.

loans.name: Guadalupe Leonidas

texts.es: Guadalupe es originaria de la ciudad de Chinandega. De 45 años de edad, casada y madre de dos hijos. Es de oficio comerciante, se dedica a la venta de bebidas (gaseosas, jugos etc.). Ella inicio con su negocio desde hace diez años, vendiendo caramelos y agua helada, poco a poco  logro comprarse su primer termo. Actualmente estableció su negocio en una zona de la ciudad de manera fija, cuenta con tres termos, vende ahora jugos, gaseosas, bebidas energizantes, pan, toallas de mano entre otros.  Solicita el crédito para  comprar: cajillas de gaseosa, jugos, caramelos, entre otros, con el fin de mantener surtido los productos. Estima que el crédito le ayudara a ofrecer una diversidad de bebidas e incrementar las ventas. Su plan futuro es tener su cafetín donde pueda ofrecer distintos tipos de frescos naturales, comidas etc.
texts.en:
Guadalupe is a native of the city of Chinandega. She is 45 years old, married and the mother of two children. She is a businesswoman who sells drinks (soft drinks, juice, etc.) She started this business 10 years ago, selling candy and ice water. Little by little she was able to buy her first water cooler.

Today she has her business in a permanent spot in the center of the city and she has three coolers. She sells juices, soft drinks, energy drinks, bread, napkins, etc.

Guadalupe is requesting a loan to buy cases of soft drinks, juice and candy to maintain her stock. She believes that the loan will help her as she will offer a greater variety of products and will increase her sales. Her future plan is to own a cafe where she can sell different kinds of natural drinks, meals, etc.

loans.use: to buy cases of soft drinks, juice, candies etc.

loans.name: Rose

texts.en:
Rose is a businesswoman in the countryside within Kyabugimbi-Bushenyi, where she has been for the last thirteen years. She trades in agricultural produce on a small scale and she works seven days a week. In addition to the produce business, she also buys and sells cattle at a profit, which has helped her to cater for the needs of the family. She started doing business with the hope of earning enough income which she would use to cater for the needs of her family. 

Rose would like to use this loan (3,000,000 UGX) to buy more produce, in the form of maize and beans, to sell so that she can use the profits realized to educate her children. Her clients are mainly school owners who buy beans and maize as food for their students. Her biggest challenge is delayed payments, since some people take items on credit with the hope of paying back in time, which they never do. Depite the challenge of delayed payments, Rose describes herself as an open-minded person who will expand her business to greater levels.

loans.use: To buy produce to sell

loans.name: Theoneste

texts.en:
Theoneste is 52 years old. He is married, with four children. 

He sells different merchandise items, and with this loan, he wants to add new items, such as TVs and refrigerators.  He has many orders for those items. 

The profits from his business will be used to reinvest in the same business.

loans.use: To buy TVs and refrigerators to fill customers' orders.

loans.name: Anita Del Rosario

texts.es: Doña Anita es una humilde señora de 44 años de edad, originaria de la ciudad de Estelí. Madre soltera de un hijo, que con esfuerzo ha logrado salir adelante para brindarle una mejor vida a su pequeña familia. Es de oficio docente, dedicada a brindar servicio de educación primaria el cual le ha generado ingresos para mantener el sustento de su familia. Su meta próxima es mejorar la infraestructura de su vivienda. Solicita el crédito de saneamiento para mejorar las condiciones sanitarias de su hogar, con el fin de brindar a su familia una mejor seguridad e higiene. Estima que el crédito le será muy beneficioso ya que lograra un mejor  estado en su hogar. Su plan futuro es ofrecerle a su familia una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Anita is a modest woman of 44 years old. She is a native of Estelí. She is the single mother of one child, who with effort has managed to get ahead offering a better life for her small family. She is a teacher, working in a Primary school which generates the money she needs for her family.

Her next goal is to improve the infrastructure of her house. She is requesting a loan to work on the plumbing to improve the sanitary conditions of her house. She wants to provide her family with more security and hygienic conditions. Anita feels that the loan will be very beneficial as it will improve the condition of her house. Her plan for the future is to provide her family with a better quality of living.

loans.use: to improve the sanitary conditions of her home.

loans.name: Tabitha

texts.en:
Tabitha is a Kiva borrower. She describes herself as a serious business lady. 

She operates a retail store where she sells clothes. Her business is located in a strategic place, and her primary customers are local residents. She describes her biggest business challenge to be transport costs. 

She will use the KES 13,440 loan to buy a gas cooker to enable her family to cook more efficiently at home. 

She hopes that in the future, she will have a big clothes store.

loans.use: buy a gas cooker for home

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more tin tomatoes, canned foods, and cooking items for resale.

loans.name: Esther

texts.en: Esther is 33 years old. She is married with four children, aged between 11 and 15 years old. She sells milk and has been in the business for the past six years. With the loan, she would like to buy more liters of milk to sell. She plans to use the profits for providing food for the family.

loans.use: To buy more milk to sell.

loans.name: Marie Joyeuse

texts.en:
Marie Joyeuse is 35 years old. She is married with four children. 

With the loan, she wants to buy more sodas and beers for sale. The profits from the business will be used to make savings and provide food for the family.

loans.use: To buy more sodas and beers for sale.

loans.name: Joyeuse

texts.en: Joyeuse is married with two children. She sells mattresses and has spent two years in the business. She requested a loan to buy more mattresses for resale. The profits from the business will be used to build a house.

loans.use: to buy more mattresses for resale.

loans.name: Sonia

texts.en:
Sonia is a 51-year-old married woman living with her husband and two children. In 1995, she started to work as a tailor, and she is much endowed at her profession. In parallel, and seeing the fact that Sonia and her family suffer from lack of financials, she works at producing homemade food which she sells to restaurants. 

And today, Sonia is seeking to improve her operations and increase her productivity by purchasing a new tailoring machinery. She will acquire it thanks to the loan she is asking for from Kiva's partner, Vitas s.a.l.

Sonia is a very optimistic person who always looks for the best, and she is sure that the loan will positively impact her business and change her family’s life to become contented.

loans.use: purchasing a new tailoring machinery.

loans.name: Anastase

texts.en: Anastase is 32 years old. He is married with three children. He sells different items in the business. But with the loan, he would like to buy more sodas and cooking oil for resale. The profits from the business will be used to renovate the house.

loans.use: to buy more sodas and cooking oil for resale.

loans.name: Thuy

texts.en: Thuy, 38, lives in a small house in Ho Chi Minh City with her family, including a daughter and her husband. Her husband is a mechanical worker. Thuy earns money through her business, selling cosmetic products for people in her community. She started this business seven years ago. She would like to get a loan, with which to buy good-quality products to sell and meet her customers' needs. She also hopes her business will ensure that her family members, and especially her child, will have a better education and a better future.

loans.use: to buy good-quality cosmetic products to sell at her store.

loans.name: Dinh

texts.en: She is requesting a loan to expand her business activities, by creating a new shop to sell household products and vegetables. The previous loan helped her to run her current business smoothly. She hopes her new activity will help her generate a higher income, which would assist her in improving her family's living conditions.

loans.use: to buy household products and vegetables to sell at her store.

loans.name: Oumue K.

texts.en:
Oumue K. is 43 years old and lives in Montserrado County, which has the largest commercial city in Liberia. She is married and has four children between the ages of 7 and 27. All of her children live at home. Three are in school, while the oldest one is out of high school and attending university. 

For two years now she has been selling fashion clothes in the local market. She started her business with a loan from a friend five years ago. She is now requesting a loan to purchase more fashion clothes such as blouses, jeans, trousers, etc. for her business. She plans to expand her business to help her children in the future.

loans.use: to purchase fashion clothes such as blouses, jeans, trousers, etc.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more clothes, shoe, and lappa for her business.

loans.name: Rugiatu

texts.en:
Meet 23-year-old Rugiatu from the Jui eastern area in Freetown. She is single, with two children.  

For the past five years, Rugiatu has run a slippers business. She began her business because she wanted to create income to support her home.  She works at the business from 8 a.m. until 7 p.m., 7 days per week. She says that the main challenge to her business is lack of capital to expand.

Rugiatu requires a loan to purchase more slippers to expand her business. She hopes that the extra income from this loan will allow her to change her status of living and increase her business.

In the future, Rugiatu plans to expand her business more. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to purchase more slippers to expand her business.

loans.name: Khadafi W.

texts.en:
Khadafi W. is married and has two children, ages 5 and 8. His children are currently attending school and living at home. His wife sells fashion clothes.
  
Khadafi W. runs a shop selling goods such as Lappa (African cloths). He describes himself as a business-minded person. He started his business six years ago, using 50,000 LRD, which he borrowed from his parents. Typically, he works 10 hours per day at his business and transports his goods to his shop by bus. He cites his greatest challenge as not earning enough income. He is proud of his business because he supports his family from his business.

Using the proceeds from this loan, he intends to purchase more Lappa. In the future, he plans to open another shop. He sincerely thanks you in advance for your support.

loans.use: to purchase more Lappa (African cloths)

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase fabrics and sewing materials to make clothes for sale

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase additional amounts of furniture woods.

loans.name: Ali

texts.en:
Ali is a 21-year-old Lebanese single man. He has been working as a private teacher for the past three years. In parallel, he is pursuing his education at the university. Ali’s only concern is to be able to gather enough money and reimburse his learning fees to continue his education peacefully. But since Ali’s income is becoming insufficient due to the expenses that increased, he is eager today to borrow a youth loan from Kiva's partner, Vitas s.a.l.

He states that with the funds, he will pay his university fees, and therefore be able to avoid getting in trouble with the management. Ali’s dream is to graduate and start his career at a reputable company where he earns a good income and lives at good standards.

loans.use: to pay for his university fees.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase second-hand televisions for resale

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more spare parts, car batteries, and engine oil to increase his inventory.

loans.name: Cristina Amalia

texts.es: Cristina de 41 años de edad vive en casa propia con su esposo y sus dos hijos de 8 y 7 años de edad ellos estudian actualmente, desde hace 4 años se dedica a la venta y elaboración de  antojitos: tostadas de papas, yuca, plátanos, atoles, etc. su negocio lo tiene ubicado en su lugar de residencia, con lo que obtiene de su trabajo y con la ayuda de su esposo logran solventar algunos gastos de su hogar, Cristina está solicitando un crédito para la compra de materia prima como: plátanos, yuca, elotes, papas, harinas, aceite, etc. para la elaboración de estos alimentos y asi poder seguir con su negocio y poderle dar a su familia una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Cristinia is 41 years old and lives in her own house with her husband and two children.  They are ages 8 and 7 and are currently in school.  She has been working making and selling food for 4 years, including potato tostadas, yuca, bananas, and atole (a cornflour-based drink).  Her business is based in her home and allows her and her husband to cover their household expenses.

Cristina is asking for a loan to buy cooking supplies such as bananas, yuca, corn, potatoes, flour, oil, and other things.  This will allow her to make food, continue running her business, and give her family a better quality of life.

loans.use: buy bananas, yuca, corn, potatoes, flour, oil, etc.

loans.name: Isatu

texts.en:
Meet Isatu.  She is 36 years old and from the Jui eastern area in Freetown. She is married, with four children.  

In 2003, Isatu established her retail business. She began her business because she wanted to generate a permanent source of income to maintain her family.   She works at the business from 8 a.m. until 7 p.m., 7 days per week. She says that the main challenge to her business is insufficient capital to expand.

Isatu requires a loan to purchase more palm oil and beans to expand her business. She hopes the extra income from this loan will allow her to pay her children's school fees and increase her business. 

In the future, Isatu plans to open a foodstuffs table. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to purchase more palm oil and beans to expand her business.

loans.name: Isata

texts.en:
Meet Isata.  She is 26 yeas old and from the Jui eastern area in Freetown. She is married, with two children.  

In 2003, Isata established her green vegetables business. She began her business because she dropped out from school, so she had to do business to sustain her family.   She works at the business from 8 a.m. until 7 p.m., 7 days per week. She says the main challenge to her business is insufficient capital to expand her business.

Isata requires a loan in order to purchase assorted drinks, cigarettes, and pure water for resale. She hopes that the extra income from this loan will allow her to take care of her family's welfare and increase her business. 

In the future, Isata plans to open a foodstuffs table. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to purchase assorted drinks, cigarettes, and pure water for resale.

loans.name: Ishaitu

texts.en:
Meet 34-year-old Ishaitu from Jui eastern area in Freetown. She is married with one child. For the past 13 years, Ishaitu has established a medical drugs business. She began her business because she wants to empower herself.  She works at the business from 8:00 AM until 7:00 PM, 7 days per week. She is very hard working and desires to improve her standard of living.

Ishaitu requires a loan in order to purchase medical drugs such as blood syrup, malarial drugs and pain tablets to expand her business. She hopes that the extra income from this loan will allow her to start a savings account and increase her business. In the future, Ishaitu plans to expand her business more. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to purchase medical drugs such as blood syrup, malarial drugs and pain tablets to expand her business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase rice, oil, pepper, and charcoal

loans.name: Sia

texts.en:
Meet Sia -- she is 42 years old and comes from the Jui eastern area in Freetown. She is married and has two children. Sia established her retail food sales business in 1998. She began her business, because she wanted to generate a permanent source of income. She works at the business from 8:00am until 7:00pm, seven days per week. She says that the main challenge to her business is insufficient capital with which to expand her business.

Sia requires a loan, in order to purchase more palm oil and beans, to expand her business. She hopes that the extra income from this loan will allow her to change her standard of living and increase her business. In the future, Sia plans to open a foodstuff sales table. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to purchase more palm oil and beans, to expand her business.

loans.name: Kurbonbuvy

texts.ru: Курбонбуви единственная кормилица своих 5 детей. Она разведена. Курбонбуви еще была молодой, когда научилась у своей матери, шитью национальных матрасов «курпача». Она изучила все тонкости этого дела. Данное время она занимается шитьем «курпача». Она в течение 1 дня шьёт 2 «курпача». Она работает 28 дней в один месяц. Курбонбуви этим зарабатывает на жизнь. Ее доход маленький и поэтому не хватает для того, чтобы провести свадебное торжество своего сына. Она запрашивает займ на сумму 5000 сомони для проведения свадебного торжества. Она мечтает, чтобы свадьба ее сына была пышной и он стал счастливым. Она ждет ваше милосердие.
texts.en: Kurbonbuvy is the sole provider for her five children.  She is divorced.  Kurbonbuvy was young when she learned to sew national mattresses "kurpacha" from her mother.  He learned all of the nuances of this trade.  Currently, she is involved in sewing "kurpacha."  She sews 2 "kurpacha" in one day.  She works 28 days in a month.  She is requesting a loan in the amount of 5000 somoni to hold a wedding.  She dreams that her son's wedding will be plush and that he will be happy.  She awaits your mercy.

loans.use: to hold a wedding for her son

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more car tires to increase  his inventory

loans.name: Las Morenas Group

texts.es: El grupo lo conforman tres mujeres emprendedoras y luchadoras una de ellas es Martha mujer de 32 años de edad, casada, con dos hijos bajo su cargo, su negocio es una pulpería ubicada en su domicilio desde hace 2 años. Tiene de ser cliente de la institución 1 años. El crédito lo está requiriendo para la compra de granos básicos como arroz, azúcar, aceite, frijoles, jabón, gaseosa, chiverías, etc.  María de los Angeles mujer de 31 años su negocio es la elaboración y venta de hamacas y leche por galón, María Isabel mujer de 42 años su negocio es una pulpería.
texts.en:
This group is made up of 3 enterprising and hardworking women.  Martha is one of these women and is 32 years old, married, and has two dependent children.  She has had a convenience store located in her home for 2 years.  She has been involved with Kiva for 1 year.

She is in need of this loan to buy basic groceries such as rice, sugar, oil, beans, soap, soda, Chiveria brand drinks, etc.  Also pictured are María de los Angeles (who is 31 years old and works making and selling hammocks and also selling milk by the gallon) and María Isabel (who is 42 years old and also has a convenience store).

loans.use: buy basic groceries such as rice, sugar, oil, beans, soap, soda, and Chiveria brand drinks.

loans.name: Mbalu

texts.en:
Meet Mbalu -- she is 30 years old and comes from the Jui eastern area, in Freetown. She is married and has three children. Nine years ago, Mbalu established her local food business. She began her business, because she wanted to generate a permanent source of income. She works at the business from 8:00am until 7:00pm, seven days per week. She says that the main challenge to her business is insufficient capital with which to expand her business.

Mbalu requires a loan in order to purchase more cassava, potatoes and native rice, to expand her business. She hopes that the extra income from this loan will allow her to change her standard of living and increase her business. In the future, Mbalu plans to open a big shop. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to purchase more cassava, potatoes and native rice, to expand her business

loans.name: Sarrah

texts.en:
Meet Sarrah, a 25-year-old from Jui eastern area in Freetown. She is single with one child.  For four years, Sarrah has run a retail business. She began her business because she wants to create a source of income to support her child.  She works at the business from 8:00 AM until 7:00 PM, seven days per week. She says that the main challenge for her business is insufficient capital to expand her business.

Sarrah requires a loan in order to purchase more palm oil and soap to expand her soap-making business. She hopes that the extra income from this loan will allow her to change her status of living and increase her business. In the future, Sarrah plans to open a food stuff table. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to purchase more palm oil and soap to expand her soap-making business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more auto parts, engine oil, etc., to improve her business.

loans.name: Remmy

texts.en:
Meet Remmy. She is 47 years old from Jui eastern area in Freetown. She is married with 2 children. In 2000, Remmy established her retail business. She began her business because she wanted to generate a permanent source of income. She works at the business from 8:00 a.m. until 7:00 p.m., 7 days per week. She says that the main challenge to her business is insufficient capital to expand her business.

Remmy requires a loan in order to purchase more palm oil and coal nuts to expand her business. She hopes that the extra income from this loan will allow her to take care of her children's education and increase her business. 

In the future, Remmy plans to open a food stuff table. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to purchase more palm oil and coal nuts to expand her business.

loans.name: Adama

texts.en:
Meet Adama. she is 38 years old from Jui, eastern area in Freetown. She is married with 2 children. For the past 10 years, Adama established her retails business. She began her business because she wanted to generate a permanent source of income. She works at the business from 8:00 am until 7:00 pm, 7 days per week. She says that the main challenge to her business is insufficient capital to expand her business.

Adama requires a loan in order to purchase more palm oil and clothing material to expand her business. She hopes that the extra income from this loan will allow her to change her status of living and increase her business. In the future, Adama plans to open a big clothing shop. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to purchase more palm oil and clothing material to expand her business.

loans.name: Jimmy Winston

texts.es:
Jimmy Wiston tiene 33 años de edad, vive junto a su esposa en el distrito de Pomahuaca, su población se dedica al cultivo de frutales y ganadería a dos horas de la ciudad de Jaén, ubicada en la Región Cajamarca, sierra norte del Perú.

Con la ayuda de su esposa se dedican a la crianza y venta de aves de corral, El brinda el servido de transporte en su mototaxi llevando a sus clientes a las zonas aledañas a su comunidad, ha solicitado un préstamo de 1 000 nuevos soles para darle mantenimiento a su vehículo y de esta manera seguir brindando el servicio de una manera segura, y una segunda parte para alimentos balanceados para engorde de sus animales y ofrecerlos a un mejor precio.
texts.en:
Jimmy Wiston is 33 years old and lives with his wife in the Pomahuaca district.  Much of the local population works growing fruit and raising livestock.  They are two hours from the city of Jaén, which is in the Cajamarca region within the northern mountains of Peru.

With the help of his wife, he works raising and selling domestic birds.  He also works as a taxi driver giving his customers rides to places close to his community.

Jimmy Wiston has asked for a loan of 1,000 sols to use to maintain his vehicle and in this way continue to offer his transportation services in a safe and secure way.  He will also use the money to buy wholesome food for his animals so as to help them gain weight and allow him to obtain a better price for them.

loans.use: maintain his vehicle and buy basic foods.

loans.name: Banco Mujer La Rosa Group

texts.es: Sandra es integrante de Banco Mujer La Rosa, tiene 40 años, es madre de tres hijos y vive en unión libre con el padre de sus hijos.  Ella y toda su familia son ganaderos y agricultores, desde siempre  han trabajado en el campo, y esa es la fuente de ingresos económicos para su familia.  Doña Sandra se dedica a la cría de ganado lechero y tiene una pequeña lechería.  Este es el sexto crédito que solicita a Fundación Mujer y los préstamos anteriores le permitieron crear su propio negocio, y que hasta el día de hoy es una ayuda importante para poder darle el estudios a sus hijos. Está nueva inyección de capital será para comprar más teneros y aumentar su producción.  Ella espera salir adelante, seguir colaborando con los estudios de sus hijos y mejorar las condiciones de vida, y las de todas sus compañeras. Con ella están 2 socias mas que van a invertir en actividades agropecuarias.
texts.en:
40-year old Sandra is a member of Banco Mujer La Rosa. She is in a common-law relationship, and she and her partner have three children. Sandra and the rest of her family raise animals and farm the land, something they have been doing for years. This is the way the family earns a living.

Sra. Sandra raises dairy cows and has a small dairy. This is the sixth loan she has sought from Fundación Mujer. Her previous loans allowed her to create her own business which up to the present has proved a great help in providing for the education of her children.

With the new injection of money she plans to buy more calves and increase production. She hopes to make progress, continue helping pay for her children's education, and improve her standard of living as well as that of her companions. With Sra. Sandra are two other members who are also going to use the loan for agriculture and livestock.

loans.use: Buy calves and animal feed

loans.name: Martha

texts.en:
Meet Martha; she is 23 years old and comes from the Jui eastern area, in Freetown. She is single and has two children. In 2006, Martha established her snacks business. She began her business, because she wanted to generate a permanent source of income. She works at the business from 8:00am until 7:00pm, seven days per week. She says that the main challenge to her business is insufficient capital with which to expand her business.

Martha requires a loan, in order to purchase more fish, cooking oil and chicken, to expand her business. She hopes that the extra income from this loan will allow her to change her standard of living and increase her business. In the future, Martha plans to open a restaurant. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to expand her business, by purchasing more fish, cooking oil and chicken

loans.name: Dany

texts.es:
Dany tiene 34 años de edad vive junto a su esposo en el distrito de La Matanza, una comunidad tranquila que su población se dedica al comercio de animales menores, y agricultura, que pertenece a Morropon, a dos horas de la ciudad e Piura.

Ella se dedica a la venta de cerveza y chicha de jora, su negocio está ubicado en su domicilio, nos explica que realiza esta actividad desde que se caso y así contribuye con su esposo con los gastos de su familia.

Es una madre emprendedora, ha solicitado un préstamo de 2 000 nuevos soles para comprar insumos para la elaboración de chicha y así tener mayor producción para ofrecer a sus clientes, generando mayores ingresos para su familia.
texts.en:
Dany is 34 years old. She lives with her husband in La Matanza district, a quiet community where residents work selling small animals and farming. It belongs to Morropon, two hours' distance form the city of Piura.

She works selling beer and chicha de jora (a traditional drink made from corn). Her business is located in her home. She explains that she has been doing this ever since she got married and in this way helps her husband with their family expenses.

She is an enterprising mother. She has requested a 2,000 nuevos soles loan to buy supplies to make chicha in order to improve production for her customers. This will allow her to generate more income for her family.

loans.use: to buy supplies to make chicha de jora (a traditional drink).

loans.name: Amarilis

texts.es:
Amarilis de 46 años de edad, habita al sur de la ciudad de Barranquilla y es madre de 2 hijos en las edades de 14 y 18 años. Ella se dedica al comercio de mercancías variadas, especialmente de artículos de miscelánea desde hace 3 años, pues por ser madre cabeza de familia, tiene la responsabilidad total de la educación y crianza de sus hijos, para hacer de ellos personas exitosas. 
Amarilis hace sus compras de contado a proveedores de la ciudad, que le ofrezcan los mejores precios y sus ventas también las realiza de contado, todos los días, desde las 9 de la mañana hasta las 9 de la noche. Sus principales clientes son sus propios vecinos y los referidos por sus familiares, que cada día hacen crecer sus ventas, aunque su mayor desafío, para responder a la demanda, es tener el suficiente capital de trabajo para hacer una oferta ajustada a sus necesidades. Esta es la razón por la cual acude a un credikiva, primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, mediante el cual comprará productos de aseo personal, colonias, dulcería, lencería, productos que algunos les dan mayor rentabilidad y otros mayor liquidez. Con su credikiva logrará una mayor variedad y comprará mucho más de lo que compra con su propio dinero, haciendo así de su credikiva su mejor inversión.
texts.en:
Amarillis is 46 years old and lives south of the town of Barranquilla. She has two children aged 18 and 14. She has earned her living selling a variety of goods for three years. As she is the head of the household, she is totally responsible for bringing up and educating her children and making them successful people.

Amarillis buys the goods on account from merchants in the town who sell them to her at good prices. She sells them also on account every day from 9 in the morning to 9 at night. Her main customers are her neighbours and people referred to her by family members. Her sales increase daily, despite the problem she has of insufficient capital to keep up with demand.

For this reason Amariilis has approached the Fundación Mario Santo Domingo for a loan, her first with the institution. She plans to use the money to buy personal hygiene products, cologne, candy, underwear, and other products that are profitable. She will be able to buy a greater variety than she would have using her own money, so her loan will be a very good investment.

loans.use: Buy personal hygiene productsm cologne, candy and underwear

loans.name: Turaje Group

texts.fr:
Anastasie fait partie du groupe  Turaje et  habite à Bujumbura. Elle a 50 et est mariée à Jacob. Ensemble ils ont 4 enfants  âgés de 19 à 28 ans, dont 3 étudient. 

Elle fait le commerce de riz, haricot, huile de palme,…   depuis 17 ans. 

Elle est à son cinquième  crédit à Turame. Avec le crédit KIVA qu’elle obtient, elle  va  augmenter son capital et acheter une grande quantité de riz, de haricot, de l’huile de palme,…  à revendre pour gagner plus. 

Dans les prochaines  années, elle  voudrait être un grossiste de produits vivriers (riz, haricot, huile de palme,…)
texts.en:
Anastasie is part of the gorup Turaje and lives in Bujumbura. She is 50 years old and is married to Jacob. Together they have 4 children aged from 19 to 28 years old, of whom 3 study.

She has been selling rice, beans, palm oil,... for 17 years.

She is on her fifth loan with Turame. With the Kiva loan that she receives, she is going to increase her capital and buy a large quantity of rice, beans, palm oil,... to resell to make more.

In the coming years, she would like to be a wholesaler of food products (rice, beans, palm oil,...).

loans.use: to increase her capital and buy a large quantity of rice, beans, palm oil,... to resell to make more.

loans.name: Dahouda

texts.fr: Mr Dahouda pour subvenir aux besoins de la famille(01 enfant de 04ans et une femme revendeuse) a commencé la vente des produits de quincailleries. Il s'approvisionne chez les grossistes et sollicite son premier crédit pour renforcer son stock de marchandises. Il espère agrandir le stock et assurer les besoins vitaux de la famille. Il est âgé de 37ans avec une ancienneté de d'01an dans l'activité.
texts.en: To meet the needs of his family (one 4-year old child and a wife who is a reseller) Mister Dahouda started selling hardware store products. He gets his supplies at the wholesalers and is requesting his first loan to strengthen his stock of merchandise. He hopes to expand his stock and ensure his family's essential needs. He is 37 years old and has 1 year's experience in his business.

loans.use: to buy hardware store products.

loans.name: Jose Angel

texts.es:
José, está muy a gusto con la atención que se le ha dado, y como ya está preparando todo para sembrar maíz y frijol, ha optado por invertir nuevamente en la compra de abono, pesticida, plaguicida y pagara la mano de obra que necesita para sembrar y recolectar la cosecha, esto le facilitara satisfacer a sus clientes, una mejor cosecha y mejores ganancias.
Con el capital que se le dio anteriormente aumento su cosecha, su situación económica mejoro, su familia tiene acceso a mejor salud y mejor alimentación.
texts.en:
José is very happy with the assistance he has received, and since he is already preparing everything for planting corn and beans, he has decided to invest again in the purchase of compost, pesticides and insecticides, and to pay for the labor he needs to plant and collect the harvest. This will enable him to satisfy his customers, and to get a better harvest and better earnings.

With the money he previously received, he increased his harvest, his economic situation improved, and his family has access to better health and food.

loans.use: to buy compost, pesticides and insecticides, and to pay for labor.

loans.name: Salamatu

texts.en:
Meet 36-year-old Salamatu from the Jui eastern area in Freetown. She is married, with two children.  

For the past five years, Salamatu has operated a building-materials business. She began her business because she wanted to empower herself.  She works at the business from 8 a.m. until 7 p.m., 7 days per week. She is very hard-working and desires to improve her standard of living

Salamatu requires a loan in order to purchase more building materials, like paint and plumbing equipment, to expand her business. She hopes that the extra income from this loan will allow her to start a savings account and increase her business. 

In the future, Salamatu plans to expand her business more. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to buy more building materials, like paint and plumbing equipment

loans.name: Mariama

texts.en:
Meet Mariama. She is in her late 50s and is from Jui, which is in the eastern area of Freetown. She is married with four children.  

For the past 10 years, Mariama has established her retail business. She began her business because she wanted to generate a permanent source of income. She works at the business from 8 a.m. until 7 p.m. seven days per week. She says that the main challenge to her business is insufficient capital to expand her business.

Mariama requires a loan in order to purchase more palm oil and gari (pickled vegetables) to expand her business. She hopes that the extra income from this loan will allow her to take care of her family's welfare and increase her business. In the future, Mariama plans to open a foodstuff table. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to purchase more palm oil and gari (pickled vegetables) to expand her business.

loans.name: Abibatu

texts.en:
Abibatu is 38 years old and married with one child. She runs a domestic products business in Waterloo, which is in the eastern area of Freetown. She started her business because she wanted to improve the living conditions of her family.  

She's been in this business since after the war and sells glass cups, knives and food containers. She says that her main business challenge is a non-ideal business location.

Abibatu has requested this loan through BRAC Sierra Leone to purchase more spoons and a variety of food containers for resale. She says that the extra income from this loan will help her increase her business and enable her to take care of her family. In the future, she would like to open a big shop. She is grateful for your support.

loans.use: to purchase more spoons and a variety of food containers for resale.

loans.name: Ramatu

texts.en:
Meet 47-year-old Ramatu from Waterloo, which is in the eastern area of Freetown. She is married with five children.  

In 2010, Ramatu established her palm oil business. Previously, she was a housewife, but she began her business because she wanted to empower herself. She works at the business from 8 a.m. until 7 p.m. seven days per week. She says that the main challenges to her business are insufficient capital to expand her business and a poor road network.

Ramatu requires a loan in order to purchase more palm oil and gari (pickled vegetables) to expand her business. She hopes that the extra income from this loan will allow her to improve her standard of living and increase her business. In the future, Ramatu plans to expand her business more. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to purchase more palm oil and gari (pickled vegetables) to expand her business.

loans.name: Isidro

texts.es:
Isidro, es casado tiene dos hijos , vive en casa propia la misma se encuentra ubicada en la comunidad Arajllanga provincia Aroma del departamento de La Paz.
El estudio hasta el nivel primaria. El es agricultor y tambien se dedica a la elaboracion de queso.
El crédito lo requiere para compra de una vaca lechera, para poder incrementar su producción de queso y mejorar sus ingresos.
El sueño de Isidro es tener mucho vacas lecheras y asi poder tener mejor calidad de vida para su familia hacer construir mas cuartos para su familia
Es el segundo que solicita crédito junto a IMPRO y la primera vez con KIVA.
texts.en:
Isidro is married with two children. He lives in his own home in the community of Arajllanga, which is in the province of Aroma in the department of La Paz. Isidro finished elementary school. He works making cheese.

Isidro is requesting this loan to buy a dairy cow in order to increase his production of cheese and improve his income. 

Isidro says that his dream is to have a lot of dairy cows so that his family can have a better quality of life and build more rooms in their house. 

This is Isidro’s second loan with the field partner and the first loan with Kiva.

loans.use: to buy a dairy cow in order to increase his production of cheese and improve his income.

loans.name: Messamesso

texts.fr: Messamesso est une femme de 34ans. Elle est mariée à un pasteur et mère de 02 enfants(05 et 02ans). L’ainé est pour le moment scolarisé. Pour prêter main forte à son conjoint dans les charges familiales, elle revend des pagnes, des livres et CD dans une baraque. Le premier prêt demandé à WAGES lui servira d'acheter plus de marchandises afin de satisfaire les clients. Elle souhaite agrandir son activité et entretenir ses enfants.
texts.en: Messamesso is a 34 year old woman. She is married to a pastor and mother to 2 children (5 and 2 years old). The oldest goes to school for now. To lend a hand to her spouse with the family responsibilities, she resells pagne cloth (colorful West African fabric), books and CDs in a shed. The first loan requested from WAGES will help her to buy more merchandise in order to satisfy her customers. She hopes to expand her business and support her children.

loans.use: to buy books, CDs and other products.

loans.name: Apélété

texts.fr: Revendeur de produits congelés depuis 2008, Apeleté sollicite un crédit à WAGES pour acheter plus de marchandises. Il espère augmenter son secteur d'activité et mettre sa famille dans de bonnes conditions. A 33ans, il est père de 03 enfants(8,5 et 2ans) dont 02 scolarisés.
texts.en: Apélété has worked reselling frozen products since 2008, and has requested a loan from WAGES to buy more merchandise. He hopes to expand his area of business and improve his family’s conditions. He is 33 years of age and has three children (aged 8, 5 and 2), two of whom are in school.

loans.use: To buy frozen products

loans.name: Blanca Herminia

texts.es:
Blanca, como toda una buena administradora de su negocio sabe que se aproxima una época donde la demanda de los productos que ofrece aumentan y es por eso que ha decidido solicitar otro crédito para comprar carteras, bolsos, etc., para surtir el negocio y que sus clientes encuentren lo que están buscando.
El préstamo anterior le permitió tener más clientes satisfechos, mejores ganancias, cancelar sus cuotas a tiempo, mejorar la alimentación de su familia, y darles una salud de calidad.
texts.en:
Blanca, like a good business manager, knows that a season is approaching when demand for the products she offers increases. That is why she has decided to apply for another loan to buy purses, handbags, etc., to stock her business so that her customers find what they are looking for.

The previous loan allowed her to have more satisfied customers and better earnings, to make her payments on time, to improve her family's diet and give them good health.

loans.use: to buy purses and handbags.

loans.name: Kayutta

texts.en:
Meet 42-year-old Kayutta from the Waterloo Eastern area in Freetown. She is married with two children.  

In 2010, Kayutta established her palm oil business.  She began her business because she wanted to create her daily survival.  She works at the business from 8:00 am until 7:00 pm, 7 days per week. She says that the main challenges to her business are insufficient capital to expand her business and a poor road network.

Kayutta requires a loan to purchase more palm oil and gari to expand her business. 

She hopes the extra income from this loan will allow her to change her status of living, and increase her business. 

In the future, Kayutta plans to expand her business more. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to purchase more palm oil and gari to expand her business

loans.name: Hannah

texts.en:
Meet 25-year-old Hannah from the Waterloo western rural area in Freetown. She is married with three children; her children are currently attending school. 

Seven years ago, Hannah established her fabric business. She began her business because she needed to create income to support the home. She works at the business 12 hours per day and 7 days per week. She says the main challenge to her business is the lack of enough capital to run her business.

Hannah requires a loan to buy more fabric to expand her business. 

She hopes the extra income from this loan will allow her to increase her business and have a permanent business location. 

In the future, Hannah plans to own a big shop. She thanks your for your support.

loans.use: to buy more fabric to expand her business.

loans.name: Kai

texts.en:
Meet Kai; she is in her early 30's and is from the Waterloo Eastern area in Freetown. She is married, with two children.  

In 2007, Kai established her palm oil business. She got married at an early age, and she began her business because she wanted to empower herself.  She works at the business from 8:00 am until 7:00 pm, 7 days per week. She says that the main challenges to her business are insufficient capital to expand her business and a poor road network.

Kai requires a loan to purchase more palm oil and gari to expand her business. 

She hopes the extra income from this loan will allow her to educate her children and increase her business. 

In the future, Kai plans to expand her business more. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to purchase more palm oil and gari to expand her business.

loans.name: Sabenty Iv Group

texts.en:
Kadiatu is the featured leader of this group of entrepreneurs. Kadiatu was born in northern Sierra Leone 40 years ago. She is married to a farmer and the couple has two children who are attending primary and secondary schools. Kadiatu sells market-food – peppers, onions, Maggi (used to give sauce a sweet taste), rice, groundnuts, etc. and has been doing this business for many years now. 

With the help of this loan, Kadiatu and her group members will be able to expand their respective businesses, make more sales and consequently improve their living conditions. Kadiatu will use her share of the loan (SLL 500,000) to buy pepper, onions, Maggi, rice, groundnuts, etc. in bulk to add to her current stock.

loans.use: to buy peppers, onions, Maggi (flavoring cubes), rice, groundnuts, etc. in bulk

loans.name: Akouavi Délali

texts.fr: Akouavi est une femme âgé(e) de 25ans. Elle est mariée à un transitaire. Akouavi Délali travaille comme revendeuse de pagnes de façon ambulante depuis 2007. Elle achète les produits au Grand Marché de Lomé et au BENIN. Elle a requis son quatrième cycle de prêt à WAGES afin d’acheter des pagnes. Elle espère agrandir son activité par l’ouverture d’une boutique et assurer une meilleure condition de vie à sa famille.
texts.en:
Akouavi is 25 years of age, and is married to a freight forwarding agent. She has worked selling pagnes [traditional African fabric] on the street since 2007, and buys her products in the Grand Marché in Lomé and in Benin. 

Akouavi has requested her fourth loan from WAGES so that she can buy pagnes. She hopes to expand her business by opening a store, as well as to improve the living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to buy pagnes [traditional African cloth].

loans.name: Pada- Eteng

texts.fr: Jeune femme de33ans, Pada-Eteng revend des tubercules et des céréales à la devanture de son domicile. Elle a démarré en 2008 et sollicite son premier crédit pour acheter plus de marchandises afin de mieux répondre aux besoins des clients. Madame Pada-Eteng espère agrandir son activité et assurer l'avenir de sa famille. Elle a pour conjoint un Directeur d’Établissement
texts.en: A young 33 year old woman, Pada-Eteng resells tubers and cereals in front of her home. She started in 2008 and is requesting her first loan to buy more merchandise in order to better respond to the needs of her customers. Madam Pada-Eteng hopes to expand her business and ensure the future of her family. Her spouse is the director of an institution.

loans.use: to buy yams, beans and a variety of products.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase winter clothing.

loans.name: Agustin

texts.es: Don Agustín, tiene 64 años de edad, está casado, tiene seis hijos y vive en el municipio de Olanchito, Yoro. Hace aproximadamente 35 años de experiencia en la confección. En su taller confecciona pantalones, camisas, y reparaciones de ropa. Este taller lo tiene en su casa y cuenta con buena clientela. El Prestamo que solicito es el tercer ciclo en la institución y es por 30,000 Lempiras, con el cual va comprar materiales como ser telas, hilos, tiza, agujas, zipers, etc. para la confección de prendas de vestir. Este crédito le ayudara a tener un mayor inventario de materiales y cumplirle a sus clientes. Su plan es poder seguir creciendo con su negocio  y darle una mejor vida a su familia.
texts.en: Agustín is 64 years old, married, he has six children, and he lives in the municipality of Olanchito, Yoro. He has about 35 years experience in tailoring. In his shop he makes pants, shirts, and also mends clothing. He runs this shop out of his home and has a good customer base. The loan that he is requesting is his third cycle with this organization, and he is requesting 30,000 Lempiras which he will use to purchase materials such as fabric, thread, chalk, needles, zippers, etc. for making garments. This loan will help him have a broader inventory of materials and fulfill orders for his customers. His plan is to keep growing his business and provide a better life for his family.

loans.use: purchase material such as such as fabric, thread, chalk, zippers, needles, etc. for making clothing.

loans.name: Iye

texts.en: This is 35-year-old Iye. She is married and has two children aged eight and five years old. She has two additional dependents who live with her to attend school and help in domestic work. In 1995, Iye established her provisions and food stuff business. She began her business because she dropped out of school at an early age. Her parents did not value education for girls. She was given to an early marriage. Her husband was a trader who trained her in business. Working 6 days a week and 12 hours a day, she earns about SLL 494,000 every month from this business. She would like a loan in the amount of SLL 4,000,000. Iye requires a loan in order to purchase cartons of provisions and food stuffs. In the future, she plans to expand her business. Competition is her major challenge. She is grateful for being given the opportunity to access a loan from ARD. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: To buy more cartons of provisions and food stuff

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more fish to resell.

loans.name: Aminata

texts.en:
Greetings from Sierra Leone! This is 42-year-old Aminata from the Waterloo eastern area in Freetown. She is married, with four children between the ages of 8 years and 18 years.  
 
Aminata runs a cookery business.  She sells cookery within her area, and she has been running this business since 2000. She started the business to get daily survival for her family. She works at the business 12 hours per day and 6 days per week.   Aminata says the main challenge to her business is the problem of price control in the market.

Aminata has requested a loan to buy food commodities like cooking seasonings, oil, and rice to prepare her cookery.  The extra income from this loan will allow her to educate her children. 

In the future, she plans to open a restaurant. She thanks you for your support!

loans.use: to buy food commodities like cooking seasonings, oil, and rice to prepare her cookery business.

loans.name: 04-12-03-Nam Ngạn Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Hoa operates a food stall/restaurant selling fruit. She is requesting a loan to purchase fruits to resell.

Hoa is 38 years old and she is married with two children. Hoa is the group leader of the 04-12-03-Nam Ngạn solidarity group, which consists of three members. She lives and works in Thanh Hoa city, a urban area in Thanh Hoa province, with her two dependents

In 2000, Hoa joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to improve her  business. Hoa has successfully repaid four loans from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. Hoa has been involved in this business for less than a year. The main hardship that Hoa faces in her business is the lack of capital.

With her business profit, Hoa hopes to build a new house, for her family to be healthy and happy, and for her business to do well.

loans.use: to purchase fruits to resell.

loans.name: Etta H.

texts.en:
Etta H. is 49 years old and lives in Gardnersville. She’s married and her husband is a businessman; they have five children between the ages of 10 and 29, only three of them are in school and live at home.

Etta H. has been operating a table where she sells pepper, peanut, rice, etc. She started this business with money given to her by her husband, and learned this way of selling from her mother.
 
Etta H. is requesting a loan to purchase more pepper, peanuts, rice, etc. for her business. She plans to expand her business internationally and send her children to school.

loans.use: to purchase more pepper, peanuts, rice, etc. for her business.

loans.name: Carmen Elena

texts.es:
Carmen  de 49 años de edad, madre de 3 hijos en las edades de 16 a 28 años,  es la propietaria de una peluquería en un lugar cercano a la ciudad de Barranquilla, allí ofrece el servicio de corte de cabello, peinado, alisado y  a sus clientes también ofrece productos de belleza, mediante su asesoría. Cada vez más su clientela crece y ella necesita tenerlos bien atendidos, para que se sientan confortables, mientras reciben el mejoramiento estético. 
Cuando inició su negocio, lo hizo para lograr independencia económica, pues no le ha gustado nunca depender de nadie. Por eso viendo a otras personas como realizaban esta actividad y practicándola, logró captar su experiencia, de manera empírica, pues nunca ha hecho cursos técnicos. Sus primeros pasos los realizaron a domicilio, haciendo su oferta a sus allegados y poco a poco con mucho esfuerzo, logró hace dos años, concentrarse en un local muy cerca de su domicilio y agregar a proveedores  de sus productos de consumo y también para venderlos, una vez diagnostica que clase de productos requiere cada uno de sus compradores. En la actualidad está aplicando a un credikiva, mediante el cual comprará productos de belleza, como shampoo, acondicionadores, tintes, masajes etc. Y también comprará 2 sillas de peluquería, 6 sillas plásticas y un equipo de manicurista. Con ello logrará su propósito de ambiente confortable, que se hace mucho más necesario para el mes de diciembre, temporada en la cual se incrementa aún más la clientela de su negocio, lo que significa su razón de éxito.
texts.en:
Carmen is 49 years old and the mother of three children between the ages of 16 and 28.  She has a barber shop near the city of Barranquilla, where she offers haircuts, styles, smoothing, and also sells beauty products and gives advice to her customers.  Her customer base constantly increases and she needs to serve them well so that they will be comfortable while they receive aesthetic treatments.

When she started her business, she did so so that she could achieve financial Independence because she never liked to have to depend on someone else.  She saw others doing this, practiced, and she was able to capture this experience, since she never took technical courses.  She made her first steps in her home and little by little she was able to open a shop near her home after two years, and add products that her customers needed.  She is asking for a Kiva loan so she can buy beauty products such as shampoo, conditioner, tints, massages, etc.  She also wants to buy two barber chairs and six plastic chairs, as well as some manicuring equipment.  This way she will have a comfortable environment that she will need in December, when her number of customers increase, which leads to her success.

loans.use: to buy supplies.

loans.name: Yamila

texts.es: Yamila de 53 años tiene una refresquería donde vende gaseosas, jugos, bolsas de agua, hielo y otros refrescos empacados. Ella desde hace 27 años tiene su experiencia de negocio, que nació una vez llegó procedente del departamento de Sucre en Colombia. La refresquería de Yamila es visitada por los deportistas que practican diversas actividades en una cancha ubicada justo frente a su domicilio donde su negocio se encuentra ubicado. Ella está atenta a venderlas bebidas desde las 8 de la mañana hasta las 10 de la noche día tras día. En la actualidad las temporadas vacacionales incrementan su demanda y por eso está aplicando a un credikiva, primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, mediante el cual comprará refrescos, gaseosas, agua, y otras bebidas que consumen sus clientes, acosados por el calor de esta tierra  cálida y muy cercana al mar caribe.  Con su credikiva, aumenta su capital de trabajo y logra la posibilidad de agregar mayor inventario en su oferta, lo que hace de su credikiva una inversión de éxito.
texts.en:
Yamila is 53 years old and has a refreshment stand where she sells soft drinks, juices, water bags, ice, and other packaged refreshments.  She has been doing this for 27 years and her business experience began in the Sucre department in Colombia.  Yamila’s refreshment shop is visited by athletes who practice different activities at a field located across from her home, where her business is located.

She works from 8:00 am to 10:00 pm every day and her customer demand increases over the vacation season.  She is asking for her first Kiva loan, through Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, so she can buy soft drinks, water, and other drinks for her customers when it’s hot in this hot area close to the Caribbean Sea.  This Kiva loan will increase her working capital and allow her to add inventory, making her loan a success.

loans.use: to stock her business.

loans.name: 02130605_Thôn 7, Xã Hoằng Kim Group

texts.en:
Hồng is applying for a loan to purchase pigs for resale. She operates a business selling pigs.

Hồng has been involved in this business for more than 10 years.  One of the most critical business difficulties that concern her is the lack of capital.

Hồng is 39 years old, and she is married, with three children.  She is the group leader of the 02130605_Thôn 7, xã Hoằng Kim solidarity group, which consists of eight members. 

Hồng supports three dependents with her business in the Hoang Hoa district, a rural town in Thanh Hoa province.

In 2012, Hồng joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to improve her business. She has successfully repaid one loan from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.

With her business profit, Hồng hopes for her children to do well in school, to be able to buy more supplies and equipment for her business, and for her business to do well.

loans.use: to purchase pigs for resale

loans.name: 06 - 01 - 16 Đông Vệ Group

texts.en:
Thơm is 44 years old, married, and has two children. She lives and works in Thanh Hoa city, a urban area in Thanh Hoa province. She operates a retail business selling clothes, which she has been doing for three years. Her main challenge is the lack of capital. 

Thơm is the group leader of the 06.01.16 Đông Vệ solidarity group, which consists of four members. She is requesting her first loan from Thanh Hoa Fund of Poor Women, which she will use to purchase clothes to sell. With her business profit, Thơm hopes for her children to do well in school, for her family to be healthy and happy, and for her business to do well.

loans.use: to purchase clothes to sell

loans.name: Beatrice

texts.en:
Beatrice is 44 years old and lives in Gardnersville. She is single and has a child, age 13, who is in school and lives at home.

Beatrice has been selling rice and palm oil for the past seven years. She learned this trade from her mother. Her main challenge is the high costs of the goods. She’s requesting a loan to purchase more rice and palm oil for her business. She would like to own her own shop one day.

loans.use: to purchase more rice and palm oil for her business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase used clothing for her business

loans.name: Yeakin

texts.en:
Yeakin is 38 years old, married, and has four children. She operates a domestic products sales business in Waterloo in the eastern area in Freetown, selling glass cups, knives, and food containers in her community, which she has been since after the war.. She started her business because she wants to improve the living conditions of her family. The main challenge to her business is its location. 

Yeakin is requesting a loan from BRAC Sierra Leone, which she will use to purchase more spoons and a variety of food containers to sell. The extra income from this loan will help her expand her business and take care of her family. In the future, she would like to open a big shop.

loans.use: to purchase more spoons and a variety of food containers to sell

loans.name: Selina

texts.en:
Meet 30-year-old Selina from Waterloo2 eastern area in Freetown. She is married with two children. In 2003, Selina established her clothing business. She began her business because she needed to create an income to support the home. She works at her business twelve hours per day, seven days per week. She says that the main challenge to her business is the difficulty of going door-to-door to sale her clothing material.

Selina requires a loan in order to buy a variety of clothing material to expand her business. She hopes that the extra income from this loan will allow her to increase her business and have a permanent business location. In the future, Selina plans to own a big shop. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to buy a variety of clothing material to expand her business.

loans.name: Flor Idalia

texts.es: Flor de 32 años de edad vive en casa propia con su esposo y sus dos hijos, desde hace 5 años se dedica al cultivo de pepino, adicional a eso también vende productos de belleza, con lo que obtiene de su trabajo y con la ayuda de su esposo logran cubrir los gastos de su hogar, Flor esta solicitando un crédito para la compra de abonos, fertilizantes, controles de plagas, etc. para seguir con sus cultivos, y así obtener mejores ganancias para darle a su familia una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en: Flor is 32 years old and lives in her own home with her husband and two children.  She has been raising cucumbers for five years and also sells beauty products.  Between what she and her husband earn, they are able to cover the household expenses.  Flor is asking for a loan to buy compost, fertilizer, blight control, etc. so that she can continue raising crops, improve her earnings, and provide a better quality of life for her family.

loans.use: to buy farming supplies.

loans.name: Juana

texts.es: Juana vive en casa propia con su hijo y su nuera, desde hace varios años se dedica  a la elaboración y venta de tortillas y tamales, con lo que obtiene de su trabajo logra solventar algunos gastos de su hogar, ahora ella solicita un crédito para poder mejorar su vivienda construyendo unos cuartos por esa razón solicita el crédito y así poder comprar los materiales necesarios como: ladrillos, cemento, arena, etc. y así poder construir su casa para que ella su familia puedan vivir más cómodos y seguros.
texts.en: Juana lives in her own house with her son and daughter-in-law.  She's had a business making and selling tortillas for a number of years, and with the earnings from this business she is able to cover some of the household expenses.  At this time, she is requesting a loan for home improvement that she will use to add some rooms.  This is why she is requesting a loan to buy construction materials such as: bricks, cement, sand, etc.  This loan will enable her to add to her house so that she and her family can live in greater comfort and security.

loans.use: to buy bricks, cement, sand, and other construction materials

loans.name: Fatmata

texts.en:
Meet 40-year-old Fatmata from Waterloo2 eastern area in Freetown. She is married with 3 children.  In 2002, Fatmata established her broom business. She began her business to sustain her life.  She works at the business from 8:00 am until 7:00 pm 7 days per week. She says that the main challenges to her business are lack of capital to establish more business and a high rate of poverty within the community.

Fatmata requires a loan in order to purchase palm oil and gari to expand her business. She hopes that the extra income from this loan will allow her to change her standard of living and increase her business. In the future, Fatmata plans to expand her business more. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to purchase palm oil and gari to expand her business.

loans.name: Zenaida

texts.en:
This is Zenaida, 54, a resident of Cabrera, Pasay, Philippines. Married to Ramon, a butcher, Zenaida operates a food stall and earns a minimum of Php 900 in sales every day. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She also has a piggery to earn additional income. Zenaida and her husband manage their household while operating the business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses.  

In the Philippines, the entire working community and most families only eat home-cooked meals during evenings when all family members are at home to take part. This is not only a tradition but also a matter of convenience and frugal living. It is considered a waste of money and time to use cooking gas and food for one or two persons when cooked rice and viands cost less than raw food.

To help her continue operations of her business, Zenaida is requesting a Php 30,000 loan to buy more quantities of products such as meat, rice, vegetables, condiments, seasonings and frozen foods. 

Zenaida hopes to expand her business and dreams of having a better living. She meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week and draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God he studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners who gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay micro finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for raw ingredients like rice, pork, chicken, vegetables, etc. needed in her business.

loans.name: Vicenta

texts.es:
Vicenta es una Señora muy luchadora de 30 años de edad emprendedora y con muchos sueños, su estado civil casada, madre de  4 hijos menores el mayor de todos trabaja en junto a sus padres y los tres más pequeños estudian en la escuela de la comunidad cursando diferentes grados de educación.  Su nivel educativo primaria completa la cual pudo cursar gracias al apoyo moral y financiero por parte de sus padres pero no pudo seguir porque sus padres son de escasos recursos económicos. Vicenta desde hace 8 año se dedica al cultivo de hortalizas (Papa) junto a su esposo pero desde muy temprana edad en compañía de sus padres fue como aprendió a trabajar la tierra ya que la zona es apta para este tipo de rubro siendo sus clientes intermediarios que llegan a la zona y los diferentes vendedores en el mercado de la comunidad. Su mayor desafió en cuanto a este rubro es mantener sus cultivos limpios de plagas e insectos que dañan la planta y la hortaliza ya que los precios de los insumos varían en el mercado y es difícil comprar la cantidad necesaria para poder protegerlos.
Por lo que hoy en día ella se ve en la necesidad de solicitar financiamiento para la compra de insumos agrícolas para dar asistencia técnica a sus cultivos de hortaliza como ser compra de fertilizantes, foliares fungicidas entre otros.
Ella sueña en un futuro hacer unas mejoras en sus casa de habitación que son necesarias para poder mantener libre de enfermedades respiratorias entre otras a la familia que son propagadas por la humedad, polvo, entre otros. También hacer crecer sus cultivos sembrando y cultivando mayor cantidad de hortalizas y de esta forma obtener mayores ingresos que le permitan salir adelante con su familia y brindarles una mejor oportunidad de vida a sus hijos, educarlos de forma que ellos en un futuro sean personas preparadas y visionarias que cuiden el patrimonio que ella desea heredarles.
texts.en:
Vicenta, 30, is a hardworking and enterprising woman with many dreams. She is married and has four dependent children. The oldest child works with his parents, while the three youngest are in different grades at a local school. Vicenta finished elementary school, thanks to her parents' moral and financial support, but she couldn't go further because her family could not afford it. 

Vicenta has grown vegetables (potatoes) with her husband for eight years, but she learned to farm from her parents at a very early age, as the area is excellent for farming, intermediaries come to purchase here, and there are local market vendors. Her greatest challenge in her work is keeping the crops free of disease and insects that damage the plants and vegetables, since supply prices vary and it's hard to buy enough to protect her plantings.

Now she needs a loan to buy supplies like fertilizer and fungicides to tend her plantings. She dreams of making necessary improvements to her house to keep her family free of respiratory problems due to humidity, dust, and more. She also wants to plant and grow more vegetables so that she earns more for her family and can give children better opportunities and an education that will allow them to be prepared and forward-thinking people that will care for the inheritance she wants to leave them.

loans.use: to buy agricultural supplies for her vegetable crops.

loans.name: Dayana Milena

texts.es: Dayana de 30 años de edad se dedica a la venta de ropa, calzado y electrodoméstico, desde hace 1 año, cuando dejó de ser empleada y tomó el dinero de su liquidación, para dedicarse a una actividad que le generara ingresos para atender las necesidades de sus dos hijos. Así fue como empezó, comprando artículos procedentes de un municipio fronterizo, y ha logrado hacerlo crecer su negocio gradualmente. Sus principales productos, son el calzado, la ropa para caballeros, damas y electrodomésticos menores, que distribuye mediante la venta entre familiares, amigos y vecinos, a quienes les otorga un crédito, para que estos lo paguen poco a poco y de manera cómoda para ellos. Su meta es lograr incrementar su cartera de clientes, pues la competencia de precios, es su mayor desafío. Actualmente aprovechará las fiestas de fin de año, para vender mucho más, pero su capital es insuficiente para lograrlo, esta es la razón por la cual acude a un credikiva, primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, mediante el cual comprará calzado, ropa y electrodomésticos y con ello obtendrá mayor capital, mayores ingresos y muchos más clientes, haciendo de su credikiva una gran inversión.
texts.en: Dayana is 30 years old and has been selling clothing, shoes, and small appliances for one year, when she stopped being an employee, took her severance pay, and created an activity that would generate an income so she could tend to her children’s needs.  This is how she started, buying items from a border town and she gradually grew her business.  Her main products are shoes, men’s and women’s clothing, and small appliances that she sells to family, friends, and neighbors on credit.  They pay little by little in a way that they are comfortable with.  Her goal is to increase her customer base.  Competition over prices is her greatest challenge.  She is taking advantage of the year end festivals and is asking for her first Kiva loan, through Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, so she can buy shoes, clothing, and small appliances, which will provide better income and more customers, making this loan a success.

loans.use: to buy inventory.

loans.name: 01.08.02 Đông Sơn Group

texts.en:
Cần operates a food stall/restaurant selling eel soup.  Cần has been involved in this business for three years. She is requesting a loan to purchase eels to make eels soup to resell.

Cần is 48 years old and she is married with two children. Cần lives with no dependents in Thanh Hoa city, a urban town in Thanh Hoa province. Her children are grown up. She is the group leader of the 01.08.02 Đông Sơn solidarity group, which consists of six members. 

In 2011, Cần joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to improve her  business. Cần has successfully repaid three loans from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.  The main hardship that Cần faces in her business is the lack of capital.

With her business profit, Cần hopes for her family to be healthy and happy and for her business to do well. She also hopes to remodel her house.

loans.use: to purchase eels to make eels soup to resell

loans.name: Isaura

texts.es: Gracias por apoyar a Isaura, quien con su anterior credikiva logró comprar una máquina de coser y una fileteadora. Ella está muy contenta porque antes pagaba por concepto de arrendamiento y hoy tiene su propias máquinas que mejoran sus procesos productivos y sus tiempos de confección, dándole la oportunidad de poder aumentar su producción de prendas. En la actualidad pasa mas tiempo con sus hijas y esto es maravilloso para su familia. Ella por eso dice a sus finacaidores: " Estoy muy agradecida, que sigan apoyándome para hacer de mi negocio prospero y grande y en el futuro tener mi propio taller con empleados. " En la actualidad está aplicando a un nuevo finaciamiento de Kiva, porque aprovechará la época navideña para incrementar aun mas, sus ventas y para ello requiere tener mucha materia prima e insumos, tambien incluirá la línea de cubrelechos, forros, de sillas de la temporada y muñequearía, además de comprar una máquina plana, que darán un acabado ideal a su nuevas prendas y con ello, hará de su credikiva una inversión de éxito.
texts.en: Thank you for helping support Isaura, who used her previous Kiva loan to buy a sewing machine.  She is very happy because she used to have to pay someone else but now she has her own machines and she is able to improve her production and production times.  Now she can spend more time with her daughters and this is wonderful for her family.  She tells her lenders, “I am very grateful for your continued support in making my business successful and growing it, so that in the future I can have my own workshop and employees.”  She is asking for a new Kiva loan because she wants to take advantage of the Christmas season, so she can increase her sales.  For this she needs many supplies.  She also wants to create a line of bed covers, seat covers, and dolls, as well as buying another machine that will provide the finishing touches on her clothing.  This will make her Kiva loan a success.

loans.use: to buy supplies.

loans.name: Rosa Melida

texts.es:
Rosa, le fue muy bien utilizando el préstamo anterior, pues mejor su economía, conto con lo necesario para que su negocio estuviera equipado y así darle mejor atención a sus clientes. Ha optado por otro crédito para adquirir materia prima, comprara harina, maíz, aceite, tomates, especias, etc., de esta manera sus productos estarán bien elaborados con lo que espera atraer más clientes, generar más ingresos, y seguir ampliando el negocio.
Su economía ha mejorado por lo que su familia le recibe mejor alimentación, salud y educación, de ellos recibe un apoyo tanto emocional como en el negocio.
