texts.en: Rosa used her previous loan well. Her financial situation improved, and she had all the business equipment required to service her customers better. She has applied for another loan to buy flour, corn, oil, tomatoes, spices, and more to make her food excellent so that she can attract more customers, earn more, and grow her business. Because her finances are better, her family has better nutrition, health, and education. She receives emotional and business support from her family.

loans.use: to buy flour, corn, oil, tomatoes, and spices.

loans.name: Urunani Iii Group

texts.fr:
Béatrice fait partie du groupe  Urunani III et  habite à Bujumbura. Elle a 35 ans et est mariée à Raphaël. Ensemble ils ont 2 enfants  âgés de 9 mois  à 3 ans dont 1 étudie.

Elle  fait le commerce des habits depuis  2 ans. 

C’est son premier  crédit à Turame. Avec le crédit KIVA qu’elle obtient, elle  va  augmenter son capital et acheter    beaucoup d’habits  à revendre pour gagner plus. 

Dans les prochaines  années, Elle  voudrait acheter une parcelle, construire une maison et voir ses enfants étudier.
texts.en:
Beatrice is a member of the Urunani III group. She lives in Bujumbura. She is 35 years old. Her husband’s name is Raphael. They have two children, nine months and three years old, one of whom is in school.

She has been selling clothing for two years. This is her first loan with Turame. With the Kiva loan, she will bolster her capital and buy a lot of clothing to resell in order to earn more. In the years to come, she would like to buy a land plot, build a house and see her children get an education.

loans.use: she will bolster her capital and buy a lot of clothing to resell in order to earn more.

loans.name: María Concepción

texts.es:
María de 51 años de edad, sus estudios los realizo hasta 6° grado, el motivo por el cual, no pudo seguir estudiando; es porque sus padres no podían darle mas el estudio que en ese tiempo costaba mucho enviar a estudiar a los hijos, desde entonce ella comenzó a trabajar en los quehaceres de la casa, ayudandole a su madre y cuando podía le ayudaba a su padre.
 
Su madre le enseño como hacer los tamales, para vender y que por la venta de los tamales obtendrían dinero para su casa. Luego creció y se acompaño y tubo un hijo, en cierto tiempo se separo del señor y comenzó a luchar, ella sola para mantener a su hijo. De lo que le enseño su madre, ella trabaja por encargo de tamales desde hace 18 años y así a podido salir adelante. Hoy su hijo creció y él trabaja en una venta de repuestos, para carros  y  le ayuda con los gastos de la casa.  

María necesita el dinero, para realizar los tramites para que su hijo se case,  los preparativos comienza en este mes hasta finalizar con el casamiento que sera en diciembre.  

Ella menciona que en el futuro, desea  seguir ayudandole a su hijo en la compra de una casa, para que  pueda vivir dignamente.
texts.en:
María, 51, finished sixth grade. She couldn't continue in school because her parents couldn't afford it, as education was expensive then. She started to work, doing household chores, helping her mother, and helping her father when she could. 
 
Her mother taught her to make tamales to sell to earn money for her household. She grew up, found a life partner, and had a son. After a while, she separated from the father and began to strive alone to care for her son. Using what she learned from her mother, she has been making tamales for 18 years to support herself. Her son is now an adult. He works at an auto supply store and helps her with household expenses. 

María needs a loan to pay for her son's marriage documents this month for his wedding, which will take place in December. She wants to keep helping her son so that he can buy a house and live decently.

loans.use: to pay for her son's marriage documents this month for his wedding, which will take place in December.

loans.name: Sharofat

texts.ru: Шарофат по профессии швея. Ей 37 лет. Она проживает с мужем и детьми в районе Бохтар. Ее муж недавно вернулся с России, там он работал в упаковочной фирме. Приехав в Таджикистан в свой родной район, он не находит достойную и  хорошооплачиваемую работу. Шарофат хочет помочь мужу. Она не хочет чтобы он снова покинул их и работал в чужих краях. Шарофат с мужем решили купить легковую машину, чтобы он начал предоставлять услуги такси. У них имеется 500 долларов сбережения. Для покупки машины им не хватает еще 2200 долларов. Эту недостающую сумму Шарофат просит кредит. Ее муж собирается купить на сумму 2700 долларов машину марки Nexia. Он планирует предоставлять услуги такси по маршруту своего района и за день делать шесть рейсов. Этот кредит очень важен их семье.
texts.en: Sharofat is a seamstress by trade. She is 37 years old. She lives with her husband and children in the Bohtar region. Her husband has recently returned from Russia, where he used to working for a packaging company. After returning to his native region in Tajikistan, he has not been able to find a decent job that would pay well. Sharofat wants to help out her husband. She does not want him to leave the family again and be a migrant worker elsewhere. Sharofat and her husband decided to buy a car so that he could start working as a taxi driver. They have saved 500 USD. They still need 2,200 USD to buy a car. Sharofat is applying for a loan for the remainder of the money. Her husband plans to buy a Nexia car for 2700 USD. He intends to work as a taxi driver transporting passengers in his region and complete six trips per day. This loan is very important to their family.

loans.use: to buy a car for her husband's new business.

loans.name: Maria Elena

texts.es: Maria de 56 años de edad vive en casa propia con su familia, desde hace varios años posee un negocio de venta de pupusas y tamales, posee mucha clientela por los buenos precios y la amabilidad que tiene a la hora de vender, con lo que obtiene de sus ventas logra solventar algunos gastos de su hogar, Doña Maria está solicitando un crédito para la compra de los ingredientes necesarios como: maíz, chicharrón, quesillo, frijoles, verduras, tomaste, etc. para poder seguir reparando los alimentos y así obtener mejores ganancias para darle a su familia una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Maria, 56, lives in her own house with her family. She has been selling pupusas and tamales for some years. She has a lot of customers because she offers good prices and friendly service. With the sales from this business, she pays household expenses. 

Maria has applied for a loan to buy needed supplies like corn, chicharrón, cheese, beans, vegetables, and tomatoes to continue preparing her dishes so that she can earn more and raise her family's standard of living.

loans.use: to buy corn, chicharrón, cheese, beans, vegetables, tomatoes, etc.

loans.name: Sonia Del Carmen

texts.es:
Sonia, invirtió el crédito anterior en surtir el inventario de su tienda, con lo que mejoro sus rancias, cumplió con las  necesidades de sus clientes y nuevamente está solicitando capital para comprar arroz, frijol, aceite, azúcar, bebidas, y otros pues como su clientela ha crecido tiene mayor demanda de productos de primera necesidad. Espera tener mejores ingresos, ir cancelando la deuda y cubrir los gastos del hogar.
En su familia hay un miembro más, todos cuentan con mejor alimentación y están muy saludables. Ella sigue luchando porque su negocio siga creciendo.
texts.en: Sonia invested the last loan in stocking her store which improved her revenues and fulfilled the needs of her customers. Once again she is requesting a loan to buy rice, beans, oil, sugar, drinks, etc.. Her clientele has grown she has more need of basic food products. She hopes to increases her income, pay off her debt and cover the household expenses. The family has a new member and everyone is better feed and in good health. She will continue to struggle to make her business grow.

loans.use: to buy rice, beans, oil, sugar, drinks, etc.

loans.name: Julio Cesar

texts.es: Julio, tiene 47  años de edad, vive  en unión libre con su esposa con quien tiene dos hijos y reside en el municipio de Villanueva,Cortes. Anteriormente trabajo  en una maquila y hace 7 años que se dedica a la venta de frutas, verduras y granos básicos. Esta actividad la realiza en un puesto del mercado. El prestamo que solicita es por 7,000 lempiras y lo va utilizar para la compra de frutas, verduras y granos básicos como manzanas, uvas, banano, melón, rábano, repollo, pataste, papas y maíz y frijoles y asi tendrá su negocio más surtido y crecerá más en clientes. Su meta es hacerlo más fuerte y mantener variedad de  productos.
texts.en:
Julio, 47, lives in a free union with his wife, with whom he has two children, in Villanueva, Cortes. He used to work at a factory. For seven years, he has been selling fruits, vegetables, and basic grains at his market stall.

He has applied for a loan of 7000 lempiras to buy fruits like apples, grapes, bananas, and melon; vegetables like radishes, cabbage, chayote, and potatoes; and basic grains such as corn and beans to stock his business and attract more customers. His goal is to make his business stronger and offer a variety of merchandise.

loans.use: to buy fruits like apples, grapes, bananas, and melon; vegetables like radishes, cabbage, chayote, and potatoes; and basic grains such as corn and beans to sell.

loans.name: Shoira

texts.ru: Шоира женщина с тонким вкусом. Она умеет шить красивые национальные платья. Шоира гордится тем, что она научилась шитью женской одежды. Она до сегодняшнего дня шила платья только для своих детей и родственников. Она теперь хочет организовать свой бизнес предоставлением услуги портнихи. Шоира мать 3 детей. Ее муж Абдучаббор занимается выращиванием сельхоз культур. Он имеет маленький доход. Поэтому Шоира целенаправленно действует для организации бизнеса. Она участвовала в курсе «Добейся Успеха» организованного Ассоциация Деловых Женщин и получила сертификат. Она запрашивает займ на сумму 500 сомони для покупки швейной машинки. Она ждет вашу доброту.
texts.en: Shoira is a woman with a delicate taste.  She can sew beautiful national dresses.  Shoira is proud of the fact that she learned how to sew women's clothing.  To this day, she sewed dresses only for her children and relatives.  Now she wants to organize her own business of providing seamstress services.  Shoira is a mother of 3 children.  Her husband, Abduchabbor, is involved in growing agricultural crops.  He has a small income.  This is why Shoira is driving toward starting her business.  She participated in the "Achieve Success" course, organized by the Association of Business Women and obtained a certificate.  She is requesting a loan in the amount of 500 somoni to purchase a sewing machine.  She awaits your kindness.

loans.use: to purchase a sewing machine and start her own business

loans.name: Merlita

texts.en:
This is Merlita. She previously accessed an 18,000 PHP loan that she used to purchase more quantities and varieties of grocery items and products needed in her business. Her earnings were a big help for her children’s education, and in their personal, household and business expenditures.
 
She would like to apply for another 18,000 PHP loan to buy groceries, toiletries, beverages and other products to add to her inventory. The more items displayed at the store, the better. More items to sell will result in better profit. Her profits from business will definitely help sustain her family’s daily needs and her children’s education expenses. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

Merlita hopes that her business will grow bigger and dreams that her children will finish their studies. She meets up with her co-fellowship* members every week to share stories of her life and to also draw strength and inspiration from the word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the word of God, build social capital and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for grocery items, toiletries and beverages needed in her business.

loans.name: Marites

texts.en:
Marites is thankful for the financial assistance extended to her, as she was able to buy the spare parts and accessories for her tricycle. She has had this business for four years now. Her loan was also helpful in the education of her children. Her income from business, on the other hand, supported their everyday household expenditures. Aside from her tricycle, she also has a direct-selling business for additional income.

She would like to apply for another 10,000 PHP loan to buy spare parts and for the maintenance of their tricycle. Her profits from her business will definitely help her to sustain their daily needs and her children's education. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

Marites dreams to have an additional tricycle and hopes that her children will finish their studies. She meets up with her co-fellowship* members every week to share stories of her life and business and to find strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for spare parts and the maintenance of their tricycle unit.

loans.name: Maazamkhan

texts.ru: Маазамхан 57 лет, замужем, вместе с супругом воспитывают 6 детей. У Маазамхан - среднее образование. В качестве основного дохода для своей семьи Маазамхан занимается полеводством, стартовав 37 лет назад, с 1,000 сом KGS. Благодаря упорному труду Маазамхан, на сегодняшний день имеется: 2 овцы и 0,60 ГА земельной доли, на которой ежегодно выращивает картофель, кукурузу и веники для реализации. Веники выращивает для продажи, сдает реализаторам и имеет небольшой доход. Ежемесячный доход составляет 15,000 сом (KGS). В целях дальнейшего развития своего хозяйства, Маазамхан обратилась в Микрофинансовый банк «Бай –Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 75,000 сом (KGS) на покупку семян картофеля и 1 коровы. Доходы от кредита Маазамхан планирует вложить в приумножение количества домашней скотины, и планирует накопить средства на строительство нового дома для сына.
texts.en:
Maazamkhan is 57 years old, married and raising six children together with her husband. Maazamkhan has secondary education. As a main source of income for her family, Maazamkhan works with field crop cultivation, after having started 27 years ago with 1,000 som (KGS). Thanks to Maazamkhan's persistent work, she currently has two sheep and 0.60 hectares of land, on which she every year grows potatoes, sweet corn and hay to sell. She grows hay to sell, paying a distributor, and gets a small income. The monthly income is around 15,000 som (KGS). 

With an aim to further develop her business, Maazamkhan turned to the microfinance bank "Bai Tushum & Partners" for a loan in the amount of 75,000 som (KGS) for the purchase of potato seeds and a cow. Maazamkhan plans to invest the income from the loan in increasing the number of household animals, and also plans to save money for building a new house for her son.

loans.use: to buy a cow and potato seeds

loans.name: Anarkan

texts.ru: Анаркан 55 лет, замужем, вместе с супругом воспитывают 4 детей. У Анаркан - среднее образование, в качестве основного дохода для своей семьи Анаркан занимается животноводством, стартовав 18 лет назад, с покупки скота на 2,000 сом KGS. Благодаря упорному труду Анаркан, в ее хозяйстве на сегодняшний день имеется: 8 дойных коров, 6 телят, 20 овец, 2 нетели, 7 бычков и 5 коз. Ежемесячный доход составляет 15,000 сом (KGS). В целях дальнейшего развития своего хозяйства, Анаркан обратилась в Микрофинансовый банк «Бай –Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 50,000 сом (KGS) на покупку коровы для увеличения поголовья скота. Доходы от кредита Анаркан планирует вложить в дальнейшее приумножение количества домашней скотины, и планирует накопить средства на покупку дома.
texts.en:
Anarkan is 55 years old, married, and raising four children together with her husband. Anarkan has secondary education. As a main source of income for her family, Anarkan works with livestock breeding, after having started 18 years ago with the purchase of livestock for 2,000 som (KGS). Thanks to Anarkan's persistent work, her farm currently has eight dairy cows, six calves, 20 sheep, two heifers, seven bulls and five goats. The monthly income is 15,000 som (KGS). 

With an aim to further develop her business, Anarkan turned to the microfinance bank "Bai Tushum & Partners" for a loan in the amount of 50,000 som (KGS) for the purchase of cows to increase the number of livestock. Anarkan plans to invest the income from the loan in further increasing the number of household animals, and also plans to save money for purchasing a house.

loans.use: to purchase cows

loans.name: Bakhtygul

texts.ru: Бактыгул 52 года, вдова, после смерти мужа сама воспитала троих детей, а также ведет свое хозяйство. У Бактыгул - среднее образование, в качестве основного дохода для своей семьи Бактыгул занимается животноводством, стартовав 31 год назад, с покупки скота на 1,000 сом KGS. Благодаря упорному труду Бактыгул, в ее хозяйстве на сегодняшний день имеется: 1 дойная корова, 10 овец. Ежемесячный доход составляет 10,000 сом (KGS). В целях дальнейшего развития своего хозяйства, Бактыгул обратилась в Микрофинансовый банк «Бай –Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 100,000 сом (KGS) на покупку нетелей для увеличения поголовья скота. Доходы от кредита Бактыгул планирует вложить в дальнейшее приумножение количества домашней скотины, и планирует накопить средства на свадьбу сына.
texts.en:
Bakhtygul is 52 years old and a widow. After the death of her husband she is raising three children by herself, and she also manages her own business. Bakhtygul has secondary education. As a main source of income for her family, Bakhtygul works with livestock breeding, after having started 31 years ago with the purchase of livestock for 1,000 som (KGS). Thanks to Bakhtygul's persistent work, her farm currently has one dairy cow and 10 sheep. The monthly income is 10,000 som (KGS). 

With an aim to further develop her farm, Bakhtygul turned to the microfinance bank "Bai Tushum & Partners" for a loan in the amount of 100,000 som (KGS) for the purchase of heifers to increase the number of livestock. Bakhtygul plans to invest the income in further increasing the number of household animals, and also plans to save money for her son's wedding.

loans.use: to purchase heifers

loans.name: Francisco

texts.en:
For a long time, Francisco wanted to open up an online business selling the latest tech items.  Four months ago, he opened up Onewaymarket, which sells a variety of Apple products and accessories at discount prices. 

Francisco hopes to take this concept global by expanding his customer base overseas. However, for now, he hopes to use this loan as start-up capital so that he can purchase more accessories and inventory.

loans.use: to purchase more accessories and inventory.

loans.name: Marjanbu

texts.ru: Маржанбу 56 лет, вдова, после смерти мужа сама воспитывает 2 детей, а также ведет свое хозяйство. У Маржанбу - среднее образование, в качестве основного дохода для своей семьи Маржанбу занимается животноводством, стартовав 35 лет назад, с покупки скота на 1,000 сом KGS. Благодаря упорному труду Маржанбу, в ее хозяйстве на сегодняшний день имеется: 2 дойные коровы, 10 овец. Ежемесячный доход составляет 12,000 сом (KGS). В целях дальнейшего развития своего хозяйства, Маржанбу обратилась в Микрофинансовый банк «Бай –Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 70,000 сом (KGS) на покупку телят для откорма с последующей реализацией на рынке по высокой цене. Доходы от кредита Маржанбу планирует вложить в дальнейшее приумножение количества домашней скотины.
texts.en:
Marjanbu is 56 years old and a widow. After the death of her husband she is raising two children herself, and also has her own business. Marjanbu has secondary education. As a main source of income for her family, Marjanbu works with livestock breeding, after having started 35 years ago with the purchase of livestock for 1,000 som (KGS). Thanks to Marjanbu's persistent work, her farm currently has two dairy cows and 10 sheep. The monthly income is 12,000 som (KGS).

With an aim to further develop her business, Marjanbu turned to the microfinance bank "Bai Tushum & Partners" for a loan in the amount of 70,000 som (KGS) for the purchase of calves to fatten and then resell at the market for a higher price. Marjanbu plans to invest the income from the loan in further increasing the number of household animals.

loans.use: to purchase calves for fattening and reselling

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more phone credit to sell.

loans.name: Shahnoza

texts.ru: Шахнозе из города Вахдата 22 года. Она не замужем. Шахноза живет вместе с родителями. Она работает продавщицей в продуктовом магазине. Шахноза недавно начала работать в магазине, но уже приобрела немало постоянных клиентов. Шахнозе нравиться ее работа, и она хочет развивать свою деятельность. По этой причине она обратилась за кредитом. На сумму от кредита Шахноза намерена купить продукты питания, в том числе молочные и хлебобулочные продукты. Она надеется, что с увеличением различности товара увеличиться ее количество клиентов.
texts.en:
Shahnoza is 22 years old and from the city of Vahdat. She is not married. Shahnoza lives together with her parents. She works as a saleswoman at a grocery store. Shahnoza started the store not long ago, but already acquired returning customers. 

Shahnoza likes her work, and she would like to expand her business. For this reason, she applied for a loan. Shahnoza intends to spend the loan on purchasing food products, including milk and bakery products. She hopes that with the increase in variety of products, she can increase the number of customers.

loans.use: to purchase food products

loans.name: Dadjo

texts.fr: Afin d'acheter de la machine à broder et réaménager son atelier, mr Dadjo fait sa troisième demande à WAGES. Il est couturier de profession et exerce son activité dans un atelier. Mr Dadjo souhaite avoir beaucoup d'apprentis et subvenir aux besoins de la famille. Âgé de 31ans, il est marié et père de 02 enfants.
texts.en: In order to buy a sewing machine and to refurbish his workshop, Mister Dadjo is making his third request from WAGES. He is a tailor by profession and practises his business in a workshop. Mister Dadjo hopes to have many apprentices and to meet the needs of his family. Thirty-one years old, he is married and father to 2 children.

loans.use: to buy a sewing machine and refurbish his workshop.

loans.name: Cristita

texts.en:
Cristita is 36 years old and married with five children, all of whom are in school. Cristita works very hard to provide for them.

Cristita runs a general store in the Philippines. She has been in this business for 18 years and sells a variety of items, such as body lotion, snack foods and other groceries. She requested a 9,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) loan through NWTF to purchase more groceries to sell.

In the future, Cristita would like to save money to expand her business and continue to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Erlinda

texts.en:
This is Erlinda, 57, resident of Silang, Cavite, Philippines. Her partner is working abroad and she is a mother to her two children. She, together with her children, manage their household while operating a business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for her everyday expenses.  

Erlinda oversees operations of their jeepney (see footnote) transportation business. She has one unit (14-16 person capacity) jeepney, which pays boundary (daily quota) each day. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of 1,000 Php everyday.

To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting a Php10,000 loan. She will be utilizing the loan to to buy spare parts and for the maintenance of her jeepney unit.

Erlinda hopes that her business will continue to flourish and dreams of having a better living. She meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies. 

-Curiously, Jeepneys have purely American origins. They were first used by American soldiers helping the Philippines throw off the invading Japanese. Filipino ingenuity, however, managed to see this vehicle as an opportunity to earn, and modified the Jeep into a 20-seater jeepney, open enough to provide adequate ventilation, sturdy for every day travel, and cheap enough to buy and maintain. Now, the jeepneys are one of the things that makes the Philippines truly the Philippines.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to pay for the spare parts and maintenance of her jeepney unit.

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
Josephine is 47-years-old, married with five children, two of whom are in school. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. 

Josephine has a business selling sea shells in the Philippines. Josephine requested a PHP 13,000 loan amount through NWTF in order to purchase more sea shells to sell.

Josephine has been in this business for twenty years. In the future, Josephine would like to save money to expand her business and continue to send her children to school.

loans.use: to purchase more sea shells to sell.

loans.name: Julie

texts.en:
Julie is 32 years old and married with four children. Three of her children are in school. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur. 

Julie has a fish vending business in the Philippines. Julie requested a PHP 5000 loan through NWTF in order to buy more fish to sell.

Julie has been in this business for five years. In the future, Julie would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more fish to sell to customers.

loans.name: Carmelita

texts.en:
Carmelita is a married mother with four children. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur. Carmelita is 41 years old, and all of her children are in school.

Carmelita has a fish vending business in the Philippines. Carmelita requested a PHP 6000 loan through NWTF in order to buy more seafood to sell to customers.

Carmelita has been in this business for five years. In the future, Carmelita would like to save money so she can afford to continue to send her children to school.

loans.use: to buy more seafood to sell to customers.

loans.name: Melissa

texts.es: Melissa de 22 años de edad, es propietaria de un salón de peluquería, negocio que inició desde hace 3 años, una vez hubo realizado estudios técnicos, en una academia de belleza. Ella y su cuñada quien también estudió pedicure y manicure, cuando terminaron simultáneamente,  decidieron unirse para emprender su propia aventura emprendedora. Hoy ofrecen servicios de mejoramiento capilar, alisados, peinados, tinturado, pedicure, manicure, directamente en su local, comprando sus insumos a mayoristas, para lograr precios que al por mayor, le resultan muy competitivos. Sus principales clientes son sus vecinos y amigos, que poco a poco han ido refiriendo mucha mas clientela. En la actualidad está aplicando a un credikiva, primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, mediante el cual comprará un aire acondicionado, y productos de peluquería, con lo que mejorarán la comodidad de sus clientes, pues ofrecerían un mejor clima cuando estos esperan ser atendidos, en un municipio de tierra caliente, ubicado a orillas del mar y de gente con mucha calidez humana, a la que hay que ofrecer un buen servicio. .
texts.en:
Melissa is 22 years old. She owns a hairdressing salon, which she started three years ago after she finished a training program in a beauty school. Her sister-in-law trained to be a manicurist and pedicurist, and when she finished her training at the same time as Melissa, they decided to join together to start their own business venture. Today they provide beauty and hair treatments in their shop such as straightening, dyeing, highlighting, manicures and pedicures. Melissa and her sister-in-law buy their supplies from distributors in order to get wholesale prices, which they say are very competitive. Their main customers are neighbors and friends who, little by little, have referred many more people to them.

This is Melissa’s fist loan with Kiva and the field partner. She will use it to buy hairdressing supplies and an air conditioner. She says that the air conditioner will make her customers more comfortable while waiting to be helped, because the shop is located in a hot, humid area on the edge of the sea. Melissa says that her customers are kind and full of life, and that she has to take care of them well.

loans.use: to buy an air conditioner and hairdressing supplies.

loans.name: Anita

texts.en:
Anita is 30 years old, and she lives in Margibi County, which has the largest producing rubber plantation in Liberia. She was fortunate to attend school and finish 12th grade before becoming involved with business for six years now. 

She is unmarried and has two children, 9 and 13 years old. Her children are living at home and go to school. Her fiancé is a local businessman. 

She started her business with a little money from her aunty.   She is requesting a loan to purchase slipper and rubber dishes (plates, blow, pan, etc) for her business.  

She hopes to build a house for herself and children.

loans.use: to purchase slipper and rubber dishes (plates, blow, pan, etc) for her business.

loans.name: Abibatu

texts.en:
Meet Abibatu. She is 42 years old and from Waterloo in the eastern area of Freetown. She is married with four children. For the past eleven years, Abibatu has established her retail business. She began her business because she wanted to generate a permanent source of income. She works at the business from 8:00 a.m. until 7:00 p.m., seven days a week. She says that the main challenge for her business is insufficient capital to expand her business.

Abibatu requires a loan in order to purchase more palm oil and cola nuts to expand her business. She hopes that the extra income from this loan will allow her to improve her welfare and increase her business. In the future, Abibatu plans to open a food table. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to purchase more palm oil and cola nuts to expand her business.

loans.name: Hawa

texts.en:
Meet 48-year-old Hawa from Jui in eastern Freetown. She is married with three children. In 2005 Hawa started working because she wanted to establish a more permanent source of income. She works at her business from 8:00 a.m. until 7:00 p.m. seven days a week. Her main business challenge is a lack of enough money to enlarge her business.

Hawa is applying for a 800,000 SLL loan through BRAC Sierra Leone to buy cigarettes, needles and local Sappho and local soap to expand her business. She hopes that this loan will lead to increased profits and a better standard of living. 

In the future Hawa plans to sell food from a table. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to buy cigarettes, needles, local Sappho and local soap to expand her business.

loans.name: Freddy Omar

texts.es: Freddy es un joven originario de la ciudad de Estelí, de 28 años de edad, Casado y padre de un hijo. Se dedica a mantenimiento vial, el cual con mucho empeño ha logrado mantener económicamente a su familia. Es un hombre con mucha voluntad para ofrecerle a su familia una vida mejor, que con los ingresos de su trabajo apoya a su esposa. Su meta próxima es mejorar la infraestructura de su vivienda. Solicita el crédito de saneamiento para  mejorar condiciones sanitarias a su domicilio con el fin de obtener una mejor higiene. Estima el crédito le será muy beneficioso ya que podrá asegurarle su pequeño hijo un  ambiente seguro donde vivir. Su plan futuro es seguir mejorando las condiciones en su vivienda.
texts.en:
Freddy is a young native of the city of Esteli, 28 years of age, married and the father of a son. He works in street maintenance which with much effort has enabled him to sustain his family. Freddy is a man who, with a great desire to offer his family a better life, helps his wife with the income from his work.
His immediate goal is to improve the infrastructure of his residence. Freddy is requesting a sanitation loan for his house. He wants to achieve better hygene and believes the loan will be very beneficial since it will assure his young son of a safe place to live. Freddy's future plan is to continue improving conditions in his home.

loans.use: improve sanitary conditions in his residence.

loans.name: Marga Damai Group

texts.en:
The Marga Damai Group decided to continue their loans. Having a sow, they need the loan to purchase feed and renovate the cage. However, some of the members will also use the loan to buy a sow. They want to breed more piglets.

Ni Ketut will use her portion of the loan to purchase a sow. She plans to sell the piglets outside her village in order to earn more income. She hopes her plan goes well. All the member also expect the same, i.e. that the business will go well, the sow will give birth safely and the piglets will grow healthy. 

Ni Ketut will use her profit to support her children's education and fullfill her family's daily needs.

loans.use: to purchase a sow.

loans.name: Cistina

texts.en: Cistina is married with two children.  She lives in Tukuran, Zamboanga Del Sur along with her family. To earn a living, she owns and operates a retail business which sells cosmetics in the local community. For the four years she has been in the business, Cistina was able to support her husband's income and successfully repaid her previous loan from GDMPC. She borrowed a new loan to boost her business. She always finds ways in order to augment their living. She used her new loan to purchase more cosmetic products to sell in their village. Her hopes in life are to have a better future and to improve her living situation.

loans.use: to purchase more cosmetic products to sell.

loans.name: Erlinda

texts.en:
Erlinda is married and has four children.  She lives in Tukuran, Zamboanga Del Sur along with her family. 

She has managed her own general store for nine years in the local community to earn a living. She joined GDMPC in 2010, and her previous loan used for the business was successfully repaid through her determination to augment the family's living.

She took out a new loan to purchase more grocery goods to resell. She hopes to sustain and improve her business in order to have a stable source of income in the near future.

loans.use: to purchase more grocery goods to resell.

loans.name: Evelyn

texts.en:
As a married mother of three children, Evelyn works hard to support her family.

She has a fruit vending business in the Philippines.  She has requested a loan of PHP 6,000 through NWTF to buy more fruits, such as bananas, as well as root crops and other fruits to sell.

Evelyn has been sustaining her business activities through her past two loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of saving money to expand her business and repair her family home.

loans.use: to buy more fruits, such as bananas, as well as root crops and other fruits to sell.

loans.name: Kadiatu

texts.en:
Meet 32-year-old Kadiatu from Jui, in the eastern area in Freetown. She is married with one child, age five.  

For the past four years, Kadiatu has run a retail business. She began her business because she wanted to empower herself and take care of her parent.  She works at the business from 8:00 am until 7:00 pm, 7 days per week. She is very hard-working, and has a desire to improve her standard of living

Kadiatu requires a loan to purchase ground nuts and gari to expand her business. She hopes that the extra income from this loan will improve her standard of living and increase her business. 

In the future, Kadiatu plans to expand her business more. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to purchase ground nuts and gari expand her business.

loans.name: Mahawa

texts.en:
Mahawa is in her late forties and married with 3 children between the ages of 3 and 15 years old. She runs a general merchandise business in Tombo Western rural area in Sierra Leone. She began her business to make a living.

She has been in this business since after she got married. She sells soda, milk, cigarette and soap within her community.  She says that the main problem for her business is lack of capital to expand.

Mahawa requested this loan through BRAC Sierra Leone to purchase more soda, milk, cigarette and soap for resale. She says that the extra income from this loan will help her increase her business and improve her standard of living. In the future she would like to open a big provision shop. She is grateful for your support.

loans.use: to purchase more soda, milk, cigarettes and soap for resale

loans.name: Twizerimana Group

texts.fr:
Gédéon  fait partie du groupe Twizerimana et habite  à Bujumbura .Il a  44ans et est marié à Dorcelle, une cultivatrice. Ensemble ils ont 5 enfants âgés de 5 à 17 ans, tous étudient.

Il fait  le commerce de brochette depuis 10 ans.

Il est à son dix-septième crédit à Turame. Avec le crédit Kiva qu’il obtient, il va augmenter son capital et acheter beaucoup de chèvres pour vendre  une grande quantité de brochettes à vendre pour gagner plus.
texts.en:
Gédéon, age 44, is a member of the Twizerimana group and he lives in Bujumbura. He is married to a farmer named Dorcelle, and together they have five children aged 5 to 17 who all go to school. 

Gédéon has been selling kebabs for 10 years. This is seventeenth loan cycle with Turame, and he plans to use the credit to strengthen his working capital and buy lots of goats to make a large quantity of kebabs to sell and bolster his revenue.

loans.use: to strengthen his working capital and buy lots of goats to make a large quantity of kebabs to sell and bolster his revenue.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more wood to resell.

loans.name: Mingdona

texts.ru: Мингдона родилась в 1957 года. Она замужем и на воспитании имеет 5 детей. Она 15 лет назад начала свой бизнес скотоводством. Она очень нуждалась в деньгах, так как обеспечение 5 детей требует много денег. Мингдона является одной из успешных бизнес леди в сфере скотоводства. Она знает все тонкости своего дела. Мингдона имеет большой коровник у себя дома. У нее огромный дом. Она откармливает как крупно -рогатого скота, так и мелко-рогатого скота. Она хочет увеличить свой оборотный капитал и таким образом получать больше дохода. Она запрашивает займ на сумму 5000 сомони для покупки скота. Она ждет вашу доброту.
texts.en: Mingdona was born in 1957. She is married is raising five children. Fifteen years ago, she started her cattle breeding business. She was in dire need of money, since raising five children is expensive. Mingdona is one of the most successful business women in the field of animal husbandry. She knows the ins and outs of the business. Mingdona has a large barn at home. She has a huge house. She fattens cattle and other livestock. She wants to increase her working capital and thus generate more revenue. She is asking for a loan of 5000 KGS to buy cattle. She's awaiting your kindness.

loans.use: buy cattle and increase working capital

loans.name: Anna Marie

texts.en:
Anna Marie is a married entrepreneur from Militar,Tukuran, and has been earning a living from her transport service business for five years. Aside from this, she also raises pigs to sell in town to earn more income for the family.

To improve business, she is borrowing capital from GDMPC micro credit for her business.  She joined GDMP in 2011, and her previous loan was successfully repaid, as she worked hard with perseverance. Her new loan was used to buy feed and two piglets to keep in addition to her existing pigs.  

Anna Marie is hopeful of the possibility of sustaining her business.

loans.use: to buy two piglets and feed.

loans.name: Edna

texts.en:
Edna joined GDMPC in 2012, and she gained access to micro finance services, which allows her a way to borrow for the business. She successfully repaid her previous loans that contributed a lot to running her business. 

Currently, she requests a new loan to purchase spare parts and accessories  for her vulcanizing shop. For nine years in the business, Edna has earned well to sustain the needs of her four children. 

Edna  wants to have a better future and to improve her business.

loans.use: to purchase spare parts and accessories  for her vulcanizing shop.

loans.name: Gina Jean

texts.en:
As a married mother of two children, Gina Jean works hard to support her family.


She has a fish vending business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from dressmaking. Gina Jean is borrowing PHP 9,000 through NWTF in order to buy more fish to sell to customers.


Gina Jean has been sustaining her business activities through her past four loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save money to expand her business and continue to send her children to school.

loans.use: to buy more fish to sell to customers.

loans.name: Milagros

texts.en:
Milagros is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a tailoring business in the Philippines. She successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her business.

Milagros is requesting a 20,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy supplies for her tailoring business. NWTF is re-listing Milagros's business profile in support of her efforts to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy tailoring supplies

loans.name: Ma. Fe

texts.en:
Ma. Fe is the married mother of three children. She runs a clothing business in the Philippines and also earns additional income dressmaking. Ma. Fe works hard to support her family. She has been sustaining her business activities through her past four loans from NWTF.

Ma. Fe is requesting an 8,000 PHP loan through NWTF to purchase more ready-to-wear clothing to sell. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of saving money to expand her business and repair her family home.

loans.use: to purchase more ready-to-wear clothing to sell

loans.name: Wilma

texts.en:
Wilma is the married mother of seven children. She has a charcoal-selling business in the Philippines and also earns additional income from selling fruit. Wilma works hard to support her family.

Wilma is requesting a 5,000 PHP loan through NWTF to purchase more stock to sell. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of saving money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more fuel to sell

loans.name: Cheryl

texts.en:
Cheryl is the married mother of three children. She runs a fish-vending business in the Philippines and also sells ready-to-wear clothing. Cheryl works hard to support her family. She has been sustaining her business activities through her past four loans from NWTF.

Cheryl is requesting an 8,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy more fish to sell to customers. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of saving money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy fish to sell to customers

loans.name: Jelicatu

texts.en:
Meet 49-year-old Jelicatu from Waterloo2 eastern area in Freetown. She is married with three children between the ages of 6 years and 14 years. For the past 30 years, Jelicatu has established her palm oil business. She began her business because she wanted to generate her own source of income to develop her family. She works at the business from 8:00 a.m. until 7:00 p.m., seven days per week. She says that the main challenges to her business are insufficient capital to expand her business and the poor road network.

Jelicatu requires a loan in order to purchase more palm oil and gari [casava flakes] to expand her business. She hopes that the extra income from this loan will allow her to change her status of living and increase her business. In the future, Jelicatu plans to expand her business more. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to purchase more palm oil and gari to expand her business.

loans.name: Adamasay

texts.en:
Meet 45-year-old Adamasay from Jui Eastern area in Freetown. She is married with six children. Fifteen years ago, Adamasay established her food stand business. She began her business because she wanted to create a daily living for her children. She works at the business from 8:00 a.m. until 7:00 p.m., seven days per week. She is very hardworking and desires to improve her standard of living

Adamasay requires a loan in order to purchase rice, palm oil and cooking seasonings to expand her business. She hopes that the extra income from this loan will allow her to feed her children and increase her business. In the future, Adamasay plans to expand her business more. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to purchase rice, palm oil and cooking seasonings to expand her business.

loans.name: Anita

texts.en:
Meet 26-year-old Anita from Waterloo Eastern area in Freetown. She is married with 2 children between the ages of 7 years and 4years.  In 2010, Anita established her palm oil business. She got married at an early age, and she began her business because she wants to empower herself.  She works at the business from 8:00 am until 7:00 pm, 7 days per week. She says that the main challenges to her business are insufficient capital to expand her business and a poor road network.

Anita requires a loan in order to purchase more palm oil and gari to expand her business. She hopes that the extra income from this loan will allow her to change her standard of living and increase her business. In the future, Anita plans to expand her business more. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to purchase more palm oil and gari to expand her business.

loans.name: Dandaza Group

texts.fr:
Dénise  fait partie du groupe  Danaza et  habite à Bubanza. Elle  a 37 ans et est mariée à Moïse. Ensemble ils ont 7 enfants âgés de 13 à 21 ans, dont 4 étudient.

Elle  fait le commerce  de charbons de bois depuis  7 ans. 

C’est son premier  crédit à Turame. Avec le crédit KIVA qu’elle obtient, elle  va  augmenter son capital et acheter  7 sacs de charbons de bois à revendre pour gagner plus. 

Dans les prochaines  années, elle voudrait acheter une terre pour la culture et les chèvres pour l’élevage de petit  bétail.
texts.en:
Dénise, age 37, is a member of the group Dandaza and she lives in Bubanza. She is married to a man named Moïse, and they have seven children aged 13 to 21, four of whom go to school. 

Dénise has been selling charcoal for seven years. This is her first loan cycle with Turame, and she plans to use the credit to bolster her working capital and buy 7 sacks of charcoal to sell, thereby boosting her revenue.  

In the coming years, she would like to purchase some land for a farming activity, and some goats to start raising small animals.

loans.use: to bolster her working capital and buy 7 sacks of charcoal to sell, thereby boosting her revenue.

loans.name: Ainur

texts.ru: Айнур 49 лет, вдова, после смерти мужа сама воспитывает троих детей, а также ведет свое хозяйство. У Айнур - средне-специальное образование, в качестве основного дохода для своей семьи Айнур занимается животноводством, стартовав 23 года назад, с покупки скота на 5,000 сом KGS. Благодаря упорному труду Айнур, в ее хозяйстве на сегодняшний день имеется: 1 дойная корова, 1 бычок, 15 овец. Ежемесячный доход составляет 15,000 сом (KGS). В целях дальнейшего развития своего хозяйства, Айнур обратилась в Микрофинансовый банк «Бай –Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 100,000 сом (KGS) на покупку коров для увеличения поголовья скота. Доходы от кредита Айнур планирует вложить в дальнейшее приумножение количества домашней скотины, и планирует накопить средства на дальнейшее обучение детей.
texts.en: Ainur is 49 years old. She became a widow after her husband's death.  She has three children and also runs her own farm. Ainur has a vocational education. The family's main source of income is Ainur's animal husbandry business which she started 23 years ago with 5,000 KGS. Thanks to Ainur's hard work, her farm now boasts one milk cow, one bull, and fifteen sheep. Her monthly income is 15,000 KGS. In order to further develop her farm, Ainur has asked the microfinance bank Bai Tushum and Partners for a loan of 100,000 KGS to buy cattle for breeding. Ainur plans to reinvest profits made from the loan into further expanding the number of animal she has. She is also planning to save money to educate her children.

loans.use: buy cows

loans.name: Saida

texts.ru: Женщина, которая любит трудится и на воспитании имеет 3 детей, планирует организовать свой бизнес, так как она нуждается в деньгах. Она много лет не имела источника дохода. Так как ее муж имеет маленький доход от выращивания сельхоз культур и не в состоянии обеспечить своих детей со всеми не обходимыми средствами. Дети год за годом требуют больше благ, так как они развеваются вместе с развевающимся миром. Она решила организовать бизнес шитьем женской одежды, так как она имеет хорошие навыки по шитью женской одежды. Она долго искала помощь и наконец, она узнала о курсе «Добейся Успеха» организованной Ассоциация Деловых Женщин. Она участвовала на этом курсе и получила много позитива для себя. После завершения курса она получила сертификат. Теперь она готова начать бизнес, однако она не имеет денег, чтобы купить швейную машинку. Она запрашивает займ на сумму 500 сомони для покупки швейной машинки. Она ждет вашу доброту.
texts.en: This woman who likes to work and is raising three children is planning to start a business because she needs the money. For many years she had no source of income. Her husband has a small income from farming, but it is not enough to provide for all their children's needs. Year after year, the children require more and more. She decided to start a business sewing women's clothes since she is skilled in sewing women's clothes. She's been looking for help, and finally she found out about the class, "Bring It On" organized by the Association of Business Women. She participated in this course and learned a great deal. After completing the course she got a certificate. Now she is ready to start a business, but she it does not have the money to buy a sewing machine. She is asking for a loan of 500 TJS to buy a sewing machine. She's awaiting your kindness.

loans.use: buy a sewing machine to start a new business.

loans.name: Vanny

texts.en:
Vanny, age 52, lives in the suburbs of Phnom Penh.  She has been married since 1981 and has one son who repairs cell phones and he installs cell phone applications and Mp3 and Mp4 players.  She also has two daughters, who are in school.  Her husband is a driver.

Vanny stays at home and does housework.  The main source of income is from her son and husband.  She is asking for a loan to help her son to buy more cell phones and phone accessories for resale.

loans.use: To help her son to buy more cell phones and phone accessories for resale.

loans.name: Wilfredo

texts.es: Wilfredo vive junto a su esposa y sus dos  hijos, él posee un taller de estructuras metálicas, elabora puertas, balcones, rejas entre otros, tiene varios años de dedicarse a este negocio y tiene mucha experiencia que le ayuda a mejorar cada día su labor, hasta ahora el negocio le ha dado muy buenos resultados ya se hizo de mucha clientela pues lo buscan por la calidad de su trabajo, por los precios accesibles pero sobre todo porque siempre realiza el trabajo al gusto del cliente; Wilfredo es un hombre muy trabajador, honesto y sobre todo humilde, siempre está a la expectativa de nuevas oportunidades que le permitan superarse y llegar al éxito; quiere hacer crecer el negocio pero necesita de capital para compra de materiales  por eso le solicita a INTEGRAL un crédito que le permita comprar, hierro, metal, herramienta etc. Wilfredo  tiene buenas referencias crediticias y está seguro que podrá saldar la deuda y a la vez llevar a su hogar seguridad económica.
texts.en:
Wilfredo lives with his wife and two children. He has a metalworking shop where he makes doors, window bars, grilles and other metal items. Wilfredo has worked at his business for a number of years now, and he says that he has a lot of experience, which helps him to improve his work every day. Wilfredo says that his business has done very well until now, and that he has gained many customers because his work is high-quality, his prices are affordable and, most of all, he always does the job according to their wishes. 

Wilfredo is described as a very hard-working person who is modest and always looking for new opportunities to better himself and achieve success. Wilfredo says that he wants to expand his business, but he needs capital to move forward. He is requesting this loan from the field partner to buy materials such as iron, metal and tools. Wilfredo says that he has good credit references and is sure that he will be able to pay off the loan while making his family more economically secure.

loans.use: to buy iron, metal, tools and other items for his metalworking shop.

loans.name: Bahtigul

texts.ru: Бахтигул является одним из таких личностей, которая старается улучшить условия жизни. Ей 20 лет. Она замужем, но не имеет детей. Ее муж получает маленькую зарплату. Это зарплата не хватает для обеспечения семьи со всеми необходимыми средствами. Бахтигул решила помочь мужу для благо получения семьи. С такой целью она обучилась в курсе «Добейся успеха» организованный Ассоциация Деловых Женщин и получила сертификат. Теперь она вполне может организовать свой бизнес и стать успешной в этой сфере. Она хочет организовать бизнес предоставлением услуги швеи, так как имеет опыт в этом виде бизнеса. От полученного дохода она планирует обеспечить свою семью. Она запрашивает займ на сумму 500 сомони для покупки швейной машинки, чтобы организовать новый бизнес. Она ждет вашу доброту.
texts.en: Bahtigul is the type of person who tries to improve her living conditions. She is 20 years old. She is married but has no children. Her husband earns a small salary. This salary is not enough to provide the family with everything they need. Bahtigul decided to help her husband for the good of the family. Therefore, she signed up for the course, "Bring It On" organized by the Association of Business Women and received a certificate. Now she is completely capable of starting a business and becoming successful. She wants to start a sewing business, since she has experience in this. She plans to support her husband with the money. She is asking for a loan of 500 TJS to buy a sewing machine in order to start a new business. She's awaiting your kindness.

loans.use: buy a sewing machine to start a new business.

loans.name: Vellie

texts.en: Vellie is 22 years old and married with one kid. She works hard to provide a brighter future for her family. Vellie manages a business buying and selling  bananas and fish within her village. She has been engaged in this kind of business for two years. Having this kind of business helps her in attaining her objective in life, which is providing her family with a comfortable lifestyle. This time, she wishes to fulfill her goal immediately. With her eagerness to obtain her goal, she requested additional capital of PHP 5,000, which will be used to buy bananas and fish to resell. She hopes that lenders will grant her requested loan for the continuous smooth flow of her business.

loans.use: to buy bananas and fish

loans.name: Zarina

texts.ru: Зарина обратилась в ИМОН первый раз. Она хочет организовать свой бизнес, так как она участвовала в курсе «Добейся Успеха» организованного Ассоциация Деловых Женщин и получила сертификат. Она имеет хорошие знания и отличные навыки по шитью женской одежды. Зарина, однако, не имеет финансовой поддержки со стороны родителей. Она не замужем и живет с родителями. Ее родители простые фермеры. Она хочет купить швейную машинку и организовать свой бизнес шитьем и продажей женских халатов и платьев. Она будет предоставлять свои услуги и производством в швейном цехе, который находится в центре ее района. Она будет арендовать место своего бизнеса. Она запрашивает займ на сумму 500 сомони для покупки швейной машинки. Она ждет вашу доброту.
texts.en: Zarina is asking IMON for her first loan. She wants to start a business. She participated in the course "Bring It On" organized by the Association of Business Women and received a certificate. She has a good knowledge base and excellent skills in sewing women's clothes. Zarina, however, receives no financial support from her parents. She is single and lives with her parents. Her parents are simple farmers. She wants to buy a sewing machine and start a business selling women's robes and dresses. She will make the dresses in her shop, which is located in the center of her region. She will rent a place of business. She is asking for a loan of 500 TJS to buy a sewing machine. She's awaiting your kindness.

loans.use: buy sewing machine to start a new business

loans.name: Imelda

texts.en:
Imelda, 45 years old, has been running her general store for five years. Through having this kind of business, she was able to earn a living. She hopes to educate her three children someday. According to Imelda, she enjoys her business because it allows her to save for the future of her children and improve her living conditions.

Now, she wants to add to the grocery items she offers within her locality, but due to insufficient funds she has had, she is requesting a loan of PHP 6,000 (Philippine pesos) to buy canned goods, breads, vinegar, soy sauce, onions and ginger. She hopes that her requested loan amount will be provided in order to increase her sales and make her business profitable.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, breads, vinegar, soy sauce, onions and ginger for her retail store.

loans.name: 08-02-07-Phú Sơn2 Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Quy operates a food stall/restaurant selling vegetables. She is requesting a loan to purchase vegetables to resell. Quy has been involved in this business for 3 years. She is 54 years old and she is married with 3 children, one still a dependent while the 2 others are grown up. She lives and works in Thanh Hoa city, an urban area in Thanh Hoa province. She is the group leader of the 08-02-07-Phú Sơn2 solidarity group, which consists of 3 members. 

In 2012, Quy joined the Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to improve her business. She has successfully repaid 2 loans from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. The main hardship that she faces in her business is the lack of capital. With her business profit, Quy hopes for her children to find a good job, for her family to be healthy and happy, and for her business to do well.

loans.use: to purchase vegetables to resell.

loans.name: Eden

texts.en: Eden is 47 years of age. She strives hard and industriously to make bags made up of beads. Eden wants her source of income to be sustainable so that she could help her husband in generating income, which will be used in sending her four children to school. She believes that through her hard work and persistence, she could cover all their household expenditures. With her determination to improve her financial stability and way of living, she is seeking a loan of 5,000 PHP [Philippines pesos], allowing her to buy a variety colors of beads (raw material in making bags, pouches and coin purses). Through this loan amount, she could be able to create more bags, pouches and coin purses to resell within her locality and nearby villages.

loans.use: to buy a variety of colors of beads to use for her retail business.

loans.name: Renelfa

texts.en:
Renelfa is 41 years old. She is married and has five children. She lives in Tamban, Baliangao, Misamis Occidental. 

Renelfa has engaged in a piggery business for four years and also does coco farming. She earns a monthly income of Php 4,000 doing this type of work. She requested a new loan to purchase two sacks of fertilizer and three sacks of pig feed.

Renelfa has been a microfinance member of Paglaum MPC for three years. She hopes to have enough savings in the near future.

loans.use: to purchase two sacks of fertilizer and three sacks of pig feed.

location.town: Calamba-Tamban Punta Miray Baliangao Misamis Occid

loans.name: Mary Jane

texts.en:
Mary Jane is thankful for the financial assistance previously extended to her. She was able to buy spare parts and accessories for her jeepney,  that's been useful to her for more than four years. Her loan was also helpful in the education of her child. She and her husband are both working hard to provide for their everyday needs. The income from her business is supporting their everyday household expenditures. 

She would like to apply for another 25,000 PHP loan  to buy spare parts and to pay for the maintenance of their jeepney unit. She looks forward to this financial assistance with gladness and thankfulness in her heart. Her profits from her business will definitely help her to sustain their daily needs and her child's education. 

Mary Jane dreams of having additional  jeepney units and hopes to have a better living.  She meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week.  Here she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God that she studies. 

-Curiously, Jeepneys have purely American origins.  They were first used by American soldiers helping the Philippines against the invading Japanese.  Filipino ingenuity, however, managed to see this vehicle as an opportunity to earn, and modified the Jeep into a 20-seater jeepney, open enough to provide adequate ventilation, sturdy for every day travel, and cheap enough to buy and maintain.  Now, the jeepneys are one of the things that makes the Philippines truly Philippines.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners.  The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, to build social capital, and to pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for spare parts and maintenance of her jeepney.

loans.name: Miguela

texts.en:
Miguela is thankful for the previous financial assistance extended to her. She was able to buy the needed materials and supplies for her farm, which has been in operation for more than 10 years now. Her loan was also helpful in the education of her children. Miguela's income is supporting their household's expenditures as she and her husband work hard to provide for their everyday expenses.

Miguela would like to request another 10,000 PHP loan to buy fertilizers and other materials needed in her business. Her profits will definitely help sustain the family's daily needs and the children's education. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

Miguela dreams of buying more land to expand her farm, and she hopes that her children will finish their studies. She meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week and draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners gathering each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay micro finance loans.

loans.use: to pay for fertilizers and other materials needed in her business.

loans.name: Juanita

texts.en:
This is Juanita, a 59 year-old  resident of Silang, Cavite, Philippines. She is a widow and a mother of  children who are all working. Together with her children, she manages their  household while operating the business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses.
 
Juanita operates an ornamental plant business. She grows garden plants that are native to the Philippines like ylang-ylang, golden shower, dahlia, and a variety of hanging and other plants. Her regular customers are local tourists, neighbors and the nearby community.  She earns a minimum of 400 PHP in sales every day.

To help her continue the operation of her business, she is requesting a loan of 12, 000 PHP. She will be using the loan to buy gardening materials and supplies, such as seed and fertilizer needed for her business. 

Juanita hopes that her business will last a long time and dreams that her family’s life will be better. She meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week. Here she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for gardening materials and supplies, such as seed and fertilizer needed for her business.

loans.name: Tara

texts.en:
Tara (in the photo), age 20, has just been a college teacher for 2 months. He is single lives with his parents on an Island of Mekong River. 

Tara wants to continue his studies by getting a bachelor's degree in at a university in Phnom Penh. He has decided to apply for an education loan. He will use the loan to pay for his third year of school, where he is majoring in Math. Tara teaches from Monday to Friday and he studies at the weekend, Saturday and Sunday.
Tara expects that he will graduate in 2015 and get a salary of about $200 a month.

The explanation how Tara can be a college student and a college teacher at the same time: Tara had already attended pedagogy for two years to become a teacher. That is why the university allows him to continue his degree in third year.

loans.use: To pay for his school fees.

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.es: La clienta vive con su esposo en casa propia, ella trabaja como  empleada en una fábrica, con lo que obtiene de su trabajo y con la ayuda de su esposo logran salir adelante y solventar algunos gastos que se les presenta, ahora ella esta solicitando un crédito para poder mejorar su vivienda, por esa razón solicita dicho crédito para poder comprar cemento, arena, ladrillo, etc. y poder construir un cuarto  para que pueda vivir junto con su esposo mas cómodos y seguros.
texts.en: This client lives with her husband in a house they own. She works as an employee in a factory. With her earnings from her job and with her husband’s help she has succeeded in getting ahead and in paying off some debts that she has. Now she is requesting a loan to improve her dwelling. Said loan will be used to buy cement, sand, bricks, etc in order to construct a room so that she can live with her husband more comfortably and safely.

loans.use: to purchase cement, sand and bricks, etc.

loans.name: Lolita

texts.en: Lolita helps  her husband to earn income for their family of  four children. She has been selling grocery goods for five years and was able to provide for their daily needs. She is requesting a loan from Field Partner GDMPC  to buy additional grocery goods for resale. She plans to save a portion of her profits for the future needs of her family.

loans.use: to buy additional grocery goods for resale

location.town: Sto. Niño, Tukuran, Zamboanga del Sur

loans.name: Merlinda

texts.en:
Merlinda is 37 years old and lives in Mohon, Aloran, Misamis Occidental. She is married with one child. 


Merlinda has a store and sells groceries and other consumable products. She earns approximately PHP 9,000 each month doing this type of work. She has requested a loan to purchase additional groceries and other consumable products for retail. 


Merlinda has been a member of PMPC for one year. In the future, she hopes to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional groceries and other consumable products.

loans.name: Jeanne

texts.en: Jeanne is married and has two children.  Jeanne runs a general store for a living, selling a variety of food and home-use products in the local community. Jeanne has been doing her business for more than ten years and earns well for the family. She joined GDMPC in 2012 and her previous loan used for the business was successfully repaid. Recently, she borrowed a new loan to purchase rice and corn grits to resell. Jeanne hopes to improve the general living of her family in the near future.

loans.use: to purchase rice and corn grits to resell.

loans.name: Annalisa

texts.en:
Annalisa is thankful for the financial assistance extended to her. It was helpful not just in her variety store, but also in her rice and videoke business. Her loan is also helpful in the education of her child. Her income from the business is sustaining their everyday household expenditures.

She would like to apply for another 55,000 PHP loan for her to buy groceries, toiletries, beverages and other products to add to her current inventory. The more items displayed at the store, the better. More items to sell will result for better profit. Her profits from the business will definitely help sustain her family's daily needs and her child's education. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

Annalisa hopes to have more business, and dreams of giving her family a good future. She meets with her co-fellowship* members weekly to share stories of her work and to draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God which she studies.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups of 15 to 30 that meet weekly. The groups study the Word of God, build social capital, and encourage the repayment of micro-finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for grocery items, toiletries and beverages for her business.

loans.name: Jasmine

texts.en:
Jasmine is thankful for the financial assistance extended to her. She has a mini grocery store, and she was able to buy more products and supplies. She also has a van for rent and a tricycle for additional income. Her child is in college already, and she is thankful to God for strength and grace to support her child. 

She would like to apply for another 55,000 PHP loan for her to buy groceries, toiletries, beverages and other products to add to her inventory. The more items displayed at the store, the better. More items to sell will result in better profit. Her profits from the business will definitely help sustain her family’s daily needs and her child’s education expenses. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

Even though she has businesses already, she still wants to invest in other businesses. She meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week, where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for groceries, toiletries and beverages to expand her product inventory.

loans.name: Somsoore Iigroup

texts.fr:
Mr SOUMAILA est la responsable du groupe SOMSOORE II. Marié  et sans enfant. Il a 02 personnes en charge. 
Mr vend des prêts à porter depuis 04ans. Elle s’approvisionne au marché du secteur 15. Ses clients sont les femmes et les hommes.
Il veut s’acheter 15 paires de chemise et 10pairs de pantalons et des hauts pour femmes.
Mr veut réinvestir ses bénéfices dans son activité. Il souhaite étendre les limites de son activité et mieux s’occuper de sa famille.
texts.en:
Mr. SOUMAILA is responsible for the group SOMSOORE II. Married without children, he supports two people. 

Mr. SOUMAILA has been selling ready-to-wear clothing for four years. He buys his stock at the market of Sector 15. His clients are women and men. He wishes to buy 15 shirts, 10 pairs of pants, and some ladies’ tops. 

He wants to reinvest his profit in his business. He would like to expand his activity and take better care of his family.

loans.use: to buy 15 shirts, 10 pairs of pants, and some ladies’ tops.

loans.name: Jyrgal

texts.ru: Жыргал 25 лет, не замужем. В 2012 году, начала бизнес в торговле мужской и женской одежды, используя в качестве стартового капитала сумму в 50,000 сом (KGS). Сумев развить свой бизнес и обретя постоянных клиентов, Жыргал имеет среднемесячный доход в сумме 20,000 сом (KGS). Благодаря упорному труду в бизнесе, Жыргал смогла увеличить товарооборот и развить свой бизнес. В целях дальнейшего увеличения и расширения своего бизнеса, Жыргал обратилась в Микрофинансовый банк «Бай-Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 120,000 сом (KGS) на увеличение товарооборота. Доходы от кредита Жыргал планирует вложить в товарооборот.
texts.en: Jyrgal is 25 years old and not married.  She started her own business in selling men's and women's clothing in 2012, using a starting capital of 50,000 som (KGS).  Having been able to develop her business and obtained regular clients, Jyrgal has an average monthly income of 20,000 som (KGS).  Thanks to her hard work in business, Jyrgal was able to increase her goods turnover and develop her business.  In order to further develop her business, Jyrgal requested a loan in the amount of 120,000 som (KGS) from the microfinance bank "Bai-Tushum and Partners" to increase her goods turnover. She plans to invest the earnings from the loan into her goods turnover.

loans.use: to increase goods turnover

loans.name: Marina

texts.es:
Marina es una clienta de Kubo Financiero y esta es su historia:

Marina es casada, tiene tres hijos y vive en una casa rentada desde hace cinco años. Su negocio consiste en la venta de pinturas y manualidades. 

Su negocio, con el cual lleva cinco años, lo atiende en su casa y así no descuida a su familia. Su esposo se dedica al mismo giro, con la diferencia de que él tiene su negocio ubicado en el centro de la Ciudad de México. 

Durante estos meses del año es cuando ella invierte mucho en mercancía ya que es la temporada donde le piden mucho material y manualidades; por esto es por lo que pide este préstamo. Con este dinero adicional tendría más ventas y por lo mismo sus ingresos se multiplicarían y le daría a su familia una mejor calidad de vida.

Sus logros es que gracias a su trabajo ha comprado artículos a crédito y los ha pagado bien. Sus retos son poder sacar adelante a sus hijos y en general darles una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Marina is a client of Kubo Financiero, and here is her story:

Marina is married, has three children, and has lived in a rented house for five years.  Her business consists of selling paints and handicrafts.  She has been in her business for five years, and she tends to it at her house.  This way she does not neglect her family.  Her husband works in the same field.  However, the difference is that he has his business located in the center of the city of Mexico.

During these months is when she invests a lot in merchandise because it is the season when she is asked for a lot of materials and handicrafts.  That is why she is requesting this loan.  With this additional money she will have more sales.  Her income will multiply, and that way she will give her family a better quality of life.

Her achievement is that, thanks to her work, she has purchased items on credit, and she has paid them off well.  Her goals are to be able to get her children ahead, and to generally give them a better quality of life.

loans.use: to stock merchandise and to have orders ready for her customers.

loans.name: San

texts.en:
Living in a wooden house in the Moung Russey district of Battambang province, San is 57 years old and married. She has five children, three of whom are dependent on her. 

The main source of her family’s income is from rice farming and vegetable planting. She has been in this business for almost 20 years. With the current business, she can earn about US $4 per day.
 
This is the second loan for San with VisionFund. She successfully used the first loan to improve her livelihood. Now she is applying for another loan which she is going to use this loan to buy fertilizers and pesticides for her farmland. She hopes to increase her crop yield and sell it for a good price so as to make a better living.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and pesticides for her farmland.

loans.name: Donabel

texts.en:
Donabel is 37 years old and lives in Mohon, Aloran, Misamis Occidental. She is married with 2 children. 
Donabel  is engaged in palay trading activity and earns approximately 5,000 PHP each month doing this type of work. She has requested a loan to be used in purchasing additional sacks of palay for resale. 
Donabel has been a member of PMPC for 2 years. In the future, Donabel hopes to expand her business.

loans.use: To purchase additional sacks of palay for resale

loans.name: Jesus

texts.en: Jesus is 53-years-old, married to a food vendor and blessed with three children. He manages a farming business, particularly rice farming.  With his two hectares farm, he has earned an amount of 120,000 PHP. His profits in this business was spent on school allowances for his son and grandchildren. Due to financial constraints, he would like to use a loan amounting to 50,000 PHP to purchase fertilizers, seedlings, and insecticides. He's hoping that his requested loan will be granted so that he can use his loan and earn more profits.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers, seedlings and insecticides.

loans.name: Kelvin Isael

texts.es:
Kelvin, se a decidido por otro crédito para poder pagar mano de obra que le ayude a recolectar la cosecha de la siembra de maíz que realizo, puesto que también de ese proceso obtendrá alimento para su ganado. Con el crédito anterior el incremento su ganadería, ha mejorado la raza, tuvo mejores ganancias, el negocio es más estable.
Kelvin tiene una mejor situación económica, ha cancelado sus deudas y por el momento no ha tenido ningún problema familiar o en el negocio que le dificulte seguir trabajando.
texts.en:
Kelvin has decided to take out another loan to be able to pay for labor to help him harvest the corn he grew. He will also obtain feed for his cattle from this process. With the previous loan, he increased the cattle he has, improving their breed. He had more profit and the business is more stable.  

Kelvin has a better financial situation. He has paid off his debts and so far has not had any family or business problem that would make it difficult to keep working.

loans.use: to pay for labor.

loans.name: María Félix

texts.es:
