María se desempeña como maestra de educación primaria en un colegio rural de la zona donde habita, es soltera, tiene una hija a la que está apoyando en sus estudios universitarios.
Actualmente está presentado la necesidad de la construcción de una cuarto para su hija ya que su vivienda solo cuenta con un cuarto donde su hija ni ella puede tener privacidad,  de esta manera  tener mejor comodidad y estabilidad familiar.  Este crédito lo utilizará para la compra de bloques, cemento y  lo que el pago de mano de obra.
Esta señora hace grandes esfuerzos para darle lo que su hija necesita, apoyándose en el mismo ya que pertenece al sector magisterial que los salarios son bajos y de esa manera mejorar las condiciones y nivel de vida.
texts.en:
María works as an elementary school teacher in a rural school in the area where she lives. She is single and has a daughter whom she is supporting in her university studies.

Right now, she needs to build a room for her daughter because her house only has one bedroom where she and her daughter can have privacy. This way, she can be more comfortable and have more family stability. She will use this loan to buy blocks and cement and to pay for labor costs. 

This woman works very hard to give her daughter what she needs and supporting herself. She is a part of the teaching profession which has low salaries. This way, she can improve her quality of life.

loans.use: to buy construction materials such as blocks and cement, and to pay for labor costs.

loans.name: María Del Socorro

texts.es:
María  , es madre  soltera, trabaja  en un instituto de la localidad desempeñándose como maestra de educación secundaria con 32 años de labora.
Actualmente esta señora esta presentando una necesidad de comprar un medicamento ya que encuentra enferma
, para poder seguir desempeñando  su labor tiene que estar en buen estado de salud, por tal motivo se presento a la oficina de ceprodel para solicitar un financiamiento ya que con este sería el numero 14 y este ultimo lo utilizaría en la compra de medicamento tales como Repostrogen 4D, Estrógenos conjugados, omepracol en   ampollas. Y le agradece y a las demás instituciones que están afiliadas con esta financiera que siempre están apoyando a las personas de bajos recursos.
texts.en: María is a single mother. She works at a local institute as a secondary school teacher with 32 years' experience. Right now, she needs to buy medication because she is ill. In order to keep doing her job, she has to be in good health. That is why she has come to the Ceprodel office to ask for a loan. This will be number 14 and this last one will be used to buy medications such as Repostrogen 4D, conjugated estrogens, and ampoules of Omeprazole. She is grateful the other institutions that are affiliated to this bank that are always helping people of low income.

loans.use: to buy medications such as: Repostrogen 4D, conjugated estrogens, and ampoules of Omeprazol.

loans.name: Valentín

texts.es:
Valentín  de 44 años de edad, se ha dedicado a la siembra de maíz desde muy pequeño; pero la necesidad lo hizo viajar a los  Estados Unidos, estuvo alrededor de 10 años trabajando, para sacar adelante a su familia.
 
 Luego se regreso a El Salvador, porque  su esposa se enfermo y no tenia quien la cuidara, por que los niños estaban pequeños, recogió dinero para mantenerse y continuar apoyando a su familia. Ese capital lo  invirtió en el negocio de compra de ganado y su posterior venta, hasta el día de hoy él sigue trabajando en el comercio de animales. Su esposa vende verduras y esto lo realizan los miércoles, que es el día de comercio del pueblo. Ellos tienen hijos uno de ellos tiene 20 años de edad, y los otro dos tienen 10 y 6 años de edad; el mayor emigro a los estados unidos a trabajar y poder ayudarle a su familia; así como lo hizo su padre.

Valentín compra y vende de ganado y cerdo, a la ves lo buscan para domar bestias mulares y caballos.

El préstamo que esta solicitando a fundación campo, es para el mantenimiento de la frijolera, que tiene sembrada que ya esta por darle los últimos mantenimientos,  para lograr tener una buena cosecha y  vender los granos.


 En el futuro, desea seguir trabajando por la oportunidad que le a brindado, la fundación campo, ya que él a sentido que en otra instituciones no trabajan con la comunidad.
texts.en:
Valentín is 44 years old. He began farming corn when he was very young. However necessity caused him to travel to the United States. He was around 10 years old and worked to help his family get ahead.

Then he returned to El Salvador because his wife became ill and he had no-one to care for her since their children were still small. He raised money to support himself and to continue supporting his family. He invested that capital in a business selling cattle and in 
later sales. Up until today he continues to work in the animal sales business. His wife sells vegetables. They make their sales on Wednesdays, which is market day in their pueblo.

The couple has children, one of whom is 20 years old, while the other two are 10 and 6 years of age. The eldest immigrated to the United States to work and to help his family, just as his father did.

Valentín buys and sells cattle and pigs. At the same time he is sought after to tame mules and horses.

The loan he is requesting from Fundación Campo is to maintain the beans he has planted and that he is now about to give final maintenance, so that he can reap and sell a good harvest.

In the future, he wants to continue working with the opportunity that Fundación Campo has provided, since he has felt that other institutions do not work with the community.

loans.use: to maintain the beans that he has planted and that now he is about to give their final maintenance.

loans.name: Minh

texts.en: Minh is a 51- year-old, married man living in Ho Chi Minh City. He has three children. His wife earns a living working for a local company. Minh runs a business that sells mattresses and camp beds, which he has done for 3 years. Minh would like to take a loan to buy a greater variety and quantity of mattresses to stock his shop. He hopes this will enable him to better meet the needs of his customers and increase the turnover of his business. He also hopes that through the loan his business will generate a higher income, and will help him to improve his family's living conditions, and enable him to set aside some savings for his children's education.

loans.use: to buy a greater variety and quantity of mattresses, to stock his shop.

loans.name: Marc Jayson

texts.en:
Marc Jayson is a third-year student at La Salle University in Ozamiz City studying for a Bachelor of Science in Business Administration, major in Operations Management. He lives in Sebasi, Clarin, Misamis Occidental with his family. His father is a farmer earning well enough for their daily living. 

Being financially unstable has never stopped Marc Jayson from dreaming. He joined GDMPC and gained access to micro-finance services specifically an education loan that support students who are qualified and want to continue their studies. For the second semester, Marc Jayson borrowed another loan to buy new textbooks , ROTC and school uniforms.  He dreams of finishing his studies and being able to work for a bright future.

loans.use: to buy new textbooks , ROTC and school uniforms.

loans.name: Be

texts.en: Be is requesting a new loan to buy a range of new products, such as travelling shampoos, snack food and beverages, to restock his general store. This purchase will help him to better meet the needs of his customers. His previous loan enabled him to improve his business and offer his customers a greater variety of products. He hopes that his new loan will assist him in adding to the size of his store and increase sales, and will also help him to improve his living conditions.

loans.use: to buy a range of new products, such as traveling shampoos, snack food and beverages, to restock his general store

loans.name: Sarah’S Group

texts.en:
Sarah's group is one of YICE’s women self-help groups in Lwamasanga village, and the group is made up of five members all coming from the same village.  Sarah (2nd from right) is the group leader.  Members of this group grow varied crops like beans, ground nuts, vegetables, Irish potatoes, sweet potatoes, cassava and onions.  They also keep local chickens.

Sarah is 36 years old and grows vegetables, sweet potatoes and cassava.  She also rears some goats.  She has been growing her crops for over the last six years but was getting low yields and income.  After acquiring better farming skills through YICE’s farming-as-business training, Sarah and her group members are applying for a loan to purchase good quality vegetable seeds and pesticides, and to pay for a laborer to clear their gardens.

Sarah believes that applying better farming practices will increase her yields and income by 80%.  She plans to use her profits to establish a goat rearing project and pay school fees for her three children.  Her dream is to support her children’s education up to the university level.

loans.use: to purchase good quality vegetable seeds and pesticides, and to pay for a laborer to clear their gardens.

loans.name: Mary’S Group

texts.en:
Mary’s group has received trainings on better farming practices through YICE’s farming as a business training program, and is one of YICE’s women self-help groups in Namuganga village.  Members of this group grow different crops like beans, maize, cassava, ground nuts and vegetables but work as a team when sowing, weeding and harvesting on their small farms.

Mary (first from left) is their group leader.  She is 30 years old, and married with four children.  She has been farming since she was 12 years old, but she believes that she has never yielded enough because she has always been using poor quality local seeds, poor farming methods and not applying any fertilizers.  

Mary asks for this loan to be able to buy good quality seeds, fertilizers and pesticides, and to access more training on better farming methods.  She believes that with this support, her yields will increase and she will be able to help her family and improve her finances.  Her future dream is to educate her children up to the university level.

loans.use: to buy good quality seeds, fertilizers and pesticides and access more training on better farming methods.

loans.name: Bezaida Margarita

texts.es: Bezaida de 46 años de edad vive en casa propia con su esposo y sus dos hijos de 14 y 9 años de edad ellos estudian actualmente, ella se dedica a la venta de frutas y verduras cerca del mercado que se encuentra por su lugar de residencia, posee mucha clientela por los buenos precios y la calidad del producto que comercializa, con lo que obtiene de su trabajo logra solventar los gastos que se le presentan en su hogar, Bezaida está solicitando un crédito para la compra de mas frutas y verduras por mayor para poder seguir con su negocio ya que esa es la única fuente de trabajo y así poder obtener mejores ganancias y darle a su familia una mejor calidad de  vida.
texts.en:
Bezaida, age 46, lives in her own house with her husband and their two children.  The children are 14 and 9, and they currently go to school.  She sells fruits and vegetables near the market by her house.  She has a lot of clientele because of the good prices and the quality of the products that she sells.  With what she gets from her work, she manages to pay the household expenses.

Bezaida is requesting a loan to buy more fruit and vegetables wholesale.  She will do this in order to be able to continue with her business because it is her only source of work.  This way she will be able to get better income and give her family a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy more fruit and vegetables wholesale.

loans.name: Yowanina’S Group

texts.en:
Yowanina (2nd from right) lives in Kyakatebe village and is a group leader of one of YICE's women self-help groups in Kyakatebe parish.  Her group consists of five members who are all female farmers but growing different crops like beans, maize, cassava, and vegetables among others.  They also rear some domestic animals like cows, pigs, and goats.

Yowanina is 45 years old, has 6 children and is a widow.  She is the household head and takes on all the responsibilities at home.  She has been a farmer for 25 years, growing similar crops season after season.  Through YICE's farming as a business program, Yowanina and her group members acquired skills in better farming practices.  They appreciate the organization's commitment to empowering vulnerable grassroots women.

Yowanina requests a loan to buy good quality seeds and fertilizers, and to hire local laborers to help her expand her garden.  She plans to use the money acquired after her harvest to pay school fees for her children and buy a cow.  Yowanina’s dream is to become a strong female farmer that supplies the community with good quality farm produce.

loans.use: to buy good quality seeds and fertilizers, and hire local laborers to help them expand their gardens

loans.name: Prossy's Group

texts.en:
Prossy’s group members have been attending YICE’s trainings on farming as business.  This group is one of YICE’s women self-help groups in Kyakatebe village.  Prossy is the leader of the group that consists of five members who all have small farming enterprises.  They grow different crops but work as a team and they help each other on their small farms.

Prossy (first from left) is 30 years old and married with five children.  She has been farming for 13 years and has never yielded enough to cater for her family's food needs.  As a result of YICE’s trainings, Prossy and her group members want to put the skills learnt into practice. 

The group asks for this loan to enable them to buy good quality seeds, fertilizers, and pesticides as well as access more training on better farming methods.  They all believe that with the support of a loan, their yields will increase and they will be able to help their families and improve their finances.  Prossy’s dream is to have enough food for her family and live a good life.

loans.use: to buy good quality seeds, fertilizers, and pesticides, and access more training on better farming methods.

loans.name: Mai

texts.en: Mai is a 35-year-old woman. She has 1 child. She lives with her family in Ho Chi Minh City. She and her husband have been running a business selling clothing and slippers for twelve years. Mai would like to take a loan to buy a greater quantity and variety of clothes to sell. She hopes this will enable her to better meet the needs of her existing customers and to attract additional customers. She also hopes that through the loan her business will generate a higher income and will help her to improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: to buy a greater quantity and variety of clothes to sell.

loans.name: Sumaira

texts.en:
Sumaira, age 37, is the mother of two children. Her husband's tailoring shop is the only source of income for the family. He has excellent tailoring skills but has only one tailoring machine. Having only one machine makes it difficult to meet the customers' needs in a timely manner. Therefore he is planning to purchase another tailoring machine and a variety of tailoring supplies including thread, needles, clothing, etc. These purchases will help him to continue working efficiently and professionally. 

However due to the lack of money, he finds it difficult to purchase the machine and supplies. Therefore his wife, Sumaira is requesting a loan from Kiva partner BRAC Pakistan with the goal of helping her husband. The loan will help her husband to purchase the needed items. Sumaira is happy that she will be able to help her husband with the loan. She prays for the success of her husband's business.

loans.use: to purchase another tailoring machine and a variety of tailoring supplies.

loans.name: Shilat’S Group

texts.en:
Members of Shilat‘s group have all attended YICE trainings in farming as a business.  These women live in the same village of Namuganga, and also joined YICE’s women self–help groups through which they have acquired better farming skills and offer each other group labor on their gardens in a rotating form.  They grow crops such as beans, ground nuts, and cow peas.  The group comprises of five members, three of which are widows, and one is divorced with two children.  The average age of the group members is 39.

Shilat (first from left) is the group leader.  She is 30 years old with two children.  Shilat is requesting a loan to purchase good quality seeds and pesticides in order to improve on the quantity and quality of her yields and her standards of living in her village.  She plans to sell what she harvests to buy scholastic materials for the family.  Her long term dream is to start up a small retail shop to supplement her income.

loans.use: to purchase good quality seeds and pesticides for their small farming enterprises

loans.name: Lovinsa’S Group

texts.en:
Lovinsa's group is made up of 5 members living in Kyakatebe.  All members of this group rear pigs and keep local chickens; they also grow different crops like beans, cassava, maize and groundnuts.  

Lovinsa (2nd from left) is the leader of the group; she is 40 years old and married with seven children.  She earns her income through the sales of pigs for meat and eggs from her chicken.  She faces a challenge of slow growth in her pigs, which she attributes to rearing local, poor breeds.  Through attending YICE’s trainings in farming as a business, Lovinsa acquired new skills to improve her piggery project.  Her group members are requesting this loan to buy exotic male piglets and good quality seeds to improve their farming enterprises. 

Lovinsa dreams of educating her children up to the university level and supporting her family to live better standards.

loans.use: to buy exotic male piglets and good quality seeds to improve their farming enterprises.

loans.name: Yen

texts.en:
Yen, a 49-year-old married mother of two, lives with her family in Ho Chi Minh City. Married to  a painter, Yen has operated a food stall selling meals to people in their community for the past eight years.

Yen is requesting a loan to purchase new furniture and good quality food ingredients in bulk to make more food to sell from her stall. She hopes this will enable her to better meet the needs of her customers and attract additional customers. 

Yen also hopes that her loan will enable her to increase her income and save money for any future difficulties facing her family.

loans.use: to purchase new furniture and food ingredients for her food stall

loans.name: Chung

texts.en: Chung, 53, is married and has two sons. She lives with her family in Ho Chi Minh City. She and her husband earn a living by operating a general store in front of their house. They started this business three years ago. Chung is requesting a loan to expand her business by buying a greater variety of products, especially food and household items, to stock her store and better satisfy her customers. She hopes her business will run smoothly and will generate a higher income.  This would raise her family's standard of living and allow her to save money for the future.

loans.use: to buy a greater variety of products especially food and household items.

loans.name: Irene's Group

texts.en:
Irene’s group consists of five members all living in Kyakatebe village.  The group members’ average age is 35 years.  Two of the group members are widows who are fully responsible for their families.  Group members grow crops of the similar kind that include beans, maize, ground nuts and tomatoes.

Irene (first from right) is the group leader.  She is 32 years old, with three children, and takes care of three relatives by paying fees for them.  She rears poultry birds for a living, and got trainings from YICE's program farming as a business. 

Irene’s group is asking for this loan to buy better quality seeds, herbicides and fertilizers to improve on their farm productivity.  In addition to this, Irene also wants to breed her chicken to get exotic chickens that would give her enough eggs and increase her income.  Her dream is to have a big poultry farm, supplying eggs to big markets in the Ugandan capital.

loans.use: to buy better quality seeds, herbicides and fertilizers to improve on their farm productivity.

loans.name: Fátima Del Rosario

texts.es:
Fátima, casada y trabaja en el Mined del municipio desempeñándose como maestra de educación primaria  con 5 años de experiencia y de profesión  Psicopedagoga.
esta señora se presento a ceprodel para ser beneficiada con un financiamiento , lo utilizara en la compra de semolina para el engorde de cerdos, ya que esta es otra forma de obtener otros ingresos a demás de su salario, ya que esto le ayuda  ha tener mayores ingresos y darle mayor estabilidad a su familia y nivel economico
texts.en:
Fátima is married, and she works for the municipal MINED [Ministry of Education] as a primary school teacher.  She has five years of experience, and she is an educational psychologist by profession.

This lady came to Ceprodel to receive the benefit of a loan.  She will use it to buy semolina to fatten the pigs.  This is another way of getting other income in addition to her salary.  This will help her to have greater income and give her family greater financial stability and a better standard of living.

loans.use: to buy semolina.

loans.name: Yida Group

texts.fr:
Mme FATIMATA est responsable du groupe YIDA. Mariée, elle est mère de 03enfants. Le plus âgé a 19ans et le moins âgé a 05ans. 03 vont à l’école. Elle a 06personnes en charge.
Mme vend des pagnes depuis 15ans. Elle s’approvisionne au marché du secteur 10 en ville. Ses clients sont les dames et hommes.
Elle veut s’acheter 09complets  pagnes.
Mme veut ouvrir un compte d’épargne avec ses bénéfices. Elle ambitionne assurer l’avenir de  ses enfants.
texts.en:
Fatimata is in charge of the Yida group. She is married and has 3 children. The oldest is 19 years old, and the youngest is 5. All three attend school. She takes care of 6 people.

Fatimata has sold pagnes [traditional wrap] for 15 years. She gets her supplies at the Sector 10 market in town. She has both male and female customers. 

She would like to buy herself 9 full lengths of pagne cloth. 

Fatimata would like to open up a savings account with her income. Her goal is to provide for her children’s futures.

loans.use: to buy 9 lengths of pagne.

loans.name: Anh

texts.en:
Anh, 51, is married and has two children. She lives with her family in Ho Chi Minh City. Her husband earns an income as a goods delivery man. 

Anh started the business of selling pork pies 18 years ago. She is requesting a loan to expand her business by buying better ingredients to make a greater quantity and variety of pork pies to sell at her shop, and better satisfy her customers. 

She hopes her business runs smoothly and will generate a higher income to assist her in improving her family's living conditions.

loans.use: To buy ingredients to make pork pies to sell

loans.name: Scovia's Group

texts.en:
Scovia's group is comprised of five women, two of which are widows.  The group member’s average age is 40 years.  All group members live in Kyakatebe, and they are active members of YICE’s women self-help groups.  All members in this group are small scale farmers, growing vegetables like tomatoes, eggplants, onions and green peppers which they sell in their village market.

Scovia (2nd from left) is 41 years old and she has been this group leader for the last eight months.  She earns her income through the sale of vegetables although she believes that she gets less than what she expects due to low and poor quality yields.

Scovia’s group members attend YICE’s trainings in farming-as-business and have acquired better farming skills so that with good quality seeds and fertilizers, their farm yields will increase.  Scovia asks for a loan to buy good quality vegetable seeds and fertilizers, and also to access more training on vegetable and other crop production to increase her yields and income so she can take good care of her family.  She dreams of becoming a model farmer for vegetable growing in her village and to the whole community, and has a vision of training other women in the future.

loans.use: to buy good quality vegetable seeds and fertilizers and also to access more training on vegetable and other crop farming

loans.name: Wendtongo Group

texts.fr:
Mme SOLANGE est responsable du groupe WENDTONGO. Mariée, elle est mère de 02enfants. Le plus âgé a 12ans et le moins âgé a 04ans. 02 vont à l’école. Elle a 04personnes en charge.
Mme fait la couture depuis 07ans. Elle s’approvisionne dans le marché de son quartier. Ses clients sont mixte (homme et dame).
Elle veut s’acheter 01 nouvelle machine à coudre.
Mme veut économiser ses bénéfices afin de pouvoir acquérir une autre machine à broder. Elle ambitionne assurer la scolarité de ses enfants.
texts.en:
Solange is in charge of the Wendtongo group. She is married and has 2 children. The oldest is 12 years old, and the youngest is 4. Both of them are going to school. She takes care of 4 people.

Solange has been making clothing for 7 years. She gets her supplies at the market in her neighborhood. She has both male and female customers.

She would like to buy herself 1 new sewing machine. 

Solange would like to save up her income in order to buy another embroidery machine. Her goal is to provide for her children’s schooling.

loans.use: to buy one new sewing machine.

loans.name: Jose

texts.en:
Jose is a 58-year-old farmer from Tipan, Oroquieta City. Through farming, he generates income and provides his family’s needs. Aside from his rice field, he also has a garden that contains various vegetables in his vacant lot, as his fun time activity.


In addition to that, Jose has been a member of Paglaum MPC for two years. He asked the organization for help; they extend their help to him to have additional capital for his farm to purchase farming stock like fertilizers.

loans.use: to purchase farming stock, such as fertilizers.

loans.name: Tien

texts.en:
Tien, 26, lives in a small house in Ho Chi Minh City with her family, including two children and her husband. Tien earns money through their business, selling slippers. 


Tien is sometimes unable to provide the volume of slippers required by her customers. Consequently, she would like to get a loan to buy a larger stock of slippers to meet her customers' needs. 

She also hopes her business will ensure that her family members, and especially her children, will have a better education and a better future.

loans.use: to buy a larger stock of slippers to meet her customers' needs.

loans.name: Pokobila's Group

texts.fr:
Mme POKOBILA est responsable du groupe. Mariée, elle est mère de 06enfants. Le plus âgé a 23ans et le moins âgé a 08ans. 06 vont à l’école. Elle a 08personnes en charge.
Mme est Gérante de buvette depuis 10ans. Elle s’approvisionne dans des caves en ville. Ses clients sont les hommes, les femmes et les jeunes.
Elle veut s’acheter 08caisses de bière et 01caisse de sucrerie.
Mme veut ouvrir un compte d’épargne avec ses bénéfices. Elle ambitionne agrandir sa buvette et assurer la scolarité de ses enfants.
texts.en:
Pokobila is in charge of the group. She is married and has 6 children. The oldest is 23 years old, and the youngest is 8. All 6 are attending school. She provides for 8 people.

Pokobila has managed a refreshment stall for 10 years. She gets her supplies from cellars in town. Her customers include men, women and young people.

She would like to buy 8 cases of beer and 1 case of sweetened beverages.

Pokobila wants to open up a savings account with her profits. Her goal is to expand her refreshment stall and to be able to provide for her children’s schooling.

loans.use: to buy 8 cases of beer and 1 case of sweetened beverages.

loans.name: Karla Patricia

texts.es: Karla es originaria de la ciudad de Ocotal, de 34 años de edad, casada y madre de dos hijos. Es de oficio profesional en contaduría pública, se dedica a la contabilidad. Su esposo la apoya económicamente en todo, lo que le ha permitido salir adelante. Su meta próxima es alquilar cuartos. Solicita el crédito para mejorar las condiciones de saneamientos en su vivienda, con el fin de asegurar un entorno más seguro e higiénico. Estima que le crédito será beneficioso ya que podrá renovar la vivienda y brindarle un mejor hogar a su familia. Su plan futuro es culminar la construcción de su vivienda.
texts.en:
Karla is from the city of Ocotal, Nicaragua, 34 years old, married, and the mother of two children. She has a professional career in public accounting and works as an accountant. Karla's husband is her full economic partner as well as her spouse, which has allowed the couple to get ahead. 

Karla's immediate goal is to rent rooms in their home. Karla is applying for a loan to improve sanitation in her home so that she can ensure that it is safer and healthier. Karla believes that the loan will benefit her as she'll be able to renovate her home and provide her family better living conditions. Karla's plan for future is to complete construction of her home.

loans.use: to improve sanitation in her home

loans.name: Rita

texts.en:
Rita, a married mother of three grown children, lives in Loboc, Bohol where she has been engaged in a piggery business for eight years now. It is quite a challenge for her to maintain her business since she has to wait for three to four months to sell her hogs. 

Rita is requesting a loan to buy feed to fatten her hogs as well as more piglets to raise. With this loan, she will be able to focus on looking after her hogs without worrying about the feed needed. In the future, Rita hopes to expand her business and become a successful businesswoman.

loans.use: to buy feed and piglets.

loans.name: Turikumwe Ii Group

texts.fr:
Firmin fait partie du groupe  Turikumwe et  habite à Bujumbura. Il a 38 et est marié à Béatrice. Ensemble ils ont 3 enfants  âgés de 2 à 12 ans, tous étudient.

Il fait le commerce de chèvres  depuis  2 ans. 

C’est son premier  crédit à Turame. Avec le crédit KIVA qu’il obtient, il  va  augmenter son capital et acheter beaucoup de chèvres à revendre pour gagner plus. 

Dans les prochaines  années, il  voudrait acheter une parcelle, y construire une maison,  et voir ses enfants étudier.
texts.en:
Firmin is a member of the Turikumwe group and lives in Bujumbura. He is 38 years old and married to Béatrice. They have 3 children between the ages of 2 and 12 years old, all of whom attend school.

He has been selling goats for 2 years. 

This is his first loan through Turame. With his loan from Kiva, he will increase his capital and buy a lot of goats to re-sell and earn more money. 

In the coming years, he would like to buy a parcel of land, build a house on it, and see his children get an education.

loans.use: to increase his capital and buy a lot of goats to re-sell in order to earn more money.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy construction material like zinc sheeting, wooden beams, bricks, cement, sand, gravel and re-bar.

loans.name: Ruth

texts.en:
Ruth is 55 years old and lives in Patawag, Labason, Zamboanga del Norte. She is married with six children. Ruth operates her sari-sari (variety) store to earn a living and has had this business for five years. Each month, she earns 5,000 PHP doing this type of work. 

Ruth has requested a loan of 3,000 PHP for additional capital to buy more products to add to her inventory to sell. Ruth is a new member of PMPC joining in 2013. In the future, she hopes to expand her store.

loans.use: buy more products to add to her inventory to sell

loans.name: Nestor

texts.en:
Nestor is 56 years old, married and has two children. He is a farmer who plants and harvests rice to sell. He has been in the farming business for almost 20 years. His wife is a vendor. 

Nestor wanted to improve his farming business but had insufficient funds. That's why he is borrowing a loan of PHP 45,000 to buy fertilizers and pesticides used in farming. The additional revenue gained will be invested in his children's education and farming maintenance.

Someday, Nestor would like to become a productive farmer and achieve better crop production.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and pesticides used in farming

loans.name: Mukhtara

texts.en:
Mukhtara is a 40-year-old married woman. Her husband is a driver, and his income is not enough to meet their household expenditure. So a few years ago, Mukhtara started a general store to support her family. Her husband also assists her by purchasing stocks of goods from the market, as he has maintained many contacts for years. 

Mukhtara is the mother of five children and is motivated to provide her family with good quality food, clothing and health. She wants to grow her business, so she has requested a loan from Kiva's field partner, BRAC Pakistan, to buy packs of sugar, oil and grains to meet the increasing demand at her store. She is expecting a boost in her earnings and dreams of expanding her business in the future.

loans.use: To buy packs of sugar, oil and grains to sell in her general store.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy construction material like zinc sheeting, wood beams, cement, sand, gravel and tiles.

loans.name: Elias

texts.en: Elias joined GDMPC in 2012. He gained access to micro finance and it helped him to improve his ability to engage in his business. To make a living, he manages his own rice farm and earns a good living. He borrowed a loan from GDMPC micro credit to purchase fertilizer in order to improve his farm. Elias is thankful to GDMPC for helping him become successful on his farm. In the future, Elias wants to have another plot of farmland to expand his rice fields.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer

location.town: Sto. Niño, Tukuran, Zamboanga del Sur

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy 8 bags of cement, 5 sheets of zinc, 200 blocks, and a quintal (about 100 lbs) of iron
